De extraccio de sancguisugua annexsa al golayro.	On the removal of a bloodsucker attached to the throat. (Note: "Sangüisuga" is an old word for a leech or other type of parasite that feeds on blood, and "annexa" means "attached.")
Quan es medicada sanguisugua am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la curacio am medicinas e no comfereys, considera lahoras en le guolayro del malaute al solelh, pus que tu aias compremuda la lengua de lu am instrument le qual a tu havem recomtat.	When a bloodsucker is treated with what we have discussed in the section on medical treatment and not by means of cupping glasses, look carefully at the patient's throat and press the tongue forward with an instrument that I have recommended to you.
Donc si tu vezes la sancguisugua, extratz aquela am onci petit o am gesti subtils decentment.	Therefore, if you see the bloodsucker, extract it gently with a pair of tweezers or some other delicate instrument.
E si no es a tu possible estrayre am aquel, lahoras pren una canula concava e entromet aquela en lo guolayro del malaute, e aprop pausa en la concavitat de la canula un ferr ignit, e fay aquo tantas vetz (entro que la sancguisugua sia morta e se osta del guolayro) e abstengua se le malaute tot lo jorn de aygua.	And if you are unable to extract it with the tweezers, then take a concave cannula and insert it into the patient's throat, place a heated iron in the concavity of the cannula, do this several times (until the bloodsucker is dead and detaches from the throat) and ensure that the patient abstains from water for the entire day.
E aprop prengua una veyria plena de aygua frega, e obra la boca de lu en aquela, e lava la boca am aquela; e no trasglucia de aquela alcuna causa e maugua l’aygua una hora aprop autra am la sua ma, quar la sancguisugua tantost cum sent l’aygua catz.	And then take a horn full of water and rinse the mouth with it, and have the patient drink some of that water and keep it in their mouth for an hour or two without swallowing, because as soon as the bloodsucker feels the water it will come out on its own.
Mays si no es foro-getada am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras subfumigua le malaute am cimetz o am assafetida per le instrument le qual havem recomtat en la sufumiguacio de uvula.	But if it is not expelled by the methods we have recommended, then fumigate the patient with cumin or asafoetida using the instrument that we have recommended in the section on fumigation of the uvula.
Fay aquo, so en quar cayra.	Do it in this way, four times. (Note: "Cayra" is an old word for "time.")
E es un’autra manieyra de operacio en sufumiguacio de aquela, es que tu prenguas una ola en la qual sian carbos ignitz e la ola sia cuberta am una cobertora en le mieg de la qual sia un trauc, e sia compausat en aquel trauc la extremitat del instrument; e aprop dega desus la subfumigacio; e pause le malaute la sua boca en la extremitat de la canula, e claugua la sua boca per que la subfumiguacio no sia foro-getada entro que sapias que la subfumigacio es pervenguda a la sancguisugua, quar la sancguisugua tantost cayra.	Here is another method of operation in fumigation of the bloodsucker: take a pot with burning coals inside and cover it with a cloth, and place a hole in the middle of the cloth where the end of the instrument can be inserted; then perform the fumigation from above; and place the patient's mouth over the end of the cannula and close their lips so that the fumigation is not lost before you are sure that it has reached the bloodsucker, because as soon as the bloodsucker feels the fumigation it will come out.
E si no catz, lahoras tu itera la subfumiguacio motas vetz, e abstengua le malaute de beure, e mange causas saladas e alhs, e no begua aygua, e ayssi necessari es que am aquest regiment sia fora-getada.	And if it does not come out, then you should repeat the fumigation many times and ensure that the patient abstains from drinking water, eats salty foods and garlic, and avoids water completely. This is necessary to ensure that the bloodsucker is expelled.
E aquesta es la forma del instrument am le qual es trayta sancguisugua del guolayro quan es vista; e es semblant a forceps ayssi cum vezes, sino quar es en lu alcuna curvitat:	And this is the shape of the instrument used to treat bloodsuckers in the throat when they are visible; it resembles tweezers but has a slight curve. (Note: The sentence describes the shape of an instrument used for removing bloodsuckers from the throat, which should have a slight curve.)
le qual sia mesa al guolayro, e la extremitat de lu es semblant a bec de ciconia, que es guanta, en la qual es aspretat de lima, per so quar, quan comprem alcuna causa, aquela no leyssa.	and place it in the throat, with its tip resembling the beak of a stork, which is curved and sharpened with a file, so that when compressing any object, it does not slip away.
Capitol .xl.	Chapter 40. (Note: As mentioned earlier, chapters were often numbered using Roman numerals in medieval manuscripts)
En le qual es la suma del sermo en apercio de apostemas e en seccio de lor.	In which is the summary of the discourse on abscesses and their classification. (Note: "Apercio" means overview or summary, and "apostemas" refers to abscesses)
Les apostemas so motas specias, de motas manieyras, segon que ve rememoracio de lor, de quascuna en aquest libre.	Abscesses are of many types and kinds, as will be remembered from the descriptions in this book. (Note: The sentence acknowledges that there are many different types of abscesses, each with its own characteristics.)
E so diversas en perforacio e seccio de lor per doas manieyras, de las quals la una es per la specia de apostemas en si meteys; e per aquo que comprem de las humiditatz.	And they are differentiated by penetration and section in two ways: one is according to the type of abscess, and the other is due to their moisture content. (Note: The sentence suggests that abscesses can be classified based on their type and moisture content.)
E la segonda manieyra es prop les locs en les quals accideys del cos, quar le apostema accident en le cap es autra de la apostema accident en le cul; e le apostema en le loc carnos accident es autra del apostema accident en junctura; e a quascun de lor es son juguament per operacio.	And the second way is based on the location in which they occur, as an abscess that occurs in the head is different from one that occurs in the buttocks, and an abscess that occurs in a fleshy area is different from one that occurs at a joint; each requires its own treatment.
E mays de apostemas so alcunas las quals cove que no sian perforadas sino aprop maturacio de la sania en aquels o compliment de lor.	And some abscesses must not be pierced until the pus in them has matured or their development is complete.
So autras apostemas les quals cove que sian traucatz quan son cruzes, e no son maturatz segon lor compliment, ayssi cum apostemas que son propdas a las juncturas, quar apostema quan ve prop junctura, lo esser de lu es prolonguat entro que·s poyreys aquo que es en le circuit de lu, e fort leu son corromputz les liamentz o les nervis de aquela junctura, per que es fayta causa de contraccio de aquel membre; o es apostema prop de membre principal, e si tu tardas la perforacio de lu entro sia madurat nosira al membre principal; o es prop le cul, donc perfora aque no-madurat; e no cove que·l perforas cru, de no-complida degestio, sino aquel que es prop del cul, per so que no poyresca le preon de lu e sia elonguat a las partidas dedintz del cul, e sia fayta fistula, o que sia fayt en le terme de lu que no sia sanat.	Some abscesses need to be pierced when they are still fresh and not yet mature, such as those that occur near joints or the groin area. When an abscess is located near a joint, its development takes longer because it spreads in the surrounding tissue, which can cause damage to the ligaments or nerves of that joint, leading to contraction of the limb. If the abscess is near the main part of the body, it is essential not to delay piercing it until it matures, as this may lead to injury to the main organ. Similarly, an abscess located in the buttocks should be pierced before it matures to avoid damage to the surrounding tissue and prevent the formation of a fistula or an unhealed wound. However, it is not necessary to make a large incision; instead, a small opening can be made to allow the pus to drain out.
Mays cove que tu sapias la hora de la perforacio de la apostema, e aysso es quan es maturat.	However, it is important to know the right time for piercing an abscess, and that is when it has matured.
E sapias que es madurat quan es la cedacio de la dolor e la cessacio de la febre, e aprop la diminucio de la rogor e de la pulsacio, e la acuitat del cap del apostema, e les autres senhals.	And know that an abscess is mature when the pain and fever have subsided, as well as the inflammation and pulse rate, and the swelling at the tip of the abscess has become soft and there are signs of pus formation. (Note: The sentence lists some of the indications that an abscess has matured and is ready to be pierced.)
E quar cove que sapias la perforacio cazer en le loc pus dejos del apostema e de pus venient de curacio de la eminencia.	It is important to know that the incision should be made in a location below the abscess, where the pus will flow from the cure of the elevation. (Note: The sentence advises that the incision for piercing an abscess should be made in a location below it, allowing the pus to flow out freely and prevent further spread of infection.)
E perforacio tostemps sia per le lonc de la carn o del cors, si las apostemas son en las partidas de las mas o dels pes, e en loc dels lacertz, de las cordas dels nervis, de las arcerias; e, al derier, en totz locs enguals en les quals no es reflecio; quar en aquels que so reflectitz, usa de perforacio segon aquel membre.	And the incision should always be made in the direction of the flesh or body, even if the abscesses are on the sides of the hands or feet, and on the ligaments, nerves, and arteries; and finally, in all places where there is no danger of reflection. For in those that reflect, use incision according to the member.
Mays quan le apostema es en loc carnos, lahoras miels es que leysses la perforacio de lu entro que sia confermada la digestio de lu segon compliment, ayssi quo havem dit; quar si tu perforas aquel denant aquo, es prolonguat le cors del poyre de lu e de mota sordicia, e fort leu las labias de lu so enduradas e la profunditat de lu.	However, when the abscess is located in a fleshy area, it is better to wait until the digestion of the abscess has been confirmed before making an incision, as I have said. This is because if you pierce it before then, the contents will spill out and mix with the surrounding tissue, causing further inflammation and making the wound more difficult to heal. By waiting until the abscess has fully matured, the risk of complications is reduced and healing is facilitated.
Mays alcus apostemas so perforatz segon la latitut de la carn o del cos deves la necessitat, o segon aquo del qual lo membre indigeys.	However, some abscesses must be pierced according to the width of the flesh or body depending on necessity, or according to what the member requires.
E cove que administres petita perforacio , e·n les apostemas grans gran perforacio e ampla o motas seccios segon la diversitat de la grandesa dels apostemas.	It is important to make a small incision in small abscesses and a larger one in large abscesses, with multiple sections if necessary according to the diversity of their size. (Note: The sentence emphasizes that the size of the incision should be proportional to the size of the abscess.)
E autras so dels apostemas en les quals cove que la codena sia conquavada e sia encidida, quan es fayta ayssi quo pan e fayta es en terme que ja stigua, ayssi cum aquel que accideys en trops de dubelec e de bubos.	And other abscesses require that the skin be excised and turned inside out, when it is necessary to make a cavity as in cases of tuberculosis and scrofula. (Note: The sentence refers to certain types of abscesses that require more extensive surgical intervention, such as excision of the affected area and creation of a cavity or wound.)
E de aquels so que so insciditz am seccio havent tres angles; e de aquels es en le qual es inscidit ayssi cum figura de fuelha de mirtra, ayssi cum las apostemas dels angonars.	And of those that are incised with a section having three angles, there is one in which it is incised as the shape of a myrtle leaf, such as abscesses of hernias. (Note: The sentence describes two different types of incisions used to treat abscesses, depending on their size and location. In some cases, a triangular incision may be made, while in others a curved or myrtle-leaf shaped incision may be more appropriate.)
E de lor so en les quals es administrada seccio redonda e seccio lunar, e semblantz ad aquels.	And of them are those in which a round section or crescent-shaped incision is made, similar to these. (Note: The sentence describes two more types of incisions used to treat abscesses, depending on their shape and location. A round incision may be appropriate for small, shallow abscesses, while a crescent-shaped incision may be used for larger or deeper ones.)
Mays aquel al qual no es cap ayssi cum son apostemas leons superficials, cove que tu perforas aquel am perforacio superficial, o plana tant solament.	But if it is not like those deep-seated abscesses that require a more extensive incision, then a superficial or shallow puncture may be sufficient. (Note: The sentence suggests that in some cases, a simple incision or puncture may be all that is needed to treat an abscess.)
E cove quant le apostema es gros e ya ha colligit mota sania, que perfores aquel e no te coytes que extraguas tot le poyre en aquela hora; habantz extratz de aquel una partida, e aprop opila le apostema entro al autre dia, e aprop extratz una partida major, e aprop fa aquo motas veguadas segon graduacio entro que sia foro-getat.	And it is important to note that when the abscess is large and has accumulated a lot of pus, you should make an incision in it but do not be hasty to drain all of the pus at once; instead, remove only a portion of it and then pack the wound with sterile gauze or bandages. Repeat this process daily until the entire abscess has been drained. (Note: This approach allows for controlled drainage of the abscess over several days, reducing the risk of infection and promoting optimal healing.)
E majorment si·l malaute es de freol vertut, o femna prens, o enfant petit, o viel en decrepitut, quar l’esperit animal motas vetz es resolvut am la egressio de la sania, e fort leu mor le malaute, e tu operte les.	And especially if the patient is of frail constitution, or a woman in labor, or a small child, or an elderly person in decrepitude, since the animal spirit often becomes weakened with the expulsion of blood, and the patient can quickly die, and you should open the veins.
Don guarda aquest capitol am gran cautela, e aprop la tua perforacio en la qual perforas aquestz apostemas, cove que abstergescas las plagues e consideras donc si la plagua del apostema es pauca, o es una seccio plana, lahoras tu aministra las qualguas de li o de coto antic; e si le apostema es gran, e las fissuras de la perforacio son motas, lahoras cove que tu pauses meca en quascun trauc entro que pervenguan ensemps.	Observe this chapter with great caution, and direct your incision in the place where you lance these abscesses; it is necessary that you clean the wounds and consider whether the abscess has a small opening or is a wide incision; therefore, you should apply some of the medicines of honey or vinegar; and if the abscess is large, and the slits of the incision are many, then it is necessary for you to place a wick in each hole so that they can drain together.
E si en le apostema es abscindit una partida de la codena o has concavada aquela en le circuit, lahoras cove que tu la complescas de coto viel o de fil fayt de drap de li, ayssi cum quan has traytz pans o razizos, ses humiditat; e strenh aquel entro al tertz dia; e aprop proceseys aquel e cura le am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if part of the colon is cut off in the abscess or has become concave in its circumference, then it is necessary for you to compress it with old linen or a thread made of wool cloth, just as when you bandage wounds or cuts, without moisture; and strengthen that within the third day; and then treat and care for it with appropriate ointments until it heals.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc en la hora de la operacio tua, lahoras tu aministra aygua frega e vi agre en les quals mules un drap de li, e pausa aquel sobre le loc del fluxs del sanc motas veguadas.	But if you encounter bleeding during your operation, then apply a cloth soaked in wine and water, which should be wrung out, over the site of the blood flow, as many times as necessary.
Mays si persevera le fluxs del sanc, lahoras cove que tu aministres regiment e curacio e polveras las quals he recomtadas en motz locs de aquest nostre libre e de divisio.	But if the bleeding persists, then it is necessary for you to provide treatment and care and use powders that I have recommended in many places of this our book and division.
Mays si es en temps de hivern, e·l loc de la apostema es loc de motz nervis, lahoras cove que tu enfundas pulvils en vi e oli caut, e pauses aquels sobre les locs.	But if it is winter and the location of the abscess is a place with many nerves, then it is necessary for you to apply poultices made of wine and warm oil over those areas.
E si es en estiu, e les locs son carnoses, lahoras cove que tu pauses pulvils enbeguts am aygua e oli o am vi e oli, e tot aquo sia freg entro que sia le ters dia, ayssi cum havem dit, e lahoras cove que tu deslies le apostema e abstergescas aquel e aministres en la curacio de lu aquo que a lu conveneys entro que sia sanat.	And if it is summer and the location is fleshy, then it is necessary for you to apply poultices made of water and oil or wine and oil, and everything should be applied until the third day, as we have said; and then it is necessary for you to open the abscess, clean it, and provide treatment for healing until it heals.
E aysso es aquo que es necessari de la cognicio de la curacio de apostemas universalment, mays segon la via de distinccio ja he dit de tot apostema en qual manieyra es via de la cura de lu per capitols singularment.	And this is what is necessary for the understanding of the treatment of abscesses in general; but according to the method of distinction, I have already discussed each type of abscess and its specific method of healing in separate chapters.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter 41.
De seccio de apostemas les quals veno en la codena del cap.	Chapter 41: On Incisions for Abscesses that Occur in the Scalp.
En la codena del cap petitz apostemas, e so de specias de nodes les quals conteno tunicas que so a lor factz ; e las specias de lor so motas.	In the scalp, small abscesses occur that are of the nature of nodes and contain tunics in their formation; and there are many types of these.
E de lor son pingas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditat semblant a lima.	And from them come pustules, and some contain moisture similar to lime.
E de aquelas so las quals conteno humiditat semblant a pols, et asemblantz a lor; e de aquelas so que son lapideas, durs.	And there are those that contain moisture similar to sand and resemble it; and there are those that are stony, hard.
E en la seccio de totz, e en la extraccio de aquels no es temor, cum deves la exteccio de aquels no fa contrariat arceria.	And in the incision and removal of all of these, there is no fear, as long as you avoid doing it too forcefully.
E la operacio en seccio de aquels es que tu esproes aquels am instrument la forma del qual ve aprop aysso, le qual es apelat entromes, entro que sapias que contengua.	And the operation in incising these is that you probe them with an instrument called a trocar, which has a shape appropriate for this, until you are certain of what they contain.
Quar si aquo que conte es humiditat, lahoras scindeys aquel am seccio segon la longitut per seccio superficial segon aquesta forma:	Because if it contains moisture, then you should cut it open with an incision in the shape of a surface slit, according to this form.
E comensa en la seccio de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G. Donc cum la humiditat es evacuada, lahoras tu excoria aquela pel que conte aquela humiditat, e no leysses de aquela alcuna causa de tot, quar tropas veguadas retorna, si roman de aquela alcuna causa.	Begin the incision on the line of B going toward the line of G. Once the moisture has been evacuated, then you should excise the area that contained it, leaving no residue at all; for if any residue remains, it may cause further abscesses to form.
E aprop submergeys coto en enguent egipciach, si es present, e sino, en aygua e sal; e umpleys am aquel la plagua e layssa aquel entro ad autra dia, quar am aquo corrodeys tot so que es romas de aquela pellicula.	Then submerge the area in Egyptian ointment if it is available, and if not, in water and salt; and fill the wound with this substance, leaving it for another day, as it will dissolve all that remains of the membrane.
E aprop itera sobre aquel coto am enguent egipciach segondament e tersament si indigeyses de lu, entro que·t comfides que no y haia romas alcuna causa de aquela pellicula; lahoras cura la plagua am enguent entro que sia sanada.	Then apply a second and third layer of Egyptian ointment to the area as needed, until you are confident that there is no residue left from the membrane; after this, care for the wound with an ointment until it heals.
E si apostema conte nodi gras, lahoras tu inscideys aquel segon aquesta forma:	And if the abscess contains fatty nodes, then you should make an incision according to this form:
am seccio havent forma de crotz, e geta oncis entre doas labias de la seccio e scorsa aquel de tota partida, e esforsa la tua vertut en extraccio de la tunica la qual conte aquel.	Having made an incision in the shape of a cross, you should then cut between the two lips of the incision and remove all parts of it; and exert your strength in extracting the membrane that contains it.
Mays si a tu arceria fa contrarieta, lahoras fay aquo que yeu t’e recontat primieyrament.	But if you encounter resistance, then do what I have told you to do first (i.e., make an incision along the length of the abscess and excise the area that contained it).
E semblantment fay en le apostema lapificat de seccio e de curacio segon que a tu havem dit; e seccio sobre apostema lapificat es pus leugiera, quar es de pauc sanc e de pauca humiditat.	And similarly, proceed with the incision and treatment of the stony abscess as I have told you; and incising over a stony abscess is easier because it contains little blood and moisture.
E alcunas vetz so alcus de aquestz apostemas les quals so en le cap en alcus homes am los quals de tot no es humiditat; la qual causa es quar yeu inscindigui sobre un apostema en le cap de una femna vielha e atrobegui le apostema ayssi cum peyra sorda, aspra, blanqua, la qual no podia esser trinquada, e si a alcu fos am aquela percussit, plaguera aquel.	Sometimes the abscesses in the scalp of some men contain no moisture at all; this is due to the fact that it cannot be incised on because there is no humidity present. This is similar to what happened when I attempted to make an incision on the abscess of an old woman's head, and found it to be as hard as a stone, rough, white, and unyielding; if anyone were to strike against such a growth, they would cause harm to themselves.
Mays en les autres apostemas accidentz en le cap otra aquest no es aquest capitol, ayssi cum les apostemas que veno als caps dels enfantz e deves las razitz de las aurelhas, mays la seccio de aquestz totz sia seccio superficial.	But in the other types of abscesses that occur on the head, such as those that appear on children's heads and must be cut along their ear rims, the incision for these should be made using surface cuts.
E pausa la perforacio de aquels de la partida pus bassa de lor per so que sia alleujat le cos de la sania a las partidas pus bassas.	And position the puncture holes of these in the lower area, to help relieve the body of blood and moisture in the lower areas.
E aprop cura aquelas am aquo que conveneys ad aquel de curacio.	And then care for these wounds with what is appropriate for their healing.
Capitol .xlii.	Chapter 42.
De seccio de scrophulas las quals accideyso en le col.	Chapter 42: On Incisions for Scrofula That Occur on the Neck.
Motas veguadas endeveno aquestas apostemas en le colh e en las aysselhas e en les angonars; e alcunas veguadas accideyso en las autras partidas del cos.	These abscesses often occur in the neck, armpits, and groins, but they can also appear in other areas of the body.
E so aquelas que accideysso en le colh, e so motas que so engendradas entre lor, e tota scrofula de aquelas es dintz la sua tunica propria, e ayssi cum en les nodis e apostema del cap, ayssi cum havem recomtat.	And those that occur in the neck are often generated between them, and all scrofulous growths of this type are within their own membrane, just as with nodes and abscesses on the head, as we have previously discussed.
E las specias de aquestas scrophulas son motas, quar de aquelas so alcunas lapideas, e de aquelas so que conteno humiditatz, e de aquelas so malignas las quals no obeseysso a curacio.	And the types of scrofula are numerous, as some are stony and hard, others contain moisture, and still others are malignant and do not respond to treatment.
Donc en aquela la qual tu vezes de bona disposicio en le Tocament, de la qual la color de aquo que es manifest es propda a la color de la codena, e es mauguda a tota partida, e no es annexsa am le nervi del colh, ni am las venas, ni am la arceria, e no es preonda, cove que tu inscidiscas aquela am siccio superficial de la partida desus a la partida dejos del cos de la linha de .G. entro la linha de .B., e scorja aquela de tota partida, e exten dos labias de la codena am onci, o am motz oncis si has necessitat de aquels, ayssi cum havem dit en las apostemas del cap, e extratz aquela petit a petit.	Therefore, for the type of scrofula that you judge to be in good condition and whose visible color is similar to the color of the scalp, and it is soft everywhere, and not attached to the neck nerves, veins, or arteries, and is not bulging, then you should make a dry surface incision from the upper part of the body to the lower part along the line between G and B, as we have discussed for abscesses on the head. Then excise all parts of it, and separate the skin of the neck with an ounce or more if necessary, as we have described before. And then extract it bit by bit.
E es mays cautela que no sia inscidida la vena o nervi.	It is important to be careful not to cut the vein or nerves. (Note: This sentence appears to summarize and reinforce the previous passage's caution against cutting into the neck's nerves, veins, or arteries.)
E sia le spatum no mot agut, que no ajuste a tu la tua ma am inscizio, o que enquiete le malaute, e que inscidas aquo que no es necessari inscidir; quar si inscideysses vena o arceria e prohibeys tu de la tua operacio, lahoras pausa en la plagua vetriol trissat o autras polveras las quals ostan fluxs de sanc, e estrenh la plagua, e layssa aquel entro que·s repausa la acuitat de la apostema e sia mollificada la plagua e comense esser poyrida.	It is necessary that the scalpel not be too sharp or unsettling to the patient, and that it only cuts what needs to be cut; for if you were to cut a vein or artery, this would prevent you from continuing your operation. In such cases, apply vinegar or other powders that can stop the bleeding and strengthen the wound, allowing the swelling of the abscess to subside and the wound to become softer and begin to turn black.
Quan le sanc es abscindit.	When blood has been cut (or "when the cutting of blood occurs") or when bleeding starts during surgery, it is important to apply pressure or a styptic agent to stop the bleeding and prevent further damage. This can be done using a variety of methods, such as cauterization, ligation, or the application of hemostatic agents. In this context, vinegar or other powdered substances may have been used for their styptic properties, which help to contract blood vessels and promote clotting.
Donc retorna a la tua operacio entro que l’aias complida.	Therefore, return to your operation until you have completed it. (Note: This sentence summarizes the previous discussion and emphasizes the importance of continuing with the medical procedure.)
E aprop inquireys am le tieu dit indic si es romas alcuna causa de las autras petitas scrophulas, donc inscideys aquelas e munda aquelas.	And then inquire with your skilled touch if there is any residue from other small scrofula growths, and if so, cut into those and clean them out. (Note: The word "teiu" means "skilled" or "expert". Here it refers to the sense of touch used in medical examination.)
E si es en la razit de la scrophula gran vena, cove lahoras que no inscidas aquela scrophula de la sua razitz.	And if it is on the edge of a large vein, then it is necessary not to cut into that scrofula at its edges.
Abantz cove que lies aquela am fiel doblat fort e que leysses aquela entro que caia per si ses nocument.	Before, take a piece of folded cloth soaked in strong bile and leave it inside so that it can fall out by itself and cause no harm.
E aprop omple la plagua de coto vielh le qual tu has ja submirgit en enguent egipciac, e aprop cura aquel.	Then fill the wound with old goat's dung, which you have previously soaked in Egyptian ointment, and heal it.
E si inscides aquela scrophula tota, lahoras cove que tu ajustes las doas labias de la plagua e cuzas2 tantost pus que no y ha romasa deguna superfluitat.	And if you find that the entire scrofulous sore is infiltrated, then it is necessary to bring together the two sides of the wound and quickly sew it up so that no excess fluid remains.
Mays si tu vezes que haia romasa superfluitat per la grandeza de la scrofula, cove que tu entendas a inscidir la razit de aquela, e astrayra aquela e aministra sutura e aquo que es dit.	But if you see that there is excess fluid due to the size of the scrofulous sore, then it is necessary to consider incising the edge of it and draining that fluid away before administering stitches as previously described.
E aquela de las scrophulas que conteno humiditatz, perfora aquela am perforacio superficial aqui la on appar a tu le loc de maturacio de lu, e pausa perforacio de aquo que siec le pus bas del cos, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for scrofulous sores containing moisture, make a superficial incision at the place where you see signs of maturation, and then place the incision at the lowest point of the body as we have said before.
E aprop aministra perforacio, calguas am enguent e semblantz ad aquels, per so que corroda aquo que es romas de la corropcio.	Then administer incisions, using cauterization and similar substances to eat away at what has been opened due to corruption.
E aprop quan tu vezes la plagua ja esser mundada, lahoras tu cura aquela am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanada.	Then when you see the wound is already cleaned out, heal it with flesh-generating ointment until it heals completely.
Capitol .xliii.	Chapter XLIII.
De seccio del pilhot del apostema accident dintz le guolayro.	Of the sectioning of the head of the abscess located within the groin area.
Diyssero les antics aquesta seccio en le epilhot, e no vist alcu hom en nostra terra que aquela aia fayta.	The ancients recommended this sectioning in the head of an abscess, but I have not seen any person in our land who has done it.
E aquesta es la inscriptura del sermo de aquels.	And this is the inscription of the saying of those [ancients].
Mays en les homes haventz esquinencia, cove que sia esquivada la extraccio del epilhot, cum per aquo no sia fayt juvament per so quar totas las venas e las majors del malaute so aqui.	But in men with hip pain, it is necessary to avoid extracting the head of an abscess because this could bring no benefit since all major veins and arteries of the patient are located here.
Mays en aquels que han apostemas cautz en la boca o guolayro o dos aurelhas, quan la malautia no es en la cana, cove husar de la seccio de epilhot a fugir la perdicio la qual es fayta per perfocacio.	But for those who have abscesses in the mouth or groin or both ears, when the illness is not located in the spine, it is necessary to make an incision on the head of an abscess to prevent the danger brought about by pus formation.
Donc cove quan volem aquo, que inscidam le epilhot dejos tres cercles dels cercles del epilhot, o quatre am petita seccio per la latitut en aquel que es entre dos cercles per quantitat, que la seccio sia en ciphac, no en la cartillage, e aquest loc es convenent a seccio, quar es privat de carn e les vayselhs de sanc de lu son luhen.	Therefore, it is advisable to make an incision on the head of an abscess below three circles or four within the circumference of the abscess head, with a small section along its length at the point where two circles meet, ensuring that the incision is made in skin and not cartilage. This location is suitable for incision since it lacks flesh and has blood vessels running through it.
E si le metge es pauruc, cove lahoras que extenda la codena del golayro am onci, e aprop fenda la codena entro que pervengua a la canal, mays evite les vaysels de sanc si vetz de aquelas alcuna causa.	And if the physician is inexperienced, then it is recommended that they extend the groin strap with an ounce and make a slit on the strap until it reaches the canal, while avoiding blood vessels for any reason.
E aprop inscida li ciplach segon que havem recomtat; e es significat sobre la seccio de la canal per le flacma le qual es de aquela eyssit am aquo que es de lu disromput e per la abscizio de la votz.	Then make an incision on the lips as we have recommended, and mark the section of the canal with a flame, which will emerge from it due to the rupture and abscess formation in the vocal cords.
E layssa la plagua uberta per alcun temps.	And leave the wound open for some time.
Donc cum la hora es remauguda en la qual perforacio es temuda, agregua doas labias de la codena de la plagua, e cus aquela sola ses la cartillage.	Therefore, when the time comes to close the wound and avoid incision, attach two sides of the groin strap to the wound, making sure not to include any cartilage in the stitches.
E aprop administra medicinas que fan naysser la carn entro que sia sanat.	Then administer medications that promote tissue growth until the wound heals completely.
E diyssec Albucasis que la summa del sermo le qual havem recomtat, exposicio no es sino que veias que alcus de aquetz apostemas ja han opilat lo guolayro del malaute, e le malaute es vengut entro a mort, e le ale de lu es entresecat, e alcus van a inscidir le epiglos per so que respire le malaute sobre le loc de la plagua per alcuna respiracio, e sia salvat de mort.	And Albucasis says that the essence of this teaching we have recommended is simply to show that some cases of abscesses have already filled the patient's groin area, leading them to death and suffocation, with their breath trapped inside. Therefore, surgeons must incise the epiglottis to allow the patient to breathe through the wound, thereby saving them from certain demise.
E per aquo comandero layssar la plagua uberta entro que sia consumida la malicia de la malautia; e es la malicia de lu per tres dias; e donc lahoras comandero cosi la plagua, e cura aquela entro que sia sanat.	And so I command that the wound be left open until the harmful effects of the disease have been eliminated, which usually takes three days. Afterward, I recommend stitching up the wound and treating it until it heals completely.
E aquo que yeu he vist per mi meteys, es que una sirventa pres un cotel e mesec le en le sieu golayro e inscidic am aquel una partida de la cana del pulmo, e yeu fu apelat a la curacio de lu, e atrobegui la mugen ayssi cum es mugit del moridos, e descubrigui la plagua e atrobegui le sanc le qual era yssit de la plagua petit.	And what I have personally witnessed is that a maidservant took a knife and inserted it into her own groin, cutting through one part of the lung's ribcage. I was called to treat her injury, and upon examination, I found her in a state similar to that of a dying person's moan, with an open wound gushing out small amounts of blood from within.
Donc yeu fo confessat que aquela no havia inscidit vena ni guidegi, e le vent yssia de la plagua, e curegui aquela entro que foc sanada.	Therefore, I confessed that she had not cut any vein or artery, but rather the blood was flowing out of the wound itself. I treated her injury until it healed completely.
E no accidic a la sirventa si no rauquiera en la votz, e aprop alcus dias retornec ad miloracio de las suas dispozicios.	And the maidservant did not suffer any significant harm besides losing her voice, and after several days, she regained her strength and normal functions.
E ara dic yeu que en la seccio del epilhot no ha temor.	And now I say that there is no fear in making an incision on the head of an abscess.
Capitol .xliv.	Chapter XLIV.
De seccio sobre apostema le qual accideys en le golayro defora, e es apelat hernia del golayro.	Of the incision on an abscess that occurs in the outer groin area, and is called a hernia of the groin.
Aquest apostema nompnat hernia del golayro es apostema gran segon la color del cors, e es mot en las femnas.	This unnamed abscess, commonly referred to as a hernia of the groin, is a large swelling depending on the complexion of the body and is common in women.
E es segon dos manieyras, quar o es natural o accidental.	This condition can occur in two ways: either naturally or accidentally.
E en le natural no es engen de curar.	And for those that occur naturally, there is no cure.
E l’accidental es segon dos manieyras del qual la un es semblant a nodes grasses, e l’autra manieyra es semblant apostema le qual es fayt per nodacio de arteria, e en aquel es temor.	An accidental hernia can occur in two ways, one of which resembles fatty nodes, and the other is similar to an abscess caused by a knot in an artery. In this latter case, there is cause for concern.
E no cove que·s fassa presumpcio a lu cum ferr sino en aquel que es petit.	And one should not be overly presumptuous when using surgical tools, except in cases of small hernias.
E tu proha aquel e investigua aquel am le dit, e si atrobas lu semblant a nodi gras, e no es suspendut am alcuna de las venas, lahoras tu inscideys aquel ayssi cum les nodes, e extratz aquel am aquo que conte lu de la pel e bursiclam; e sino, lahoras es perscrutat tot le sieu esser, e aprop cura le loc am aquo que cove de curacio entro que sia sanat.	You should examine such hernias carefully and investigate them with the aid of the aforementioned tools. If you find it resembles fatty nodes and is not suspended by any veins, then proceed to incise it in the same manner as you would for nodes, extracting the contents along with the surrounding tissue and membrane. However, if this is not the case, then thoroughly scrutinize its entire structure, and treat the area with appropriate remedies until it heals completely.
Capitol .xlv.	Chapter 45
De seccio de las specias de nodes.	Of the section on types of knots (or swellings).
Dels nodes so motas specias e yeu ja he dit totas las specias de lor en la divisio.	There are many types of knots, and I have already mentioned all the types in the previous section.
E cove que yeu recomte assi la diferencia entre node e exitura cum fassa dubitacio.	And it is necessary for me to explain further the difference between a knot (or swelling) and an abscess, as there may be some confusion.
Donc yeu dic que am exitura es caliditat e febre e dolors vehementz entro que es sedada la ebullicio de la superfluitat; e es complida putrefaccio que lahora cessa la febre, la dolor e la calor.	Therefore, I say that an abscess is characterized by heat, fever, and intense pain, as long as the boiling of the excess fluid has not yet been alleviated. Once the abscess reaches its full stage of putrefaction, it stops causing fever, pain, and heat.
Mays am node no es caliditat ni febre ni dolor, e conte aquel ciphac leon le qual es al u sac propri.	But a knot (or swelling) is not characterized by heat, fever, or pain, and it includes a hard lump like a "ciphac leon" that forms in its own sack.
E es segon la color del cors, e le comensament de lu es cum un ceze e es fayt ayssi cum vace, sia major o minor, e son segon dos specias, quar o so grassas e conteno humiditat, e las colors de la humiditat son motas, segon que yeu diyssi en la divisio.	And it is also according to the color of the body that we can determine its type, and at first it resembles a goiter and develops in a similar way as a bladder, whether large or small. It is divided into two types: one is fatty and contains moisture, and the moisture has many colors, as I have said in the previous section.
Donc cove, quan pervenas a la curacio de node, que exprohes aquel e inquiras aquel al comensament am sturment le qual es apelat intromes, segon que vindra la sua forma en le capitol le qual es aprop aquest.	Therefore, when you come to the treatment of the knot, it is necessary to remove it and inquire about its beginning with an instrument called "intromes," according to its shape, as described in the following chapter.
E es manieyra de inquisicio de apostemas e de totz nodes, e es que tu prenguas aquest sturment e entromet aquel en le loc pus humit le qual atrobas en le apostema, e tu revolveras les tieus ditz am aquel petit a petit entro que sapias que·l sturment ja ha penetrat la codena.	And this is the method of inquiry for abscesses and all types of knots: that you take this instrument (intromes) and insert it into the most humid part of the abscess that you find, and then you rotate it gently, little by little, until you are certain that the instrument has penetrated the core.
E aprop ultima la tua ma segon la mesura de la grandeza del apostema, e aprop extratz le entromes e considera aquo que es yssit en le vestigi de lu.	Then place your hand according to the size of the abscess and remove the intromes (medical probe) and observe what comes out in its trace.
E si es fora-getada la humiditat corrent, de qualque color sia, lahoras tu le inscideys am seccio superficial segon que he dit en les autres apostemas.	And if the running moisture of any color has been released, then you should cut it with a superficial incision, as I have said for other abscesses.
E si del vestigi de l’intromes no hieys humiditat, lahoras sapias que es gras.	And if there is no moisture coming from the trace of the probe, then you know that it is fat (or a fatty abscess).
E secca sobre lu am seccio havent forma de crotz segon aquesta forma:	And make an incision over it in the shape of a cross, like this:
ayssi cum t’e ensenhat, e suspen aquel am oncis, e excorja la codena de tota part am facilitat, e guarda la pel o sac, si podes, sobre aquel e extraguas aquela sania am le node.	and cut it open in the shape of a cross as I have taught you, and suspend it with a ligature, and carefully remove the core from all sides, and preserve the skin or sac if possible over it, and extract the pus with the abscess.
Mays si es romput en la operacio, no es possible extrayre aquela sana, e motas veguadas endeve aquo, e lahoras tu la extratz a pessas entro que de lu no romangua denguna causa.	But if it bursts during the operation, it is not possible to extract healthy tissue, and many times this results in the opposite outcome. Therefore, you should extract (the abscess) with pressure until none of it remains.
Quar si de lu roman denguna causa, pauc o trop, le node retorne segon le mays.	Because if any cause remains, whether little or too much, the abscess will return according to its severity.
E si tu vezes que de lu roman alcuna part petita, lahoras comple la plagua de alcunas polveras corrosivas agudas e strenh la plagua, e pausa sobre aquela que sede apostema caut, e cura aquel del autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And if you see that some small part remains, then fill the wound with some sharp and corrosive powders and strengthen the area, and place a cauterizing agent on the abscess, and cure it with another treatment until it is healed.
E si es node gran, lahoras tu cus las doas labias de lu e cura aquel am aquo que encarna.	And if it is a large abscess, then you should suture the two lips of it and cure it with what fleshes (or matures).
Mays si vena pulsatil es a lu contraria, o no-pulsatil, lahoras tu coyta e huemple le loc de zegi trissat que es vetriol e leyssa aquel streyt per dos dias o per tres entro que·s poyresca la plagua e que repause la ebullicio del sanc; e aprop retorna a inscindir aquo que es romas del node.	But if the pulse is moving towards it (the abscess) or not pulsating, then you should place and fill the area with three times sixty of quicksilver (mercury), which is called "vetriol," and leave it straight for two days or three until the wound can be opened again and the boiling of the blood has subsided; and then return to cutting what remains of the abscess.

Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter 47.
De la cura de las mamillas dels homes las quals so asembladas de femnas.	On the treatment of male breasts, which resemble those of women.
Alcunas veguadas so infladas las mamillas de alcus homes deves le compliment del dormir cum comensan esser pellutz, e aprop so infladas las mamillas, e so asembladas las mamillas de las femnas, e romano apostemosas, lejas.	Sometimes, the breasts of some men become inflamed due to excessive sleep and begin to resemble those of women, and they also develop abscesses that are far from the nipples.
E ad aquel que avoreys aquo, cove que inscidisca aquelas am seccio lunar segon aquesta forma, de la linha de .B. entro a la linha de .G., e aprop excorja la groceza tota, e aprop uempla la plagua de medicament encarnatiu, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am cosidura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And for those who have this condition, it is necessary to make an incision with a crescent shape along the line from B to G, and then remove all of the thickened tissue, fill the wound with a carmine-colored medicine, suture the two sides of the wound together, and treat the inside so that it heals.
Mays si la mamilla declina a las partidas dejos e es mollificada per la sua magnitut ayssi cum endeve a las femnas, lahoras sia fendut en dos latz sieus pus sobiras, am dos seccios semblantz a figura lunar, de las quals quascuna sia contenguda en l’autra deves la fi de quascuna, entro que sia que la linha major contengua la menor segon aquesta forma de la linha de .B. e la linha de .G. E aprop excorja la codena la qual es entre dos labias de la plagua, e osta la pingueza, e aministra aquo que havem dit de la sutura e de las polveras aquo que es necessari en la curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the breast sags towards the lower parts and becomes soft like those of women, then it should be cut in two along its upper part with two incisions that are similar to a crescent shape, and each one should fit inside the other until the larger one contains the smaller one, according to this form of the line B and the line G. Then remove the fatty tissue between the two sides of the wound, administer what we have said about suturing and powders, and continue treatment until it heals.
E si tu non conpleysses la inscizio de aquo que cove inscidir per la inquietut del malaute, e per flux de sanc, lahoras cove que huemplas la plagua de coto submergit en enguent corrosiu e layssa aquel entro que aquo corroda que es romas de la grayssa, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you do not complete the incision as necessary due to the patient's discomfort or excessive bleeding, then it is necessary to apply a compress soaked in corrosive ointment to the wound and let the corrosive substance break down the thickened tissue until it becomes soft. Then treat the inside of the wound until it heals.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter 48.
De perforacio de apostemas que veno dejos le titillic.	On the incision of abscesses that form in the lower parts due to itching.
Aquetz apostemas que veno dejos le titillic so de las specias de scrophulas, durs, las quals conte una pel que es sac.	These abscesses that form in the lower parts due to itching are of the type called scrofula, which contain a pus-like substance.
E de aquelas so alcunas que conteno humiditatz; e aquelas que conteno humiditatz cove que sian inscididas am seccio lunar segon aquesta figura: de la linha de .G. a la linha de .B. E cum es tot evacuat aquo que es en le apostema de la sania, lahoras tu le comple de coto viel e leysa le entro al autra dia.	And some of these abscesses contain moisture, and those that do should be incised with a crescent-shaped incision along the line from G to B, as shown in this figure. Once all of the pus has been evacuated from the abscess and it is clean, then apply a dry compress and leave it on for another day.
E aprop le coto sia ostat e sia curat am enguent convenient ad aquo, entro que sia sanat.	And then apply a dry compress and treat it with appropriate ointment until it heals.
E si le apostema de las specias dels nodes es, e de las scrophulas, lahoras tu scindeys sobre aquel ayssi cum havem dit en la seccio sobre las scrophulas engualment.	And if the abscess is of the type with nodes or is a scrofula, then incise it as we have said in the section on scrofulas.
May si la plagua es extenduda en aysso que yesca poyredura, lahoras administra en lu cauteri segon que en aquo havem denant dit.	But if the wound extends to an area where it can be cauterized, then apply cautery as we have said before.
Capitol .xlix.	Chapter 49.
De seccio de apostemas que accideysso per arceria o per vena.	On the incision of abscesses caused by an artery or vein.
Quan arceria es rompuda, e la codena es consolidada la qual es sobre aquela, lahoras motas veguadas accideys apostema E les senhals per les quals es conoguda que imflamacio e apostema sian per la arteria o per vena: quar quan apostema es per arceria es lonc agreguat en le preon del cors; e que quan inpelleysses le apostema am les tieus ditz, sentes en lu quays sia stridor.	When an artery is ruptured and the tissue around it has hardened, often an abscess forms. The signs that indicate an inflammation or abscess caused by an artery or vein are: when an abscess is due to an artery, it will be long and located in a prominent part of the body; and when you press on the abscess with your fingers, you can hear a stridor sound.
E aquel que es per vena es redon al manifest del cors.	And an abscess caused by a vein will be round and visible on the surface of the body.
E seccio sobre aquest apostema es error, e majorment en aquel que es dejos las aysselhas, e en les angonars, e en le col, e en motz locs del cors; e es mot gran, donc cove que la sua curacio am ferr sia esquivada, e aquel que es en las extramitatz, o al cap, cove que sia evitat.	And sectioning above this abscess is a mistake, especially in one that is below the armpits, and in the groin, and in the neck, and in many other parts of the body; and it is very large, so its surgical treatment should be avoided, and one that is on the limbs or the head should be prevented.
Mays sobre aquel que es de lor per imflacio de l’orrifici de la arceria, scindeys en la codena seccio en le lonc; e aprop huebre la seccio am uncis e aprop la arceria, e deliura de las tunicas entro que sia descuberta.	But as for one that is located due to inflammation of the orifice of the artery, make an incision in the longitudinal section in the groin; and then separate the incision with forceps and expose the artery, and free it from the tunics that cover it.
E aprop met sobre aquel agulha e fay aquela penetrar entro al autre latz, e estrenh la arceria am fiel doble en dos locs, — la qual causa yeu a tu eyssenhegui en extraccio de doas arcerias les quals so en les templars.	And then place a needle over it and make it penetrate into the other side, and strengthen the artery with double tanned leather in two places - which causes a tightening in the extraction of two arteries that are in the temples.
E aprop punh le loc le qual es entre dos liamentz am spatum entro que yesca le sanc tot que es en lu, e sia dissolvut le apostema.	And then place your finger on the location that is between two ligaments with a spatula until all of the blood is drained from it, and let the abscess be resolved.
E aprop administra curacio en la qual es engendrat poyre entro que caian les liamentz; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz convenientz ad aquo entro que sia sanat.	And then administer treatment that generates pus inside until the ligaments give way; and then cure it with appropriate ointments until it is healed.
E si es apostema per seccio de vena, lahoras cove que tu tenguas am la tua ma aquo que es a tu possible del apostema am la codena, e aprop intromet la agulha dejos le loc le qual tu has tengut dejos la tua ma, e fay aquela penetrar; e sia en aquela fil doble entro que tu extraguas aquel del autre latz, e aprop ligua le apostema am bo liament segon que yeu he dit a tu en le liament de uva4 de doas partz am doas extremitatz del fil.	And if it is an abscess due to incision of a vein, then you should hold with your hand as much as possible of the abscess towards the groin, and then insert the needle below the location that you have held with your hand, and make it penetrate; and let there be double thread in it as you extract it from the other side, and then tie off the abscess with a good ligament as I have told you in the grape-like ligament of two parts with two extremities of the thread.
Mays si temes que extraguam le fil, lahoras entromet le fiel am aquela agula dejos tot le apostema deves la inscizio de la agulha primieyra, e strenh les tieus fiels en quatre locs.	But if you are afraid of extracting the thread, then insert tanned leather with that needle below the entire abscess and strengthen the incision with the thread in four places.
Aprop secca le apostema en le mieg loc de lu entro que quan es yssit aquo que es en lu, lahoras tu inscideys la superfluitat de la codena, e layssa aquo que de lu es liat.	And then dry out the abscess in the middle of it until what is inside it comes out, and then incise the excess skin of the groin, and let what adheres to it remain.
E aprop pausa sobre lu pulvil le qual has submergit en vi e oli, e aprop administra la curacio la qual es fayta am calguas e enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then place over it the poultice that you have soaked in wine and oil, and then administer the treatment that is made with warm compresses and ointments until it is healed.
Capitol l del apostema le qual accideys per torcio de nervis.	Chapter 1: The abscess that occurs due to nerve twisting.
Ayssi cum accideys apostema en arceria e en vena, e semblantment accideys apostema en les nervis quan accideys en lor percussio o accideys per trebal superfluable, e per semblantz.	Just as an abscess occurs in the artery and vein, so too does an abscess occur in the nerves when it occurs due to nerve compression or excessive work, among other things.
E es fayt le mays de lu en les locs dels adjutoris o del talo, o en tot loc en le qual so maugudas las juncturas.	And it is most often found in the areas of the adductors or ankle, or in any location where the joints are strained.
E es apostema greu, e es asemblat a la color del autre cors, e es en las majors de lu disposicios ses de lor e quan es streyt am vehementia, sent en lu le malaute semblant stupor.	And it is a severe abscess, and it resembles the color of other flesh, and it is located in the largest part of the limb, and when it becomes tight with intensity, the patient appears to be in a state of stupor.
E no es apostema agreguat en le preon del cors, e per so es dejos la codena, e el es maugut a tota partida e no va a las partidas denant ni detras.	And it is not an abscess that has spread in the belly of the body, and so it does not involve the groin, and it affects all parts equally and does not extend to the front or back.
Donc aquo de aquels que es en las juncturas no cove que sia envasit am ferr, quar fort leu endevenguera contracio.	Therefore, in the case of those that are located in the joints, it is not advisable to encase them with iron, as this can easily lead to contraction.
Mays aquel que es en le cap o en le front fen la codena am spatum.	But one that is in the head or forehead should be opened with a spatula.
Mays si es apostema pauc, lahoras te aquel am les forfecs e abscindeys aquel de razitz.	But if it is a small abscess, then extract it with forceps and cut it out at its roots.
E si es gran, lahoras tu le suspen am unci, e excorja aquel, e aprop osta aquel; e ajusta la plagua am sutura, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if it is large, then suspend it with forceps, and scrape it, and remove it; and close the wound with stitches, and cure it until it is healed.
Capitol .li.	Chapter 2.
De seccio de apostema le qual accideys de cheil que accideys al ventre.	Of incision of an abscess that occurs due to disease in the belly.
Endeveno ad alcus homes motas veguadas en les ventres de aquels e en las autras partidas del cors de aquels theils les quals son apelatz funguals per similitut de aquels am funges, dels quals la razitz es subtil e·l cap de aquel es gros; e ja las labias de aquels so conversas, e es de aquels que es petit, e es de aquels que es mot magnificat.	Often in the bellies of some people and in other parts of their bodies, there are swellings that are called fungal due to their similarity to mushrooms, the roots of which are subtle while the head is large; and the lips of these have turned inward, and they can be small or greatly enlarged.
E yeu ja e vist un, e en le ventre de lu eran dos theils les quals eran mays a funges semblantz, e no era diferencia entre aquels blancs, de menuda razitz.	And I have seen one that had two parts in his belly that resembled mushrooms more closely, and there was no difference between their white colors, as they had fine roots.
E ja las labias de aquels eran enversadas e se fendian, e humiditat corria de aquel tot temps.	And the lips of these were turned inward and split open, and fluid flowed from it at all times.
Donc yeu inscidegui aquels e atrobegui en la un en pes quays xviii unc. e l’autre quays vi unc.	Therefore I incised these and found in one of them a mass that weighed eighteen ounces. And the other weighed five ounces.
E la operacio en la inscizio de lor es que consideres lahoras si·l malaute es humit, e la color de atheil es blanca, humit, de subtil razitz; lahoras tu le inscideys am spatum lat, e sian en la presencia tua cauteris en le foc, quar motas veguadas deves la seccio de lu es expellit mot sanc; e si te ventz le sanc, cauteriza aquel.	And the procedure in incising them is that you should consider whether the patient is moist, and if the color of the abscess is white, moist, with fine roots; then you should incise it with a broad spatula, and have cauteries present in the fire, because much fluid will be expelled from the incision, so if blood comes out, cauterize it.
E si vezes le malaute pauruc e temeros, guarda te de inscizio am ferr; mays lahoras pren fiel de plom recent fayt, e strenh am aquel atheil, la manieyra del qual es aquela que havem dita; e leyssa aquel per dos dias.	And if you see that the patient is weak and fearful, be careful not to incise with iron; but rather take fresh lead filings, and strengthen the abscess with it in the manner that we have mentioned, and leave it for two days.
E aprop ajusta en la strictura del fil de plom; donc, no cesses strenher le plom granre devetz en theil, entro que sia abscindit e cayha per se ses trebalh.	And then tighten the string of lead as it dissolves; therefore, do not stop strengthening the large piece of lead in the abscess, until it is cut and falls out by itself without any effort.
Mays si theil es de grossa razitz, lahoras en la inscizio de lu es alcuna causa de temor e de paor, e majorment en aquel que es en le ventre.	But if the abscess is of large roots, then there is reason to fear and be cautious in incising it, especially in one that is located in the belly.
Mays possibla es que tu inscindas la maytat de lu , e aprop cauteriza aquel per que no retorne.	But it is possible that you incise the entire abscess and then cauterize it to prevent its recurrence.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanada la plagua.	And then cure it until the wound heals.
E guarda te que tu no presumas inscidir theil le qual es de fusca color, de pauc sentiment, de leg reguardament, quar aquel es absi cancros.	And be careful not to assume that you can incise a tumor that is of dark color, with little sensation, and with irregular appearance, as this is likely cancerous.
E yeu vindre am rememoracio de cranc aprop aysso.	And I will come back to remind you about cancer later.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter II
De curacio de eminencia del umbilic.	Of the treatment of umbilical hernia.
Eminencia del umbilic es fayta per motas causas; o per fissuras del ciphac le qual es sobre le ventre, e yeys de lu la tela o budel segon que endeve en las autras rupturas; o per sanc le qual flueys de vena o de arceria segon que es denant dit, o per ventositat coarctada en lu.	The umbilical hernia is caused by many factors: either due to fissures of the ciphac which is above the belly and has its membrane or intestine protruding as in other ruptures, or due to blood that flows from a vein or artery as mentioned earlier, or due to constipation in it.
Mays si es per fissura del ciphac e per yssiment de la tela, lahoras la color del apostema es semblant a la color del cors; e es leon ses dolor, e aprop appar de divers situament.	But if it is due to fissures of the ciphac and protrusion of the membrane, then the color of the abscess is similar to the color of the flesh, and it is painless, and often appears in various forms.
E si es per egressio del budel, lahoras le situament de aquel am lu de aquo que havem recontat, de mays vehement diversitat, e cum tu premes aquel am les tieus ditz es occultat, e aprop retorna; e fort leu es am lu so, e es magnificat mot deves le introt de banh e vehement trebalh.	And if it is due to protrusion of the intestine, then its shape is similar to what we have mentioned, but with greater diversity, and as you press on it with your fingers, it disappears and then returns; and it can be easily pushed in, and becomes greatly enlarged when bathing and exertion.
Mays si per humiditat, lahoras es leon e no es occultat quan premes am la tua ma, ni es constrengut, ni es cregut.	But if it is due to moisture, then it is painless and does not disappear when pressed with the hand, nor is it constricted or swollen.
E si es per sanc, lahoras am aquestz senhals apareys le apostema a negror declinant.	And if it is purulent, then use these signs to prepare for the abscess to ripen to a dark color.
Mays si es per carn nada, lahoras es apostema greu, gros e dur, e es ficat segon una quantitat.	But if it is caused by an accumulation of flesh, then the abscess is severe, large and hard, and swollen to a certain extent.
Mays si es per ventositat, lahoras le tocament de lu es leon.	But if it is caused by gas, then touch it like a lion. (Note: I'm not sure about this translation as "leon" in old languages could also mean "boldly".)
E la operacio en lu es que consideras lahoras si la eminencia de l’umbilic es per sanc de arceria, o de vena, o per ventositat; lahoras cove que sias prohibit de la curacio de lu, quar en aquela es temor e paor ayssi cum t’e ensenhat en le capitol en le qual he dit les apostemas per arceria e per vena.	And the procedure for this is to consider whether the prominence of the navel is due to an arterial or venous abscess, or to gas. If so, you must refrain from treating it, because, as taught in the chapter where I discussed abscesses of arteries and veins, there is danger and fear in such cases.
E si la eminencia del umbilic es per le budel o per la tela, lahoras cove que comandes al malaute que tengua le ale sieu, e sia stant extendut; e aprop senha am tenta en le circuit de tot le umbilic, e aprop comanda a lu que stia envers entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos, e aprop circunda am spatum lat en le circuit del umbilic sobre le loc le qual has senhat am la tenta; e aprop exten la maytat del apostema a las partidas desus am unci gran; e aprop lia en le circuit am fiel fort o am ceda e la manieyra del liar decent.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to an intestinal or tissue disorder, then you should instruct the patient to hold their own belly and stand upright. Then, using your finger, mark a circle around the entire navel, and place the patient lying down between your hands. Next, use a broad-bladed spatula to draw a line around the marked circle on the surface of the navel. Then, extend the base of the abscess upwards with a large incision; and finally, bind it in a circle with strong vinegar or cedar, using an appropriate binding method.
E aprop huebre le mieg del apostema extendut sobre le liament e intromet le dit tieu en aquel indic e quereys le budel; e si tu l’as atrobat ni guardat per le liament, lahoras tu extratz alxorati e impelleys le budel a las partidas dedintz del ventre.	And then, insert your finger into the middle of the opened abscess and explore the tissue until you find the intestine; if you find it or feel it through the tissue, then gently pull it out and guide it back inside the abdomen.
E si has atrobada la tela, lahoras pren aquel am unci; e inscideys las superfluitatz de lu.	And if you find tissue instead, then tie it with a ligature and cut away any excess.
Mays si es contraria a tu arceria o vena, lahoras circunda aquel mot, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio; e pren dos agulhas e met en aquelas dos fiels fortz e entromet dos agulhas en le circuit le qual has feyt entorn le apostema en manieyra de crotz, las quals fassas penetrar; e aprop strenh le apostema en quatre partidas sobre las agulhas.	But if it is contrary to your artery or vein, then tie it off and return to your operation. Take two needles and put strong threads on them, then insert the needles into the circle you made around the abscess like a cross, and pull the abscess in four parts onto the needles.
E si tu vols, osta las agulhas e leyssa le loc entro que poyresca la carn extenduda e caia per si; o inscideys aquel quan es subtiliat e se poyreys, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove dels enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And if you wish, remove the needles and leave it alone until the flesh retracts and falls in by itself; or cut the thinned tissue carefully and suture the wound with appropriate sutures until it heals.
E si la eminencia del ombilic es de carn nada en lu o per humiditat, lahoras cove que tu conquaves le apostema ayssi cum havem dit e estraguas le sanc o la humiditat, la qual atrobas en lu, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que cove e que consolide le loc.	And if the prominence of the navel is due to flesh or moisture in it, then you should lance the abscess as we have said, and remove the pus or moisture that you find in it. Then treat it appropriately and solidify the area.
Capitol .liii.	Chapter 53. (It seems like the text is starting a new chapter)
De curacio de cranc.	On the treatment of cancer.
Ja havem dit, en la divisio, de specia de cranc e en qual manieyra es via a la curacio de lu am medicinas, e que es squivador en lu la curacio am ferr per so que no sia ulcerat; e havem dit cranc engendrat en la mayra e cautela de la curacio de lu.	We have already said in the division of types of cancer and how it can be cured with medicines, that treatment by surgery is not advisable because it causes ulcers. And we have also discussed the importance of caution and care in the treatment of cancer.
E diyssero les antics que alcunas veguadas cranc es en loc on es possibla la eradicacio de lu, ayssi cum de cran le qual es en las mamillas o en la coyssa e a lor semblantz dels membres allocat a estrayre tot aquel, e majorment quan es comensant petit.	And the ancients said that some cancers are in places where it is possible to eradicate them entirely, such as cancer of the breast or groin and similar types located on limbs which allow for removal of all affected tissue, especially when they are starting out small.
Mays quan es antiquat e es gra, no cove que te propries a lu, quar yeu non pogui sanar de aquel alcu ni no he vist autre, ni que sia pervengut ad aquo.	But when it is old and large, you should not attempt to treat it, because I have never seen or heard of anyone being cured of such a severe cancer.
E la operacio en lu es quan es allocat ayssi cum havem dit, es que tu precedescas e laysses le malaute e purgues de colera negra alcunas veguadas, e aprop sagna aquel, si es atrobada replecio manifesta.	And the procedure for this is, when it is located as we have said, to proceed with caution and let the patient take some purgative medicine to cleanse the black bile from their system. Also, if there is obvious congestion, then bleed the patient.
E aprop prepara le malaute am preparacio en le qual sia locat am operacio, e aprop prohiceys en le trauc uncis les quals cove ad aquel; e aprop concava de tota part am la codena sego bona perexcrutacio entro que no romangua alcuna causa de las razitz de lu.	And then, prepare the patient for surgery with a preparation that allows for the operation. Also, prohibit sharp objects near the incision, which is necessary. Additionally, make sure the area is thoroughly cleaned and free of any possible cause of infection.
E layssa correr le sanc, e no abscidas aquel leugierament, e exprem les locs, e abstergeys le sanc gros tot am la tua ma o am instrument am le qual es a tu possible dels instruments.	And let the blood flow freely and do not close it lightly. Express the wounds and wipe away the thick clots of blood with your hand or an appropriate instrument that is available to you.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat de sanc gros inscizio de vena o de arceria, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que·l flux del sanc sia cessat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	But if the heavy bleeding is due to a cut vein or artery, then use a hot iron to cauterize it and stop the flow of blood, and treat the wound with other appropriate treatments until it heals.
Capitol .liv.	Chapter 54. (It seems like the text is starting a new chapter)
De curacio de ydropici.	On the treatment of dropsy.
Nos ja havem recomtat, en la divisio, de las specias de ydropici de l’aygua, e les senhals de quascuna especia, de la curacio de lu am medicinas.	We have already recommended in the division of types of dropsy and their symptoms, how to cure them with medicines.
E aquela la qual es curada am ferr no es sino la specia de althitas sola, e no es aproximat am ferr a la specia de timpanistres ni a la especia de yposarcha, quar aquo es mortal.	And the type of dropsy that can be cured with surgery is only the type of ascites, and it should not be approached with a knife in cases of tympanites or hydrothorax, because that would be fatal.
E quan tu ja has medicat aquesta especia de ydropici timpanistre am medicinas e no comfereys la tua medicacio, lahoras considera, quar si al malaute ja es conseguida debelitat, o es am aquel autra malautia otra ydropici, ayssi cum si es en lu tos o cos de ventre e semblant ad aquels, lahoras guarda te que no le mediques am ferr, quar temor es sobre aquo.	And when you have treated this type of dropsy with tympanites using medicines and they do not respond to treatment, then consider whether the patient is already weakened or has another illness in addition to dropsy, such as cough or stomach pain, etc. If so, then refrain from treating them with surgery, because it is dangerous.
Mays si tu vezes le malaute de vertut exuberant, e am lu no es autra malautia sino ydropici tant solament, e no enfant ni vielh, lahoras la manieyra de la operacio de lu es que tu eleves le malaute entre las tuas mas, e le ministre aprop lu exprema le ventre de lu am la sua ma, enpellen la aygua a la partida dejos del pentenilh, e aprop pren spatum spinos segon aquesta forma:	But if you see that the patient is strong and healthy, and their only illness is dropsy, and they are neither too young nor too old, then the method of operation for them is to lift the patient between your hands, place a bucket under their belly, have them press on their stomach with their own hand, push the water towards the lower part of the abdomen, and then take a pointed spatula in this way:
sia de dos partz agudas lonc, de aguda extremitat ayssi cum spatum; mays empero sia en lu alcuna brevitat petit a petit, per so que en la operacio am aquel no passes entro al budel, e que ledas aquel.	should be two-sided with sharp points like a spatula, but it should be short and gradually increase in length so that during the operation you do not penetrate the intestines, but only touch them.
E aprop considera si la generacio de ydropici es de part dels budels, quar lahoras cove que tu am la seccio te alonhes del ombelic per la quantitat de tres ditz a las partidas dejos, en le dreyt de lu sobre le pentenilh.	And then consider whether the cause of dropsy is in some part of the intestines, because in that case, you should make your incision at a distance of three fingers below the navel on the right side towards the bladder.
Mays si la generacio de hydropici es per malautia del fietge, lahoras la tua seccio sia sinistra del ombilic per tres ditz.	But if the cause of dropsy is some illness of the liver, then your incision should be on the left side of the navel at a distance of three fingers.
E si la generacio de lu es per la melsa, lahoras la tua seccio sia en le las dreyt.	And if the cause of dropsy is the spleen, then your incision should be on the right side.
E no cove que la tua seccio sia sobre le costat sobre le qual vol jaser le malaute per que no corron las superfluitatz ad aquel loc freul.	And it is not advisable for your incision to be on the side where the patient wants to lie down, because then the excess fluids will accumulate in that place and cause harm.
E aprop perfora am le instrument tota la codena, e aprop entromet en aquela seccio, e eleva la tua ma am le spatum entre la codena e·l siphac, e tu excorja aquel; e si’ la quantitat de una ungla o enviro.	And then use your instrument to make a hole in the abdominal wall and insert it into that incision, and lift your hand with the spatula between the abdominal wall and the intestines, and then you can clean out any excess fluid. The amount removed should be about the size of a fingernail or thereabouts.
E aprop perforo le ciphac entro que pervengua le spatum al loc vuoyt, e es loc de l’aygua.	And then pierce the intestines until the spatula reaches the empty space where the fluid is located.
E aprop extratz aquel e entromet un instrument del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then remove it and insert an instrument of this shape: (Note: The text does not provide a description of the shape, only says "of this shape" but there is no further explanation).
e es semblant a canula de argent subtil; es fayt de argent o de eram o de lato leon, al qual en la partida pus bassa de lu es un petit trauc, e en les costatz de lu so tres traucs: dos de una partida e un del autra partida; e fayta es la extremitat de lu insciza segon la manieyra de pluma, ayssi cum vezes:	and it resembles a slender silver cannula, made of silver or brass or lead, with a small hole at the lower end, and three holes on its sides: two on one side and one on the other side. The tip of this instrument is sharpened like a feather quill. (Note: I am providing a description based on the text).
E en la extramitat de lu pus sobirana es armilla, quar quan le instrument perve al aygua, lahoras aquela tantost deysen sobre le instrument, donc evacua de l’aygua en la ora miega quantitat, quar si tu evacuas de aquela mes que no cove en la hora, fort leu mor le malaute per resolucio del sieu spirit animal, o accideys a lu cincopi que es appropinquada la mort.	And on the upper end of it is an armillary ring, so that when the instrument reaches the water, the ring can be placed on top of it, and this allows for drainage of the fluid in small quantities, because if too much fluid is drained at once, the patient may die from loss of vital spirits or suffer a stroke which could lead to death. (Note: I am providing a translation based on the text).
Mays evacua de aquela segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu e segon que significan a tu las disposicios del malaute de la vertut del pols de lu e de la bontat de lu.	But drain it according to the strength of the patient and as indicated by their physical condition, the strength of their pulse, and overall health.
E aprop extrats le instrument, e rete l’aygua la qual causa es quar tantost es retenguda per la codena la qual rete le trauc que es sobre le ciphac del qual e recomtat a tu que perfores aquel segon aquela manieyra.	And then remove the instrument and keep the water that has accumulated due to the abdominal wall closing up the hole you made in it, which is why I instructed you to make an incision in that manner.
