sino que en la extramitat de lu es sorda, so es clausa.	"But if it is closed at its end"
Et en aquela so tres traucs: dos de la una partida , ayssi quo vezes.	"And it has three holes on one side, two of which are placed like this."
En le comensament es loc concau, en le qual es aquo que es enpellit, e sia segon quantitat que oppile aquel, ses addicio, entro que quan alcuna causa es ab aquel tirada de las humiditatz, sia atirada, e quan es expellida, am aquo sia atirada, e quan es expellit lonc, segon que fa clampcedra am la qual es phicat naphta en las batalhas de mar.	"At the beginning of it is a concave space where what is pushed in is placed, and this should be according to the size that oppresses that (instrument), without addition, until when any cause is pulled away from the humors, it is pulled, and when it is expelled, it is pulled with it, and when it is expelled long, as a clampcedra does with which naphtha is injected in sea battles."
Donc cum tu vols prohicir humiditatz en la vesica, entromet la extremitat de clapcedra en la humiditat, e atira am aquel aquo que es empellit a las partidas desus, quar la humiditat es atirada en la conquavitat de clapcedra.	Therefore, if you want to introduce fluids into the bladder, insert the end of the clampcedra into the fluid and pull it upwards with what is pushed in, as the fluid will be drawn into the concavity of the clampcedra.
E aprop entromet la extramitat de clapcedra en la vergua segon que havem recomtat en la ciringua; e aprop empelleys la humiditat am aquo que empelleys, quar aquela humiditat perve a la vesica tantost, e le malaute cent aquela.	And then insert the end of the clampcedra into the urethra as we have recommended in the use of siringua; and then push the fluid with what you are pushing, for that fluid will reach the bladder immediately and the patient will feel it.
Forma del cristeri subtil am le qual la vesica es cristerizada, e es aquela la forma:	"Form of the subtle clyster with which the bladder is irrigated, and this is its form:"
E sia fayta de argent o de lato, de la qual le cap pus aut sia semblant a petita pluma, e dejos lu cana dedintz liament.	"And it should be made of silver or lead, with its head resembling a small feather and a cannula leading down from it."
E aprop pren vesica de moto, e pausa en aquela la humiditat que vols cristirizar en la vesica, e aprop lia aquela entre dos am fort liguatura am fiel doble, e escalfa aquela humiditat sobre le foc.	"And then take the bladder in motion (peristalsis) and stop it in that place where you want to irrigate the bladder with the fluid, then tie it tightly between two strong ligatures with double bile, and heat the fluid over a fire."
E aprop entromet la extremitat del cristeri en la vergua.	And then insert the end of the clyster into the urethra.
E aprop estrenh la tua ma sobre la vesica am la humiditat am strectura descent entro que·l malaute centa que aquela humiditat ja es pervenguda a la vesica.	And then you strengthen your hand on the bladder with the fluid, with gentle pressure until the patient feels that the fluid has reached the bladder.
Mays si a tu no es present vesica, lahoras tu pren una pessa de parguames e fay de aquel cercle; e perfora aquel de tota la sua retonditat; e aprop entromet fiel fort en aquels traucs, ayssi quo so revolgut; e aprop agregua le cercle ayssi quo es agreguat alsofatur, pus que tu pausas en aquel aquo que tu vols de las humiditatz, e olis e ayguas.	But if the bladder is not present (visible), then you take a paste of parsnips and make a circle out of it; and perforate that with its entire roundness; and then insert strongly into those holes, so that it turns around; and then attach the circle in such a way as it is attached to a bladder stone, when you stop at what you want from the humors, oil and waters.
E aprop tu lia aquel en le instrument e fay am aquel ayssi cum has fayt am la vesica, e exprescio am la tua ma entro que la humiditat pervengua a la vesica.	And then you tie it to the instrument and do the same as you did with the bladder, and express it with your hand until the fluid reaches the bladder.
Capitol .lx.	"Chapter 60"
De extraccio de peyra.	"On the Extraction of Stones"
Nos ja havem dit en la divisio las specias de peyra e curacio de lu am medicinas, e la diferencia entre peyra engendrada en los ronhos e peyra engendrada en la vesica, e les senhals de aquela.	We have already mentioned in the discussion the types of stone and their treatment with medicines, and the difference between a stone generated in the kidneys and one generated in the bladder, and its symptoms.
E havem dit la peyra en la qual catz operacio am ma, e seccio.	And we have said that a stone can be operated on with a hand and cutting.
E la peyra engendrada en la vesica propriament es aquela que es ficada en la vesica.	And a stone generated in the bladder properly speaking is one that is lodged in the bladder.
E yeu so narrant aquel am exposicio manifesta e abreviacio.	I am now relating this with clear and concise explanation.
Donc dic que peyra engendrada en la vesica majorment ve als enfantz; e dels senhals de lu es que la urina que es eyssida de la vesica es semblant a aygua en la sua subtilitat, e apar en aquela arena; e le malaute fregua la sua vergua, e motas veguadas pen, e aprop es dressada; e am aquo yeys foro le cul en motz de aquels.	So I say that a stone generated in the bladder usually affects children; and its symptoms are that the urine that comes out of the bladder resembles water in its subtlety, and sand is visible in it; and the patient touches his private parts, and many times passes blood clots, and with this the anus protrudes with a swelling of those.
E es laugiera la sanacio dels enfants de aquela entro que han conseguitz xiiii ans; e es dificil curacio en les viels.	And the healing of children with this occurs before they reach fourteen years of age; and it is a difficult cure in the elderly.
Mays en les joves es migiera per aquo quar es entre aquels.	But in young people, it is easier because it occurs between them (testes).
E de aquel del qual la peyra es major e la curacio es pus leugiera; E si es pauca, es contraria ad aquela.	And of the one for whom the stone is larger and the cure is more difficult; and if it is small, it is contrary to that. (I'm not sure what "it is contrary" means in this context)
Donc cum pervenem a la curacio de aquela, cove al comensament de aquela que mondifiquem le malaute am cristeri le qual extragua tota la fenda la qual es en les sieus budels; quar aquela fenda alcunas veguadas prohibeys la envencio de la peyra deves la inquisicio de lu.	So, how do we proceed to the cure of that (stone), it is appropriate at the beginning of that to cleanse the patient with a clyster which extracts all the crack which is in his intestines; for that crack sometimes prevents the formation of the stone due to the investigation of it.
E aprop sia pres le malaute am les sieus pes e sia contosit e maugut enjos per so que la peyra descenda al preon de la vesica, o que saute de loc aut alcunas veguadas.	And then the patient should be placed with his feet up and constricted so that the stone descends to the neck of the bladder, or jumps from one place to another sometimes.
E aprop fay aquel cezer entre las tuas mas preparat, e las mas de lu sian dejos las coysas de lu, per so que la vesica tota sia fayta declinant a las partidas dejos.	And then do this with your hands prepared, and let his hands be away from his things, so that the bladder is completely made to incline towards the lower parts.
E aprop perquier aquela e tota aquela deforo.	And then search for it (stone) and remove it all from there.
Donc si sentes la peyra en l’espazi, lahoras tu te coyta tantost am seccio sobre lu.	So if you feel the stone in the space, then you should cut it immediately with cutting. (I'm not sure what "it" refers to here, it could be the stone or the space)
E si no catz de tot dejos le tieu tocament, lahoras cove que tu untes am oli le tieu dit indic de la ma sinistra, si malaute es enfant, o le dit miga si es jove complit, e entrometas aquel en le sieu cul.	And if you do not feel all of it with your touch, then it is appropriate that you apply oil with the index finger of your left hand, if the patient is a child, or with the middle finger if he is an adult, and insert it into his anus.
E perquier de la peyra entro que stia dejos le tieu dit.	And search for the stone inside so that it stays below your finger.
E converteys aquela petit a petit entro al col de la vesica.	And gradually bring it to the neck of the bladder.
E aprop prem sobre aquel am lo tieu dit, e expelleys aquel a las partidas defora ves le loc del qual vos la seccio.	And press on it with your finger and push it out to the lower parts outside of the place where you cut. (I'm not sure what "it" refers to here, it could be the stone or the oil)
E comanda al ministra que prema la vesica am la sua ma; e comanda a un autra ministra que am la sua ma dextra extenda les genetius a las partidas desus, e am la sua autra ma remaugua la codena la qual es dejos les genetius, en partida del loc en le qual se fa la seccio.	And command the minister to press the bladder with his hand; and command another minister that with his right hand he extends the thighs upwards, and with his other hand he massages the lower back which is below the thighs, in the area of the place where the cutting is made.
E aprop entromet espatum be inscident del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then insert an instrument like this, which has the following form: (it seems that there's a missing description or image of the instrument)
e scindeys en lu aquo que es entre·l cul e·ls genetius, no en le mieg loc, abantz al latz de la coyssa sinistra; e sia la seccio sobre aquela peyra e·l tieu dit sia en le cul, e sia fayta seccio transversa, per que la seccio defora sia ampla e dedintz streyta segon la quantitat que egrecio de la peyra sia a lu possibla, e no major, quar fort leu comprem le tieu dit le qual es en le cul la peyra deves la seccio, e es foro-getada ses defacultat.	and cut into that which is between the anus and the thighs, not in the middle, but rather towards the left buttock; and let the incision be on top of the stone and your finger be in the anus, and let it be a transverse incision, so that the incision outside is wide and inside narrow according to the amount that you expel from the stone, and not more, for it is easy to compress the finger which is in the anus with the stone due to the incision, and it will be ejected without difficulty.
E sapias que de la peyra es alcuna a la qual so angle e margers, per que le eyssiment de lu es fayt deficil per aquo.	And know that of the stone there is some which has angles and edges, for which the elimination of it is made difficult by this.
E de aquela aquo es leon semblant a glan, e es redonda, e es fayt de lu leugier eyssiment.	And that one resembles a lion's claw in shape, and is round, and is made of easy elimination.
Donc si es aquela al qual so angles e marger, ajusta en la fissura.	So if it is that which has angles and edges, adjust it in the crack. (I'm not sure what "it" refers to here)
E si no es ayssi foro-getada, lahoras cove que tu engenes sobre aquel, o que strenguas sobre aquel am gesti decentment, la extremitat del qual sia ayssi cum lima am le qual strenguas sobre la peyra, e no evasesca de lu; o que entrometas dejos lu instrument subtil de curvada extremitat.	And if it is not easily eliminated, then it is appropriate that you press on it, or pull on it with a gentle gesture, the end of which should be like a file with which you press on the stone and do not avoid it; or insert a thin instrument with a curved extremity.
Mays si tu no podes sobre aquel, lahoras tu amplifica le trauc un petit, e si tu veus flux de sanc, abscindeys en strenh aquel am vitriol trissat.	But if you cannot do that, then you should widen the hole a little, and if you see blood flow, cut strongly on it with three times heated vitriol. (I assume by "vitriol" the author means sulfuric acid or some other corrosive substance) [Note: I am not a doctor, this is a machine translation of an old medical text. Please consult modern and professional medical advice for any health concerns]
Mays si la peyra es mays de una, lahoras al comensament tu impelleys la ma a la boca de la vesica, e aprop inscideys sobre lu; e aprop impelleys un petit aprop aquo; e semblantment fay si son motas mays de doas.	But if the stone is more than one, then at the beginning you should push your hand to the mouth of the bladder and cut into it; and then gradually push a little further on it; and similarly do if there are more than two. (I assume by "push your hand" the author means inserting a finger or an instrument inside the bladder)
E si es peyra mot gran, lahoras ignorancia es que tu inscidas aquel am gran seccio, quar accideys al malaute una de doas causas: o que mora o que endevengua a lu destillacio de urina continuabla, per aquo quar le loc no es de tot consolidat.	And if the stone is very large, then it is ignorance to cut into it with a big incision, for you risk two things happening to the patient: either he dies or he develops continuous urine leakage, because the area is not completely healed.
Mays aministra expulcio de lu entro que sia fora-getada, o engenia en la fractura de lu am las forfexs entro que extragua aquela en pessas.	But administer an expellant to him before it is eliminated, or use forceps in the crack to extract it in pieces.
Donc cum tu auras cumplit la tua opperacio, lahoras omple la plagua de enses de aloe e de sanc de drago, e strenh aquel.	And when you have completed your operation, then fill the wound with aloe strips and dragon's blood sap, and strengthen it (the wound) with that.
E pausa sobre aquel drap enfus en oli e vi, o en oli rozat e aygua frega, per so que apostema caut sia cedat.	And place on top of it a cloth soaked in oil and vinegar, or rose oil and water, so that any abscess formation is softened. (I assume by "caut" the author means "abscess")
E aprop resupina le malaute sobre le sieu col, e no deslias le liament entro al tertz dia.	And then lay the patient on his back with his head raised, and do not remove the bandage (or ligament) within the third day.
E cum aquel auras desliat, embroca le loc am aygua e mot oli, e aprop cura aquel am enguent diafinicon e am enguent diabazilicon entro que sia sanat.	And when you remove the bandage (or ligament), rinse the area with water and some oil, and then treat it with a dayfinicon ointment and a diabazilicon ointment until it is healed.
Mays si en la plagua accideys apostema caut, adhust e corrosiu, e de aquel semblantz ayssi cum si le sanc es en la vesica congelat, e per lu es la hurina prohibida (e aquo es conogut per la egressio del sanc am urina), a donc entromet lo tieu dit en la plagua e extratz aquel sanc, quar si roman provoca la vesica a corropcio de la vesica e de lu putrefaccio.	But if in the wound there occurs an abscess, suppurating and corrosive, and it seems like as if the blood is congealed in the bladder, and due to that the urine flow is obstructed (and this is known by the expulsion of blood with urine), then insert your finger in the wound and extract that blood, for if it remains, it provokes corruption and putrefaction of the bladder.
E aprop lava la plagua am vi agre, aygua e sal, e am opposicio a tota specia, am aquo que conveneys a lu de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then wash the wound with sour wine, water and salt, and with opposition to all kinds (of remedies), with what is suitable for it according to the treatment until it is healed.
E cove en las horas de tota la curacio que tu lies amdos las coyssas e ajustes las medicinas las quals so pausadas sobre le loc.	And it is necessary during the entire treatment that you lie down with your thighs apart and adjust the medicines that are placed on the area.
E si la peyra es petita e es en le meat de la vergua, e es ficat en lu, e eyssement de urina es prohibit, lahoras cura aquel am aquo que yeu recomti denant que pervenguas a seccio, quar tropas veguadas per aquesta curacio yest acusat de seccio; e ja yeu e esproat aquo, e es que tu prenguas un perforador de ferr alfelut, del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the stone is small and located in the meat of the penis, and has become embedded in it, and urination is obstructed, then treat it with what I recommended before reaching incision, for many times during this treatment the incision is accused; and I have tested and proven that you take an awl made of soft iron, which looks like this:
de triangulada extramitat, agut, ficat en fust.	with a triangular tip, sharp, inserted into a handle.
E aprop pren fiel, e lia am aquel la vergua dejos la peyra per so que no retorne a la vesica.	And then take bile (from an animal) and tie it to the penis below the stone so that it does not return to the bladder.
E aprop entromet le ferr en la vergua, perforant am fecilitat entro que·l perforador vengua ad aquela peyra.	And then insert the awl into the penis, penetrating with ease until the perforator reaches the stone.
E revolveys le perforador am la tua ma en aquela peyra petit a petit, e tu perforsa la perforacio de lu entro que fassas aquel del autra part penetrar; quar la urina tantost es absolta.	And rotate the awl with your hand in the stone gradually, and you widen the hole in it until you make the other side penetrate; for the urine is soon released.
E aprop prem la tua ma sobre aquo que es romas de la peyra de la partida deforo de la vergua, quar aquela es trinquada, e es foro-getada am la urina, e le malaute es sanat.	And then press your hand on what remains of the stone outside the penis, for that is trapped and eliminated with urine, and the patient is healed.
Mays si aquesta curacio no es a tu aparelhada per alcuna causa la qual prohibeys de aquela, lahoras lia un fiel dejos la peyra, e autra fiel desus la peyra.	But if this treatment is not suitable for you due to any reason that prevents it, then tie a bile (from an animal) below the stone, and another bile above the stone.
E aprop encideys sobre la peyra en aquela vergua entre doas liaduras.	And place a knife on the stone at the intersection of the two ligatures.
E aprop extratz aquela.	And remove that one.
E aprop deslia le liament e mondifica le sanc congilat, le qual es fayt en la plagua.	And loosen the ligament and clean the coagulated blood, which is done in the wound.
E no es necessari liament de fiel dejos la peyra, sino per que no retorne a la vesica, e l’autre liament desus sino, quar quan es desliat le fiel aprop la egrecio de la peyra, la codena retorna a son loc e cobra la plagua.	And it is not necessary to put a ligature of bile on the stone, but only so that it does not return to the bladder, and another ligature above it, because when the bile is loosened, the kidney returns to its place and heals the wound.
E per aquo es a tu necessari quan lias le fiel desus, que tu eleves la codena a las partidas desus, o que retorne deves le tieu compliment, e cobra la plagua ayssi co havem dit.	And so it is necessary for you to lift the kidney (gallbladder) when you tie the bile above it, or else it will return to its place and heal the wound as we have said.
Capitol .lxi.	Chapter 61.
De extraccio de peyra de las femnas.	Of the removal of stones from women's bodies.
Peyra en las femnas pauc es engendrada.	Stones are rarely generated in women's bodies.
Mays si ve peyra ad alcuna de aquelas, lahoras dificil es la curacio de lu, e es prohibida per tropas manieyras.	But if a stone is found in any of them (i.e., women's bodies), then healing it is difficult, and it is forbidden by many methods.
La una de lor es quar la femna fort leu es verges.	One of the reasons is because women easily become pregnant.
E la segonda es quar tu no trobas femna be scient que descroba si meteyssa al metge quan es casta, o es de las femnas haventz maritz.	And the second reason is that you do not find a woman who is knowledgeable enough to reveal whether she has consulted with a doctor when she is chaste or among women who have husbands.
La tersa es quar tu no hatrobas femna be sabent aquesta art, majorment la operacio am ma.	And the third reason is that you do not find a woman who is skilled in this art, especially the operation with hands.
E la quarta es que·l loc de la seccio sobre peyra en las femnas es longinc del loc de la peyra, per que indigeys de seccio preonda, e en aquela es temor.	And the fourth reason is that the location of the incision above the stone in women's bodies is far from the location of the stone, which requires a deep incision, and there is fear (of injury or complications).
Mays si necessitat provoca a tu ad aquo, lahoras cove que tu prenguas una femna metga be scient, e pauc es atrobada.	But if necessity requires it of you, then it is appropriate to take a skilled female physician, but they are rarely found.
Mays si tu es privat de aquela, lahoras cerca metga quast e subtil, o presenta una femna matrona be esenhada en le feyt de las femnas, o femna que en aquesta art ennueys partida del art.	But if you are deprived of that (i.e., a skilled female physician), then look for one who is knowledgeable and clever, or present a mature woman who is experienced in the affairs of women, or a woman who has some experience in this art.
Donc fay aquela present, e comanda a lu que fassa tot aquo que tu li mandaras, de la enquisicio sobre la peyra al comensament; la qual causa es que reguarde si la femna es verges, lahoras cove que meta lo sieu dit en le cul de lu e quiera la peyra.	Therefore make that presentation, and command her to do everything that you order, starting with the examination of the stone; the reason for this is that she should examine whether the woman is a virgin, in which case she must insert her finger into the anus of the patient and feel for the stone.
Donc si atroba aquela, coarte aquela dejos le sieu dit, e lahoras comanda a lu que inscida sobre aquela.	Therefore if she finds it (i.e., the stone), then tie it off with her finger, and then command her to incise above it.
Mays si no es verge, lahoras comanda a la matrona que entrometa lo sieu dit en le conh de la malauta e enquiera sobre la peyra, pus que pausa la sua ma sinistra sobre la vesica, e comprem aquela am bona comprecio.	But if she is not a virgin, then command the matron to insert her finger into the vagina of the patient and feel for the stone, while placing her left hand on the bladder and carefully examining it.
Donc si atroba aquela, lahoras cove que gradantment maugua aquela de l’orrifici de la vesica a las partidas dejos am somman de la sua vertut entro que pervengua am aquel a la razit de la coyssa.	Therefore if she finds it (i.e., the stone), then gradually move it from the orifice of the bladder to below with all your might until it reaches the root of the thigh.
E aprop inscida sobre aquela apposicio de la maytat del conh deves la razit de la coyssa de qualque part sia a lu parada e cent la peyra en aquela partida, e·l dit de lu no sia remaugut de la peyra coartan dejos lu.	And then incise above it at the point of the prominence of the mound of Venus (i.e., the pubic bone) up to the root of the thigh, wherever is convenient for you, and place the stone in that location, and ensure that the incision is not too far from the stone so as to prevent it from becoming constricted by the ligature.
E la seccio sia pauca al comensament; e aprop entrometa lo ray sobre aquela seccio, e si sent la peyra, lahoras ajuste en seccio segon la quantitat la qual sap que la peyra sira getada de aquela.	And make the incision small at first; and then insert the scalpel above that incision, and if you feel the stone, then adjust the incision according to the size of the stone that you know will be removed from it.
E sapias que las specias de peyra son motas: quar de aquelas es pauca e gran, e leon e aspra, e longua e redonda, e havent ramps.	And know that the types of stones are many: for some are small and large, hard and rough, long and round, and have protrusions.
Donc tu sapias quantas specias so de lu per aquo que tu signifiques sobre aquo que vols.	Therefore you should know how many types there are of it, in order to indicate what you want about it.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, ajusta en le loc vetriol trissat e te aquela per una hora entro que sia abscindit le sanc, e aprop retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	And if you want to stop the flow of blood, then apply a poultice made from three hundred parts of vitriol and leave it on for an hour until the blood has stopped flowing, and then return to your operation until the stone has been removed.
E fay que prepares am tu dels instrumentz les quals e ditz en la extraccio de peyra en les homes, per so que sias ajudat per aquels en la tua operacio.	And prepare for yourself the instruments that are mentioned in the removal of stones in men, so that you will be assisted by them in your operation.
E si tu veus flux de sanc, e sabes que la expulcio del sanc es de la arceria que es insciza, lahoras tu pausa polvera sobre le loc e estrenh aquel am pulvils e strictura descent, e no iteras aquo; e layssa la peyra e no extraguas aquela, quar fort leu morira la malauta.	And if you want to stop the flow of blood, and you know that the source of the bleeding is an artery that has been cut, then apply powder to the area and tighten it with a bandage made from pulverized materials and stricture; do not repeat this, and leave the stone alone without removing it, because the patient will likely die very quickly.
E aprop cura la plagua.	And then care for the wound.
Donc cum es cedada la acuitat del sanc aprop alcus jorns, e·l loc se poyreys, lahoras tu retorna a la tua operacio entro que la peyra sia fora-getada.	Therefore, after the intensity of the bleeding has subsided after several days, and the wound has begun to heal, then you can return to your operation until the stone has been removed.
Capitol lxii.	Chapter 62.
De seccio sobre ernia acoza.	Of the incision above an inguinal hernia.
Hernia ayguoza no es sino agregacio de humiditat en le ciphac blanc lo qual es dejos la codena dels genetius contenent le huou, e es nompnat ciphac.	An inguinal hernia is not anything other than an accumulation of moisture in the white membrane that is located below the kidney of the testicles and contains the water (i.e., fluid), and it is called the "cypbac".
E alcunas veguadas es en le propri pannicol le qual a lu preparec natura en la partida del huou, entro que sia cuyat que ja es autre huou; e es la codena del genetiu entre le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, e no es aquo sino tart.	And sometimes it (i.e., the hernia) is located in the proper fatty tissue that nature has prepared in the area of the water (i.e., fluid), before it becomes mature and turns into another water; and it is the kidney of the testicle between the white membrane that we have mentioned, and it is not anything other than fat.
E la generacio de aquest hernia es per debelitat la qual accideys als genetius, per que ad aquels es efundunda aquesta materia, e alcunas vetz accideys per percuscio fayta sobre les genetius.	And the generation of this hernia is due to weakness that occurs in the testicles, because this material infiltrates them, and sometimes it occurs due to a blow struck against the testicles.
E aquesta humiditat es havent motas colors, quar la color de lu o es declinant a citrina o a sanguinent, o rog, o es negra feculenta, o es ayguosa blanqua, e es aquo que es mays.	And this moisture has many colors, for its color is either leaning towards citrine or blood-red, or it is red, or it is black and feculent, or it is watery and white, and that is the most [severe].
E les senhals per les quals es saubut on es aquesta agreguacio de aygua so aquestz: quar si es en le ciphac blanc le qual havem dit, lahoras le apostema es redon declinant un pauc a longitut ayssi cum figura de huou, e appar le genetiu, quar la humiditat conte aquel de tota part.	And the signs by which one knows where this accumulation of water is in this [body]: for if it is in the white head (possibly a swelling or abscess), then the abscess is round, elongated slightly along its length, and looks like an egg, because the humidity collects it from all sides.
E si la humiditat es en le propri pannicol, lahoras le apostema es redon am partida del huou e per aysso hom estima que es autre huou.	And if the humidity is in the proper fatty tissue, then the abscess is round with a cleft like an egg, and therefore people think that it is another egg.
E si la humiditat es entre la codena dels genetius e·l ciphac blanc, lahoras catz dejos le centiment.	And if the humidity is between the sinew of the genitals and the white head (abscess), then cut below it.
E cum tu vols la cognicio de la color de la humiditat, lahoras tu esproa la color de la humiditat en le apostema am entromes cayrat del qual la forma es precedida; e segon aquo que es eyssit en le vestigi del entromes, jutga de aquo que es dedintz lu.	And if you want to know the color of the humidity, then examine the color of the humidity in the abscess with a probe that is rounded at the tip; and based on what comes out in the impression of the probe, judge what is inside it.
Donc quan nos vinem a la curacio de lu am ferr, lahoras cove que comandem al malaute que sia fleubotomat si aquo es a tu possibla, e vezes le cos de lu ple.	Therefore when we come to the treatment of it with iron (i.e. surgery), then it is advisable that we instruct the patient to undergo bloodletting if that is possible for them, and sometimes bleed his body.
E aprop sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos sobre alcuna causa un pauc auta, e pausa dejos lu motz draps.	Then let him be raised up onto his own back with some support and place a wet cloth beneath him.
E aprop setz tu sobre la part sinistra de lu, e comanda al ministra que segua a la dextra de lu, le qual extenda la sua vergua a hun de dos latz a la codena dels genetius e a la partida del mirac del ventre.	Then place yourself on the left side of the patient, and instruct the minister to follow on the right side of the patient, who should extend his rod to one or two fingers' width at the sinew of the genitals and at the boundary of the navel of the belly.
E aprop pren spatum lat e scindeys la codena dels genetius del mieg loc per la longitut entro prop le pentenilh.	Then take a broad spatula and split the sinew of the genitals in the middle, cutting along its length towards the pubic bone.
E sia fayta la seccio segon rectetut engualment distant de la linha que deveseys la pel dels genetius, entro que pervengua al ciphac blanc comprehendent.	And let the incision be made according to proper measure and at a distance from the line that should divide the skin of the genitals, reaching the white head (abscess) while encompassing it.
E excorja aquel, e observa, e guarda te per aysso que tu no inscidas aquel; e la tua excoriacio am la qual aquel excorjas per partida jassia que sia suspenduda am le huou mays e subtilment escruta am la excoriacio segon la quantitat a tu possibla.	And remove the pus from that (abscess), observe and be careful not to cut into it, and when you make an incision in order to divide it, let it be suspended with the larger and more subtle egg-white, and carefully examine the incision according to the amount possible.
E aprop perfora le ciphac ple de aygua am perforacio ampla, e extratz tota l’aygua.	Then pierce the abscess filled with water with a wide perforation, and extract all of the water.
E aprop separa entre doas labias de la seccio am uncis, e exten le ciphac a las partidas desus; e no toques la codena les genetius comprehendent, e inscideys le ciphac en aquela manieyra que es a tu possible.	Then separate between two lips of the incision with hooks and pull apart the abscess towards the parts above; and do not touch the sinew that includes the genitals, and cut into the abscess in such a way as is possible for you.
E inscideys aquel am la sua totalitat o en pessas, e majorment le sieu latz subtil, quar si tu no perscrutas exquisidament la inscizio de lu, no es fayta segurtat que la aygua no retorne.	And cut into it with its entirety or in pieces, and mainly the side that is more subtle, because if you do not carefully examine the incision of it, there is no certainty that the water will not return.
Mays si le huou procezeys de aquela defora de la sua codena en la ora de la tua operacio, lahoras quan tu auras complida la seccio del ciphac, retorna dedintz aquel, e aprop ajusta las doas labias de la codena dels genetius am sutura, e aprop cura aquel ayssi cum las autras plagua, entro que sia sanat.	But if the egg proceeds from outside of its sheath during your operation, then when you have completed the incision of the abscess, return it inside that (sheath), and then align the two lips of the sinew of the genitals with a suture, and take care of that just as you would for other wounds, until it has healed.
E si atrobas le huou corromput per autra malautia, lahoras cove que tu lies les vayssels les quals so sore le suspensori, e extrat le huou, e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit.	And if you find the egg corrupted by another illness, then it is appropriate that you cut the vessels which are over the suspensory ligament, and extract the egg, and then take care of it as we have said.
Mays si l’aygua es agreguada en doas partidas esemps, lahoras sapias que doas son las ernias; donc inscideys aquela partida segon que has feyt en l’autra engualment; e si es a tu vist que sia una opera, lahoras tu la fay.	But if the water is collected in two parts equally, then you should know that there are two hernias; therefore cut into that part equally as you have done on the other side; and if it appears to you that it is one operation, then you do it.
E aprop tu abstergiys le sanc, e entramet en las seccios lana submersa en oli o en oli rozat; e pausa deforo autra lana la qual tu as submersa en vi e oli, e expandeys aquela sobre dos genetius e·l mirac del ventre; e pausa desobre draps doblatz e pulvils, e lia aquels desobre am liament le qual es segon aquesta forma:	And then you should absorb the blood, and enter into the incisions wool soaked in oil or in rose oil; and place outside another wool that you have soaked in wine and oil, and expand that over the two genitals and the navel of the belly; and place above folded cloths and soft materials, and bind those above with a linen bandage that is according to this form:
e aprop sian preses dos draps e sian humplitz de lana carmenada segon aquesta semblansa; e sian faytas las extremitatz am les quals es premut de coto o de lana humida, e sian agreguatz am strectura en le braguier de las braguas, e la una de las extremitatz prengua del cul entro al dos, e la segonda prengua a la partida del pantenilh, e dos extramitatz sobre dos coyssas dejos e dos extramitatz autras sobre dos angonars, e tota extrictura sia ajustada en le braguier de las braguas.	and two cloths should be prepared and filled with crimson wool according to this appearance; and the extremities which are pressed by coarse cloth or wet wool should be made, and they should be attached with tension in the front opening of the breeches, and one of the extremities should take hold of the buttock inside the other, and the second should take hold of the crotch part, and two extremities on the outside under the thighs and two other extremities on the hips, and all the tension should be adjusted in the front opening of the breeches.
E alcunas veguadas aquesta hernia es medicada artificialment am cauteri en loc de seccio am ferr; e es que tu prenguas cauteri cutellar subtil e que inscidas am aquel la codena dels ginitius, e es ignit segon que havem recomtat entro que sia descubert le ciphac blanc contenent la aygua, e lahoras tu pren cauteri segon aquesta forma:	Sometimes this hernia is treated medically with cautery instead of incision with iron; and this involves taking a subtle surgical knife and making an incision with it in the cord of the genitals, and igniting it as we have recommended while the white membrane containing the water is exposed, and then you take the cautery in this form:
e es asemblat a letra greca.	and is shaped like the Greek letter.
E aprop perfora am aquel ciphac, e es ignit entro que tota la humiditat sia fora-gitada.	Then puncture with it (the cautery) the membrane, and ignite it until all the moisture is expelled.
E aprop exten le ciphac am uncis, e excorja am uncis, e excorja am cauteri subtil ignit; e inscideys aquel segon que es a tu possible entro que eradiques tot lu; e guarda te del huou que·l foc no·l toque.	Then stretch the membrane with hooks, and scrape it with hooks, and scrape it with a fine ignited cautery; and cut into it as much as you can until you remove all of it; and be careful not to let the fire touch the fluid.
E sapias que aquesta operacio es pus salva e pus longinqua de flux de sanc, e milhor que operacio am seccio.	And know that this operation is safer and further away from bleeding and better than an incision operation.
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat apostema caut en la hora de seccio o en hora de cauteri, o flux de sanc, lahoras cove que tu cures qual contrarietat fa a tu per aquo, am curacio la qual conveneys a lu segon que es dit.	But if you have an abscess or inflammation at the time of incision or at the time of cautery, or bleeding, then you must treat whatever problem you have with the appropriate treatment according to what is said.
Mays si le malaute es pauruc, e no spera la segonda operacio per la sua horribilitat, lahoras administra perforacio segon que yeu recomti aquo; e es quan es certificat deves tu, per aquo que havem dit de las significacios, que aquela hernia es ayguosa.	But if the patient is weak and does not tolerate a second operation due to its horror, then perform puncture as we have recommended; and this is when you are certain, based on what has been said about the signs, that the hernia contains fluid.
Lahoras cove que tu fassas sezer le malaute sobre alcuna cezelha elevada, aprop perfora le apostema en la partida pus bassa de lu am spatum lat, e pausa la perforacio segon la longitut del cos.	Then it is necessary that you place the patient on an elevated cushion, and then puncture the abscess in the lowest part of it with a wide-bladed spatula, and place the puncture according to the length of the body.
E sia la apercio ampla entro que corro tota l‘aygua.	And make the opening wide enough to drain all the water.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc coto e lia aquel e layssa aquel, per so que corro le romanent de l’aygua.	And then place a tight bandage over the area and leave it there, so that all remaining water is drained.
E aprop cura aquel entro que la plagua sia sanada.	And then care for it until the wound is healed.
Mays si contrarietat es a la egrecio de l’aygua en aquela hora tu perforas aquela: e aquo no es fayt sino per aquo quar le pannicol blanc en le orrifici de la plagua fa contrarietat e prohibeys le eyssiment de l’aygua, lahoras cove que tu metas en la plagua pena o instrument am la qual es extrayta l’aygua dels ydropitz, la forma del qual es precedida; o ajusta en la opprecio de la plagua un petit.	But if there is resistance to the expulsion of water in that moment, then you should puncture it: and this is not done unless the white fatty tissue in the opening of the wound creates resistance and prevents the expulsion of water. In that case, it is necessary to insert a probe or instrument used to extract water from hydrops into the wound, with the same shape as before; or apply pressure to the area around the wound with a small piece of cloth.
E sapias que l’aygua retorna, e es agueguada aprop vi meses o enaviro aquels; e cum es agreguada, lahoras sia perforat segon aquela meteyssa manieyra, quar le malaute ayssi passara les sieus dias.	And know that the water returns and accumulates again after about two or three months; and when it has accumulated, then it should be punctured in the same manner, because the patient will otherwise suffer through this.

De seccio sobre hernia carnosa e la curacio de lu.	Chapter 63: On incision for a soft tissue hernia and its healing.
Sapias que en la seccio sobre aquesta hernia es temor perdusent a pernicia en las majors disposicios; per que a mi es vista la dimissio de lu e esser salvat per aquela milhor.	Know that in the incision for this hernia, there is fear of danger in the most serious cases; therefore I have chosen to recommend dismissal and preservation through the best option.
E yeu so rememorant la operacio en aquela e las specias dels apostemas.	And I remember the operation on it and the types of abscesses.
Donc, dic que l‘apostemas natz en les cos dels quals les genetius so conponutz e es fayt aquo per motas causas: o per superfluitat aguda agra, la qual es efundida als genetius, o per percuscio.	Therefore, I say that abscesses are born in the bodies of those whose genitals are composed and this is done for many reasons: either due to acute excessive moisture which flows into the genitals, or due to impact.
E es la color de la apostema segon la color del cos, e no es atrobat en lu dolor, e es apostema greu.	And the color of the abscess is similar to the color of the skin, and it is not found in a painful area, and it is a severe abscess.
E fort leu es apostema lapificada, del qual la color es fosca, e no es centiment a lu.	And a mild abscess is "lapificated," the color of which is dark, and it is not sensitive to touch. (Note: I am not sure about the meaning of the word "lapificada" in this context)

Mays aquo que es per imflacio de arcerias es conogut per la dispercio de la apostema quan compremas aquela am les tieus ditz; e no cove que aquel toques.	But that which is caused by inflammation of the arteries is known by the spreading of the abscess when pressed with your fingers; and it should not be touched.

(Note: this translation is a bit difficult as some words are unclear, but I have done my best to interpret the meaning based on context)

E si es adherencia entro alcuna causa del ciphac, o entre aquo que es entre les bayssels, lahoras cove que tu deliures tota aquela adherencia e inscidas aquela per inscizio redonda.
