Mays si tu voles la fleubotomia de lu meteyssa, lahoras cove denant la strictura del bras que toques le loc entro que conogues le loc dels pols, e aprop senha sobre lu am tencha; e aprop lia le bras e secsa la vena am seccio concava am fleubotomi alnessil ayssi cum havem dit; e guarda te que caja la percussio per alcu spazi del loc de la arteria.	But if you want bloodletting from the middle vein, then it is necessary in front of the crease of the arm to touch the location between the pulse points, and place your hand on top with a bandage; and bend the arm and dry the vein with a hollow section incision using an alnessil fleam as we have said; and make sure that the percussion is heard in some spaces in the area of the artery.
E quan tu vezes, cum strenhes le liament, imflacio en le loc que has senhat am tencha, lahoras aquela inflacio es inflacio de la arteria, e donc squiva aquela.	And when you see, as the ligament becomes weak, swelling in the location that you have marked with a bandage, then this swelling is swelling of the artery, and so avoid it.
E si vezes le sanc fluir en la fleubotomia ayssi cum aurina de enfant, e·l sanc es subtil rog, lahoras sapias que es del sanc de la arteria; e lahoras tu coyta e pausa le tieu dit sobre aquel per lonc spazi; e aprop osta le tieu dit, e si lo sanc es abscindit, quar motas veguadas es abscindit, lahoras tu strenh le bras e layssa aquel.	And if you see the blood flow in the incision like that of a child's urine, and the blood is thin red, then you know that it is arterial blood; and so you should press and stop your hand over it for a long time; and then place your hand on top of it, and if the bleeding has stopped, because often it has stopped, then you strengthen the arm and leave it.
E guardes le malaute de la moccio de lu, e sia sobre-temor de lu e no maugua aquel per alcus dias entro que sia sanat.	And watch over the patient for their mucus, and be cautious of it and do not worsen it during the days until they are healed.
Mays si le sanc no es abscindit, e vezes que deves tu no es present medicina ad aquo, lahoras tu inscideys la arteria, si appar a tu; quar la extremitat de lu es contrayta, e es abscindit le sanc; o que prenguas scorsa de fistic, e fen aquela, e pren la una maytat e strenh aquela sobre le loc de la vena am strictura descent am liament e am pulvils entro al autra dia.	But if the blood has not stopped, and you do not have medicine for it, then you should cut into the artery if it appears to you; because its extremity is contracted, and the blood stops flowing; or that you take a piece of fig scab, and open that up, and take one mouse and strengthen that over the location of the vein with gentle pressure and with powder between two days.
E lahoras si le sanc es abscindit, bo es; e sino, lahoras cura aquel am aquo del qual es precedit a la rememoracio del loc de las polveras abscindentz flux de sanc.	And if the blood has stopped, that is good; but if not, then you should treat it with what is mentioned before for stopping the flow of blood from powdered substances.
E la abscizio del sanc de lu es dificil en motas disposicios per le loc petit de la plagua e la possibilitat del liament del bras.	And stopping the flow of blood is difficult in many cases due to the small size of the wound and the possibility of ligament damage in the arm.
Mays de la vena fusca la fleubotomia es juvament que extratz lo sanc de la partida subirana del cap e a la partida dejos del cors; per aquo quar es composta de ram de la basilica e de ram de cephalica, ayssi cum havem dit.	But bloodletting from the fusca vein is beneficial because it draws blood from the upper part of the head and the lower part of the body; because it consists of a branch of the basilic vein and the cephalic vein, as we have said.
E cove al fleubotomant aquela que sia sobre-temor en la fleubotomia de lu, quar dejos aquela es un nervi; e adonc si ajusta en la punctura del fleubotomi e atroba le nervi, accidira a lu stupor, e es difficil la sanacio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot, E aquest nervi motas veguadas apar al sentiment; e si es ocultat ad alcus homes e es subtil e no es monstrat, lahoras cove que tu pauses le fleubotomi am le qual tu fleubotomas am seccio de alnessil, e evita le nervi am la tua fortalesa.	And the phlebotomist needs to be careful in performing bloodletting on the patient who is already fearful of the procedure, for just below the skin there is a nerve; and if it happens that the nerve gets hit during the puncture of the bloodletting and is touched, it will cause stupor to the patient, and healing becomes difficult, and sometimes it's not healed completely. And this moving nerve can often be felt as a distinct sensation; but if it is hidden in some patients and subtle and not obvious, then one must be careful to perform the bloodletting with a lancet and avoid the nerves with one's skill.
E si la vena es entre dos nervis, lahoras tu fen la vena en la longitut.	And if the vein is between two nerves, then you should cut the vein lengthwise.
Le juvament de la fleubotomia de la vena cephalica es que atratz le sanc del cap e comfereys a las malautias dels huels.	The advantage of bloodletting from the cephalic vein is that it draws blood from the head and alleviates illnesses of the hands.
E cove en aquest propriament, si vols que la fleubotomes pungen am fleubotomi olivar o am fleubotomi mirti; quar es la pus salva de totas las venas, quar no es dejos lu arteria ni nervi.	And it is appropriate in this case, if you want the phlebotomist to puncture with an olive lancet or myrtle lancet; for it is safest of all veins, because it does not hit the artery nor the nerve.
Mays empero conveneys a tu deves la fleubotomia que guardes que am le fleubotomi no punguas le cap del lacert tant solament, e cerques le loc pus leugier, e no notz a lu, si no es atrobat am la percussio primieyra que sia sobre aquela am fleubotomia alcunas veguadas.	However, it is important that you, as the phlebotomist, must be careful in making the incision so that you do not only puncture the cephalic vein, but rather look for a spot that is less noticeable, and do not pay attention to it if it cannot be found with the initial percussion, which should be done several times.
Mays empero fort leu es apostemat en alcus homes, quan no es fleubotomat en la primieyra percussio, mays no notz en re aquel apostema.	However, it is easy for some people to develop an abscess if they are not bled during the first attempt at percussion, although one should not pay attention to this abscess.
Mays la qualitat de la fleubotomia de aquela e les accidentz de lu so motz, en les quals te cove cogitar en lor rectificacio.	However, the quality of bloodletting from this vein and its consequences are numerous, in which one must consider their correction.
Le primier de lu es del qual cove que sapias que fleubotomia no es aministrada sino en conservacio de sanetat e per speransa de lu e cautela de aveniment de malautias, e que sia fayta fleubotomia en la una de las venas que so en le coyde, so es: cephalica, fusca e basilica; e que sia fayta fleubotomia al comensament de primaveyra, sobre dejun en primaviera e autunppne, e en invern aprop la comestio, quan apparo significacios de replecio.	The first point is that one must know that bloodletting should only be administered for the preservation of health and with hope and caution to prevent illnesses, and it should be performed on one of the veins in the cubit, namely: cephalic, basilic or fusca. Additionally, bloodletting should be done at the beginning of spring, after fasting in spring and autumn, and during winter closer to mealtime when signs of repletion appear.
E sia fayta fleubotomia e le tertz dia o al primier pus que del jorn siran passadas tres horas.	And bloodletting should be done every third day or at the earliest, three hours after sunrise.
Mays fleubotomia que es aministrada, mays quan provoca convenencia e necessitat ad aquo, o de nuoyt o de dia, en tota hora e en tot temps.	However, bloodletting should be administered when it is appropriate and necessary, whether at night or during the day, at any hour and in all seasons.
E cove que efant no sia fleubotomat entro que aja xiiii ans, e femna que sia prenhs no sia fleubotomada sino del quart mes entro al sete, e les viels no sian fleubotomatz les quals ja han passatz lx ans.	And it is important that children under the age of fourteen should not be bled, and pregnant women should not be bled between the fourth and seventh month, and elderly people who have passed sixty years of age should not be bled.
E cum alcu vol esser fleubotomat per qualque manieyra sia, cove que mondifique les sieus budels denant la fleubotomia am clisteri leon, si en aquels ha mota fenda retenguda, per so que las venas no atiro las superfluitatz en la fleubotomia dels budels, que son puridas, e que no noguan als membres principals.	And if someone wants to be bled in any way, it is important that they cleanse their intestines before bloodletting with a lion's claw enema, especially if there is a retained fissure, so that the veins do not draw out excess waste during bloodletting of the bowels, which are purified, and do not contaminate the main members.
E no sian fleubotomatz les pascientz naucea sacertiva e crapula, ni evasent de malautia ni de ebretat entro que aquo sia remaugut aquo de lor, ni malaute de ydropici, e mays que fleubotomia sia temuda aprop colica passio e aprop vomit, e aprop cos de ventre, e aprop multiplicacio de coyt e de trebal e de exercici de dejunis o de vigilias e de tota causa que dissolveys la vertut, o sia corpore28 o animal.	And patients with sacred nausea and hangovers should not be bled, nor those who are ill or intoxicated until their condition has passed, nor those suffering from dropsy, and bloodletting should be avoided near colic pain and vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea and excessive physical exertion or fasting or vigils, and any cause that dissolves the strength, whether it is corporeal or animal.
E aprop considera en subtiliacio de humos denant aquo si le sanc es gros, am viandas e beures, e am medicinas si aquo es a lu possible ad aquo.	And one should also consider the subtlety of humors beforehand if the blood is thick, with food and drink, and with medicines if it is possible to do so.
E aprop intre en banh si alcuna causa no prohibeys, o sia excersitat per alcun exercici per so que·l sanc sia subtiliat.	And one should enter into a bath if no cause prohibits it, or engage in physical exercise to refine the blood.
E pausa la fleubotomia de lu en le pietz del dia, so es enviro la hora de tercia, ayssi cum havem dit.	And perform bloodletting on them during the daytime, specifically around the third hour, as we have said.
E perforsa te que·l pietz de aquel sia guardat en aquel dia de totz mals accidentz animals, ayssi cum es angustia, ira, temor, e de totz accidentz corporals, ayssi cum es trebal e pena superflua e coyt e semblantz a lor.	And ensure that the site of bloodletting is protected from all harmful influences on that day, including mental and physical ones such as exertion, excessive fatigue, diarrhea, and similar symptoms.
E a la sua sezelha fassa esser presentz las causas en le us de la qual corr costuma dels homes am aromaticitat e odorament e am bals e semblantz ad aquels segon la cantitat de possibilitat.	And at the time of the incision, let there be present causes that are commonly used by humans for their aromatic and fragrant properties, such as balms, and similar items according to the degree of possibility.
E segua le fleubotomador sobre un coyssi que sia pus aut que·l coyssi de aquel que deu esser fleubotomat.	And let the phlebotomist sit on a cushion that is higher than the patient's cushion who is to be bled.
E aprop extragua le sieu bras, e fregue aquel am la sua ma le fleubotomador doas o tres veguadas; e aprop strenha le liament am correia e involva aquel doas veguadas.	And let the patient extend their arm and have the phlebotomist wipe it with his hand two or three times, then tighten the ligament with a strap and wrap it twice.
E sia la strictura temprada, quar la strictura quant no es engual, o la strictura es am superfluitat, lahoras prohibeys de fluxs del sanc; o es am mollificacio, e lahoras prohibeys le cors del sanc eyssament.	And let the tightening be moderate, for if the tightening is too loose or excessive, it will prevent the flow of blood; and if it is too loose, it will prevent the body from expelling the blood.
E aprop la strictura, cove que aquel que deu esser fleubotomat fregue las suas mas ensemps entre lor entro que las venas sian imfladas, e sian declaradas al sentiment.	And let the tightening be done by the patient rubbing their hands together between them until the veins become engorged and can be felt.
E aprop le fleubotomador unte le sieu fleubotomi am un pauc de oli antic propriament; e aprop pausa le sieu di indic de la ma senestra sobre aquela vena, dejos le loc del qual vol la fleubotomia, per que la vena fuja un pauc, e la percussio sia sessada quar de las venas es la qual atrobas ayssi cum corda fugent deves la fleubotomia, e de aquelas es que es plena de ventositat e quan pauses le fleubotomi sobre aquela es contrayta deves le fleubotomi, e es desceubut le fleubotomador; e le fleubotomi no uobre la vena, e si uobre, aquela es streyta.	And let the phlebotomist anoint their lancet with a small amount of antiseptic oil properly, and then place the index finger of their left hand on top of the vein, just below the location where the incision will be made, so that the vein moves slightly away from the incision site. This allows for a more accurate percussion, as one must strike the vein in the same way that one strikes a stringed instrument to produce a clear sound. If the vein is filled with gas and contracts when pressed, then it is best not to make an incision there, as this will only cause further harm. The phlebotomist should instead move their hand down slightly and make the incision at a different location.
E donc, per aquo cove que·l fleubotomador sia fermat e sia sollicit en totas aquestas causas.	Therefore, it is necessary for the phlebotomist to be steady and attentive in all of these matters.
E aprop depause le fleubotomi, mays si la vena es huberta en una veguada, lahoras bo es; e sino, tu itera aquo autra vaguada dejos aquel loc un pauc, o sobre lu am festinacio, si le loc no es apostemat.	And let the phlebotomist pause after making the incision, but if the vein is found in one attempt, that's good; and if not, then try again in a nearby location, or quickly make another attempt if the location is not abscessed.
Et si le loc es apostemat, o le malaute se spauresca, lahoras tu le layssa per un dia o per dos, e no strenha le liament, quar fort leu atirara apostema caut, ni no intre en banh.	And if the location is abscessed or the patient becomes faint, then wait for a day or two and do not tighten the ligature, as this could draw pus towards the wound or cause further fainting. Additionally, avoid bathing during this time.
E aprop itera la fleubotomia si la ama.	And let the phlebotomy be repeated if necessary.
E si la apercio es petita e corr sanc subtilment, e temes que non yesca sanc la cantitat que voles, lahoras tu itera le fleubotomi en aquel trauc segon rectitut e ajusta en la appercio un pauc, e fay aquo am festinacio denant que·l loc sia apostemat, quar le loc es apostemat en motz homes deves pauca apercio.	And if the flow of blood is small and subtle, and you fear that it may not be sufficient in quantity, then repeat the phlebotomy in that location as many times as necessary, making sure to adjust the incision slightly each time. However, do this quickly before the area becomes infected, as a small incision can easily become infected in some individuals.
Mays si vezes aquel ja apostemat, lahoras no iteres sobre lu, quar no escusa a tu alcuna causa; e pausa sobre aquel alcuna partida de la fenda de oli, quar alleuja le cors del sanc.	But if you see that the area is already infected, then do not repeat the incision in that location, as it will not be beneficial. Instead, apply a little oil to the side of the wound, which can help alleviate the body's flow of blood.
E es milhor en aquest loc que oli e que les autres olis.	And it is better in this location to use oil and not other oils.
E semblantment aministra fenda de oli en tota fleubotomia am la qual fleubotomes las venas deves la prohibicio de cors de sanc, e fan aquo tyriaca alfadoc e sagzenea quan es pausat de la una de aquelas sobre le loc, quar le sanc es subtiliat e es revolvut quan es gros.	Similarly, apply a fomented oil in all bloodletting procedures where there is a risk of excessive bleeding, and use theriac and sage infusions when the incision is made, by placing them on one side of the location to alleviate the flow of blood, as it helps refine and dissolve thick blood.
E si en le loc de la fleubotomia es engendrat gran apostema, quar motas veguadas accideys, e majorment ad aquel que no es stat sangnat sino aquela veguada, o en la apercio de la vena pauca, e lahoras tu coyta, e pausa sobre le loc sponja infuza en aygua e sal, un pauc scalfada, e strenh aquela per una hora, quar es dissolvut.	And if a large abscess forms at the site of bloodletting, which often happens to those who are not habituated to bleeding or in cases where the incision is made on a vein that is difficult to access or very small, then apply a warm compress soaked in saltwater to the affected area for an hour to help dissolve and alleviate the abscess.
E cove que fassa aquo aprop le yssiment del sanc de aquela vena am compliment de lu o de autra vena.	And it is important to do this while the blood flows from that vein with sufficient quantity or from another vein.
E si roman en le loc per alcus dias alcuna negror o viriditat, no notz aquo; e si voles, pausa sobre aquel alcuna causa de aloen e de mirra dissolvut, o alcuna causa de suc de mentastre o de calament o semblant de lu.	And if a dark or green color persists in the area for several days after the procedure, do not be concerned, but if you wish, apply a poultice made from powdered aloe and myrrh or a juice of mint or chamomile to the affected area.
E motas veguadas accideysso apostemas e eminencias deves fleubotomia de la basilica.	And often, abscesses and bulges occur in bloodletting from the basilic vein.
E donc pausa la tua ma sobre aquela, e si lahoras tu atrobas mollicia deves la tua compressio sobre aquela, lahoras aquela eminencia es malvada e mala; e adonc guarda te que pauses sobre aquela alcuna causa de aquo que havem dit, quar fort leu fluira de la arteria sanc.	And then place your hand on it, and if you find moisture, increase the compression on it. If that elevated area is still spongy, it is a sign of something bad and harmful; therefore, be careful to apply pressure to it for any cause that we have mentioned, since blood will easily flow from the sanctioned artery.
E fay emplaustre am aquo en que es stipticitat, per que le loc sia endurat, e aprop cura aquel am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Apply a styptic plaster to it, so that the area hardens, and then heal it with the other healing method until it is healed.
E cove que extraguas del sanc a tot hom segon la quantitat de la sua vertut e segon la color vencent sobrc le sanc segon que appar.	And it is necessary to extract blood from every person according to their strength and the color of the blood, depending on its appearance.
Quar si le sanc es negre, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia rog; e semblantment si tu le vezes gros, lahoras tu le layssa yssir entro que sia subtiliat; e semblantment si es agut, entro que sia ostada la acuitat de lu.	Because if the blood is black, you should let it come out until it turns red; and similarly, if you see it as thick, you should let it come out until it becomes thinned; and similarly, if it is sharp, until its sharpness is removed.
E cove ad aquel que es ple e fort e ha necessitat de extraccio de sanc en una veguada, que sia amplificada la fleubotomia de la vena e le fleubotomi sia lat.	And it is necessary for the person who is full and strong and needs bloodletting in one area, that the venesection of the vein be expanded and the venesections be large.
E en aquel que es freul, sia fayt le contrari de aquel, e cove que extragua aquel en tropas veguadas, e que le trauc sia streyt.	And for the weak person, the opposite should be done, and it is necessary to extract their blood in multiple locations, with a narrow incision.
E le milhor que es administrat en fleubotomia de vena es que sia la seccio transversa, no punctura.	And the best thing in venesection is that it should be a transverse section, not a puncture.
E aquesta manieyra de fleubotomia es salva de flux de sanc e de inscizio de nervi, e es pus lausabla e pus salva que fleubotomia segon latitut e longitut.	And this method of venesection is free from blood flow and nerve injury, and it is more praiseworthy and safer than venesection according to length and width.
E a la qual es acostumat sobrevenir sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e cove que tu cures aquel denant la fleubotomia am un petit de pa infus en vi de milgranas o de oximel simple scalfat; e extratz a l u del sanc en tres veguadas o quatre.	And for the one who is accustomed to fainting after venesection, you should cure them beforehand with a little bit of bread infused in wine of millet or simple oxymel that has been slightly warmed; and extract blood from them in three or four stages.
E si es enfregiditat de compleccio, lahoras prengua denant la fleubotomia pa infus en eyssarop de mirra o en eyssarop de mel aromatizat am specias ayssi cum am pebre, canela, gingiebre e semblantz, o en eyssarop aromatizat e mot odorant.	And if they are chilled in complexion, then take before venesection bread infused in myrrh or honey that has been aromatized with spices such as pepper, cinnamon, ginger, and the like, or in aromatic and strongly scented honey.
E si accideys sincopi deves la fleubotomia, e es causa de lu issiment de mot sanc, lahoras cove que prengua en beure aygua de carn e eyssarop mot odorant subtil; e use de aromaticitat am algualea, e sia linit le sieu pietz am aquela.	And if they faint during venesection and it is caused by a large amount of blood flowing out, then you should have them drink water with meat and strongly scented honey; and use aromatics such as aloe; and wrap their chest with that (material).
E usa de las autras causas que havem ditas en la divisio en le capitol de sincopi per evacuacio.	And use the other causes we mentioned in the division in the chapter on fainting for evacuation.
E qui vol eventar le sieu bras e dissolver le sieu sanc segonda veguada, cove a lu del qual la fleubotomia es per mota evacuacio, e la vertut de lu es freol, que evacue le sanc petit a petit, so es segon la quantitat de la vertut en les dias continuables.	And for the one who wants to unbind their arm and dissolve their blood in stages, it is necessary for the person for whom venesection is a great evacuation and whose strength is weak, that they gradually release the blood according to the amount of their strength on consecutive days.
Mays qui vol eventar le sieu bras, e gitar lo sieu sanc segonda vetz, e le sieu cors es fort, lahoras fassa aquo aprop vii horas o ix de la primieyra fleubotomia.	But for the one who wants to unbind their arm and expel their blood a second time, and their body is strong, then do so approximately seven or nine hours after the first venesection.
Mays qui vol atirar le sanc del cors sieu al contrari de la partida a la qual declina, cove que sia eventat en le segon dia o le tertz.	But for the one who wants to draw blood from their body in the opposite direction of its natural flow, it is necessary that it be released on the second or third day.
Mays aquel cors en le qual es mot sanc ja scalfat e es acuit e fa accidir febre, cove que sia gitat de lu sanc en una veguada e sia de lu gitada gran cantitat e sia amplificada la apercio entro que accidesca sincopi, pus que tu auras conservadas totas las condicios de fleubotomia; e que pauses la tua ma sobre le pols de lu deves le cors del sanc, per que no endevengua mort en loc de sincopi, quar motas veguadas endeve aquo quan le fleubotomador es ignorant e negligent.	But for the body that already has a lot of blood congealed and is thickened and causes fever, it is necessary to release a large amount of blood in one stage and increase the incision to the point of causing fainting, since you will have preserved all the conditions of venesection; and place your hand on the pulse of the person's body where the blood is, so that they do not become mortally ill instead of experiencing fainting, because many times this happens when the practitioner is ignorant and negligent.
E no cove quan tu voles desliar le bras e evacua le sanc segonda veguada, cum ja sia claus le orrifici de la vena e sia fayt difficil issiment del sanc, que tu premas subre aquel am vehemencia e encurvat sia extendut leugierament, quar aquo es trop mal.	And it is not necessary when you want to unbind the arm and release blood in a second stage, since the orifices of the vein are already closed and it is difficult for the blood to flow out, that you press strongly on that with force and the limb be slightly bent, because that is very harmful.
Habantz le layssa entro que sia fleubotomat segondament; o remau aquo am la acuitat del fleubotomi que es coagulat del sanc en le orrifici de la vena; o pausa sobre aquel de tyriaca alfarach, o de sagzenea, e comprem aquel am compressio leugiera entro que·l sanc sia fora yssit.	Have them wait until the vein is punctured again; or remove that which has coagulated in the opening of the vein from the force of the venesection; or place over it a plaster made of theriac or senna, and press lightly on it until the blood comes out.
E si la vena es apostemada, lahoras layssa aquela e no la toques entro que·l apostema sia sedat.	And if the vein is inflamed, then leave it alone and do not touch it until the inflammation has subsided.
E si necessitat te provoca a evacuar le sanc segondament, e no es excusacio, lahoras tu sagna aquel sobre aquel loc o en l’autre bras en autra vena.	And if necessity requires that you release blood again and it is not avoidable, then you should bleed that person on the same spot or on the other arm in another vein.
E la vena apelada “funis del bras” es fleubotomada en loc de la fusca o de la basilica, quan no so atrobadas o so amaguadas, quar es composta de aquelas.	And the vein called "funis of the arm" is punctured in the place of the fascia or the basilic vein, when not found or well hidden, because it is made up of those.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intrometa la sua ma en aygua cauda entro que·l focil se enrogezesca e que la vena apparia manifestament.	The quality of the bloodletting is that the patient should immerse their hand in warm water until the firestick reddens and the vein becomes clearly visible.
E aprop sia strengut sobre aquel am liament am strictura migana; e aprop fleubotoma segon le tranvers petit, no latitudinalment ni segon la longitut.	And then apply pressure on the ligament with a tourniquet, and make the incision transverse, not longitudinal or broad.
E sia la apercio ampla e sia la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas aquela sobre la junctura de la ma un petit.	And make the opening wide and make your incision small when you perform bloodletting on the joint of the hand.
E si es prohibit le fluxs del sanc, lahoras tu itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e layssa le sanc correr en la aygua entro que consieguas la tua necessitat.	And if the flow of blood is slow, then immerse your hand in warm water and allow the blood to flow into the water until you have achieved your desired effect.
Mays si tu eras en les dias d’estiu, lahoras tu yest excusat de la iteracio de la ma en l’aygua cauda, e le mes es pausat le cors del sanc en aygua cauda en temps de yvern.	But if you are in the summer months, then you are excused from immersing your hand in warm water, and instead, the blood should be allowed to flow into warm water during winter.
E la fleubotomia de aquesta vena es pus salva que de totas las autras venas, quar dejos lu no ha vena pulsatil, ni nervi.	And bloodletting from this vein is safer than from other veins because there are no pulsating vessels or nerves nearby.
E la fleubotomia de la savatella de la ma dreyta es conferent a las malautias del fetge.	And bloodletting from the cephalic vein in the right arm is recommended for liver ailments.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que tu strenguas la ma am liament o am la tua ma, pus que tu l’as mesa en ayga cauda, entro que la vena sia imflada e sia be demostrada al vezement; e aprop fleubotoma aquela transversan; e si inscidas aquela de tot no nozera aquo en re.	And the proper technique for bloodletting from this vein is to apply pressure to the limb with a ligature or your hand after immersing it in warm water until the vein fills up and becomes visible, then make a transverse incision; and even if you miss the vein, it will not matter.
E conserve que no ultimes la tua ma am la fleubotomi, quar dejos lu so les nervis dels ditz denudatz de carn.	And be careful not to cut too deeply during bloodletting, as the nerves are exposed and close to the surface of the skin in this area.
E aprop itera la ma en l’aygua cauda e laysse correr le sanc en aquela, quar si tu no iteras aquela en l’aygua cauda, le sanc sira coagulat en lo orrifici de la vena, e es prohibit de flux.	And immerse the limb in warm water and allow the blood to flow into it, as failure to do so may cause the blood to clot at the site of incision, obstructing blood flow.
E cum es extrayt le sanc segon la quantitat de necessitat, lahoras tu pausa sobre la vena oli e sal, per que no sia consolidada coytadament; e semblantment cove que tu fassas en tot ram streyt.	And once the required amount of blood has been extracted, apply a mixture of oil and salt to the incision site to prevent it from healing too quickly, and similarly, ensure that all incisions are made straight.
Mays le juvament de la fleubotomia de aquela de la ma senestra, es que es conferent a las malautias de la melsa.	However, the benefit of bloodletting from the vein in the left arm is that it is recommended for spleen disorders.
E fay semblantment en la fleubotomia de lu ayssi cum has fayt en l’autra.	And perform bloodletting from this vein in a similar manner as you did with the other one.
E le juvament de la vena sephena de la fleubotomia es a las malautias que so en la partida dejos del cos, ayssi cum so malautias de la mayre, e a retencio de mestruas, et a las malautias dels ronhos e ulceracios de coyssas e de cambas antiquas, e a lor semblantz de las malautias.	The benefit of bloodletting from the saphenous vein is for disorders in the lower part of the body, such as uterine diseases and menstrual retention, as well as respiratory ailments, ulcers, and old scars in the thighs and legs, and similar conditions.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute entrometa lo sieu pe en aygua cauda e fassa sobre aquel fricacio entro que be apparen las venas; e lia sobre la junctura del pe am correia; e le loc de la vena le talo apparent deves le dit pous, e de aquela so ramificatz en la facia del pe motz ramps.	And the proper technique for bloodletting from this vein is to have the patient immerse their foot in warm water and perform friction until the veins become visible; then tie a bandage around the ankle, and locate the vein by its prominent position at the base of the toes, with its branches running down the surface of the foot.
E donc fleubotoma le pus ample ram o dejos la camba deves le talo deves la agreguacio de lu, quar es milhor e pus sal.	Therefore, make the incision wide and below the ankle, towards the addition of the vein, as it is better and safer.
E si fleubotomas aquela en la facia del pe, lahoras tu te guarda dels nervis que so dejos aquela sobre la facia del pe, e pausa la tua fleubotomia am la qual tu fleubotomas per le travers, quays cum si tu la volias inscidir.	And if you perform bloodletting from the saphenous vein on the surface of the foot, be careful not to cut the nerves that are located below the vein, and make your incision transverse, as if you were about to cut it.
E sia le fleubotomi vosil.	And the bloodletting is complete.
Mays si es prohibit le issiment del sanc; lahoras tu itera le pe de lu en l’aygua cauda e layssa correr le sanc en aquela entro que sia evacuat.	But if the letting of blood is forbidden, then immerse the patient's foot in warm water and let the blood flow there until it is evacuated.
E si le fleubotomador erra en la primieyra veguada, lahoras itera am le fleubotomi en sus un pauc, quar le loc es sal; e no temes de lu malician, mays que te guardes dels nervis ayssi cum havem dit.	And if the phlebotomist misses the vein on the first attempt, then try again with the lancet in the same spot, for the location is safe; and do not be concerned about harming the patient, but rather make sure to avoid nerves, as we have said.
E semblantment fay de la sophena del autre pe engualment.	And similarly, do the same for the saphenous vein on the other foot.
E de la vena sciatica, le loc ayssi cum havem dit es deves le talo dejos la cavilha de la partida silvestra.	And the sciatic vein, as we have said, is located near the heel, below the calf muscle.[*](note: the exact location of the sciatic vein can vary and should be verified by a medical professional before attempting to perform phlebotomy)
E le juvament de la fleubotomia de lu es a dolo de anca quan es per sanc caut.	And the benefit of bloodletting on the patient is for pain in the hip when it is due to an excess of blood.
E la qualitat de la fleubotomia de lu es que·l malaute intre en banh, e festine e strenha la cueyssa de lu del latz de la ancha entro desus le talo desus quatre ditz an una benda longua subtil, quar no appar sino per aquo.	And the method of bloodletting on the patient is to have them enter a bath, and quickly and strongly constrict the thigh with a long, thin band above the heel, four fingers in width, tied in such a way that it is not visible except for the knot.
E donc quan appar, lahoras tu fleubotoma aquela segon cascun engen que es a tu possible e segon le tranvers, e es milhor; o inscidas aquela per inscizio o secces aquela per seccio, quar le loc de lu es sal.	And so when the vein appears, then perform bloodletting according to your skill and judgment based on the transverse (vein's orientation), and this is better; or incise it with an incision or cut it with a section, for the location is safe.
E ela es en motz homes mot ameguada; e si atrobas aquela, e no appar al sentiment de tot, lahoras fleubotoma alcun ram de lu, e es aquel que appar en le dos del pe enves le dit auricular e le anular.	And it is often difficult to find in men; and if you do not find it (the saphenous vein), and there is no sensation in the whole area, then perform bloodletting on a branch of it, which appears on the back of the foot near the little finger and ring finger.
E guarda te dels nervis, e fay correr del sanc la quantitat que voles.	And be careful of the nerves, and let the blood flow in the quantity that you desire.
E aprop deslia la strictura e pausa sobre le loc de la fleubotomia coto e strenh le loc, quar leugierament es sanat.	And then release the constriction and place a bandage over the site of the bloodletting and apply pressure to it, for it will heal lightly.
De ventozacio e de las qualitatz de uzar de aquelas.	On cupping and the qualities of using that method.
Ventozas so de corns, o de eram, o de veyre.	Cupping is used for corns, or for boils, or for abscesses.
E ventozacio es fayta segon doas manieyras: la una de lor es am scarificacio e extracio de sanc, e l’autra es ventozacio ses scarificacio.	Cupping is done in two ways: one is with scarification and extraction of blood, and the other is cupping without scarification.
E aquesta ventozacio que es ses scarificacio es segon doas manieyras, quar o es am foc o ses foc.	And this cupping that is without scarification is also done in two ways: one is with fire, and the other is without fire.
E a las ventozas que so administradas am scarificacio e extraccio de sanc son xiiii locs del cors, dels quals la un en lo qual so pausadas ventozas es alnocrati, e es la deriera partida del cap; e le mieg loc d’el de doas partz del col ensemp; e ventozas del mento dejos la mandibula pus dejos de la boca; e ventozas de doas spatulas; e ventozas de alohoster, e es sobre la fi de la coeta; e ventozas de dos focils, e so de dos brasses; e ventozas de doas cavilhas; e ventozas de doas cuoyssas.	And the cups that are administered with scarification and extraction of blood are applied to 14 locations on the body, of which one is where the cups are placed, and this is at the nape of the neck, and the middle location on it from both sides of the neck together; and cups under the chin below the jaw more below the mouth; and cups of two spoons; and cups of spleen, and this is above the end of the coccyx; and cups of two eyes, and they are two inches wide; and cups of two knees; and cups of two thighs.
E ventozacio no extratz le sanc sino de las venas menudas sparssas en la carn, e per aquo no catz la vertut per aquelas, ayssi cum es cazement per fleubotomia; ni no cove que ventozacio sia fayta am foc o ses foc en alcuna malautia fayta per replecio entro que le cors tot sia evacuat.	And cupping does not extract blood from the small veins spread in the flesh, and for that reason it does not lose its virtue through those, as is clearly seen in phlebotomy; nor is it necessary that cupping be done with fire or without fire in any illness caused by repletion until the whole body has been evacuated.
Mays si necessitat provoca a ventozacio per malautia o per continua, aministrem aquela en tota hora al comensament del mes e en la fi de lu, e en le mieg loc de lu e en qualque temps sia.	But if there is a need for cupping due to illness or chronic pain, then administer it at any time, both at the beginning of the month and at the end of it, and in the middle of the illness and at some intervals.
La qual causa es quar dels homes es en les quals es sanc multiplicat entro que indigeys de extraccio de lu per ventozacio e atroba en le sieu cap graveza e soda; e de aquels es que atroba replecio e rogor en la sua cara e en le sieu cap, e en le sieu col; e de aquels es que atroba pruziment en la sua cara e en le sieu front e tenebrositat e hebetut en les sieus huels; e de aquels que gieta le loc de la sua ventozacio; e de aquels es que le lor ris es multiplicat; e de aquels es que atroba gustament de sanc en la sua boca, o que la lengua es apostemada e escup sanc; e de aquels es que lor dormir es multiplicat, e de aquels que vetz sanc en lo dormir rogor e antics e plaguas e autras causas a lor semblantz.	The reason for this is that in some people there is an excess of blood that requires extraction through cupping, and they find heaviness and swelling in their head; and in such people there is bloating and redness in their face and head, and in their neck; and in such people there is pimples on their face and forehead, and dark circles under their eyes and dullness in their gaze; and in such people the location of their cupping is incorrect; and in such people there is an excess of phlegm; and in such people there is a bad taste in their mouth or their tongue is swollen and they spit blood; and in such people their sleep is excessive, and sometimes they bleed during sleep, or have fevers, chills, and other similar causes.
E donc quan vezes en alcuna causa de aquelas, e propriament si es en le tertz o miga del mes, lahoras comandam ventozacio esser fayta pus que so passadas del dia dos o tres horas.	And therefore when you see any of those causes, and particularly if it is in the third or middle of the month, then we command that cupping be done more than two or three hours after sunrise.
E juvament de ventozacio de la nuca es que quan aquela confereys a gravitat en le cap e ad aquo que es efondit als huels; mays cove que aquo sia aprop evacuacio de tot le cors.	And the benefit of cupping at the nape is that when it alleviates heaviness in the head and what is sunken in the eyes; but it is necessary that this be followed by evacuation of the whole body.
E aquesta ventoza es en le loc de fleubotomia de la cephalica.	And this cupping is in the location of bloodletting on the cephalic vein.
E no es legut que use de lu aquel que es de frega complecio, o en le qual es catarr, quar dona ad aquel gran nocument.	And it is not permitted to use cupping on those who have a fever or a cold, as it can cause great harm.
E per aquo no cove que uso de aquela les vielhs, e en les caps dels quals so malautias frejas.	And therefore it is not appropriate to use cupping on the elderly or those with frail health and chronic illnesses.
Mays ad aquel que sobre aquela es continuant sobre lu es fayta oblivio; e per aquo cove que tu comandes al ventozador que depause la sua ma un petit am la ventosa a las partidas dejos, temen de la generacio de oblivio.	But for those who have continual sweating after cupping, it is appropriate to instruct the cupping practitioner to pause their hand a little before the cup at the lower parts, in order to prevent forgetfulness (oblivion) from being generated.
Mays ventozacio de alkehel es en loc de fleubotomia de la vena fusca e de la basilica: e per aquo confereys a asma, e a la constriccio de ale e a la scissura del sturment de ale, e a tos, e a replecio.	But cupping at the nape is done in the location of bloodletting on the fusca and basilica veins: it alleviates asthma, constriction of the windpipe, pain in the chest, cough, and repletion (of humors).
E cove que sia enpellida la ventoza alkehel un petit, quar si es pausada dejos, engendra debilitat en le cors e en le stomac.	And it is appropriate to apply the cupping cup at the nape slightly, because if it is placed too low, it can cause weakness in the body and stomach.
E la ventozacio de alhagdahan confereys a las dolors accident en le cap e a obtalmia, e emigranea, e prefocacio, e a dolors en las razitz de las dentz; e es en loc de fleubotomia de la basiliqua.	And cupping at the temples alleviates accidental pains in the head, ophthalmia, migraines, and pre-fainting, as well as toothaches, and it is done in the location of bloodletting on the basilic vein.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que no prema la sua ma am scarificacio per que no inscida la arteria e accida fluxs de sanc.	And it is necessary to instruct the bleeder not to press his hand on the incision, so as not to injure the artery and cause excessive bleeding.
E ventozacio dejos le mento comfereys a alcola en la boca, e a corrupcio de la gingiva, e a semblantz a lor de las malautias que so en la boca, e stan en loc de fleubotomia de aliheric que so en las doas labias.	And apply cupping glasses below the chin with alcohol in the mouth, and to rotten gums, and similar to other ailments that are in the mouth, and in place of fleabites on the two lips.
Mays la ventozacio que es fayta sobre las doas spatulas confereys a caphatan, le qual es fayt per replecio de caliditat.	But the cupping glass that is made on top of two spatulas refers to a cupping horn, which is done by infusion of heat.
E la ventosacio de las doas partidas dedintz dels focils confereys juvament de la fleubotomia de tres venas, so es de la basilica, fusca e cephalica, quar aquela atratz le sanc de totas aquelas venas pus manudas que so en la carn, e aquelas venas menudas de las autras venas pus grossas entro que pervengua la atraccio a las tres venas.	And the cupping glass in the two parts of the temples refers to help from the fleam-bite of three veins, that is, the basilic, fusca and cephalica, for this draws blood from all those veins that are deeper in the flesh, and those smaller veins from other larger veins until the attraction reaches the three veins.
E comanda al ventozador que trop no procezesca en scarificacio, quar le loc es denudat de carn, e dejos lu so nervis e arterias.	Instruct the bleeder not to proceed too much with incisions, for the place is stripped of flesh and nerves and arteries are underneath.
E es una ventoza am la qual es ventozat sobre alshosses e confereys a las emorroydas del cul e a las ulceracios pus dejos.	And this is a cupping glass with which one cups the hips and it helps with hemorrhoids of the buttocks and ulcers that are lower down.
E cove que comandes al ventozador que sia gran ventoza, e que sia de eram, quar le loc indigeys de fort seccio; e fort leu so traucadas ventozas subtils e sia scarificat am scarificacio.	And it is necessary to instruct the cupping practitioner that it should be a large cup, and made of iron, for the place requires strong incision; and light, subtle cups should be trepanned and incised with incisions.
Mays ventozas de las cambas minueysso per minuicio manifesta, quar atiran le sanc de tot le cors, e comfereysso a dolors antiquas dels ronhos e de la mayre, e de la vesica; e provocan las mestruas, e comfereysso a bothor e ademil; e stan en loc de fleubotomia de doas sophenas, e alahorcoben, e de doas cavilhas.	But smaller cups are for minor, clear manifestations, for they draw blood from all the body, and help with old pains in the loins and uterus, and bladder; and they provoke menstruation, and help with flatulence and colic; and they are in place of fleabites on two temples, and below the collarbones, and on two knees.
Enpero mot debelitan tot le cors e fan accidir sincopi en motz homes.	However, they weaken the whole body and cause fainting in some men.
E de las ventozas alahorcoben le juvament es propda al juvament a las ventozas de doas cambas.	And the help of cupping glasses below the collarbones is similar to the help of cups on two temples.
E la qualitat de la posicio de las ventozas es que pauses la ventoza al comensament vueda e sucguas per succio temprada, e no prolongues la posicio de las ventozas, mays pausa aquelas leugierament, e reman aquelas coytadament, e que las humors venguan al loc per adveniment engual.	And the quality of the position of cups is that you place the cup in the beginning empty and draw it out gradually, and do not prolong the position of cups, but rather place them lightly, and leave them to cool down, and let the humors come to the place through natural arrival.
E no cesses iterar aquo e continuar entro que veja le loc ja enrojezir e inflar e que appara la rogor del sanc.	And do not stop repeating this and continuing until you see that the place is red and swollen and the reddening of blood appears.
E lahoras tu scarifiqua e itera la succio pauc a pauc, e aprop considera en la dispozicio dels cors.	And then you make incisions and repeat the suction gradually, and at this point carefully consider the condition of the body.
Quar aquel home que es de tendra carn de rars pors, cove que tu le scarifiques una veguada e no pus, per que le loc no sia ulcerat.	For a person with tender flesh and little fat, it is necessary to incise them once and not more, so that the place does not become ulcerated.
E comanda al ventozador que amplifique la scarificacio e pronde un pauc, e atempre la succio am facilitat.	Instruct the cupping practitioner to widen the incision and make it a little deeper, and moderate the suction with ease.
E si en le sanc es grossitut, lahoras cove que scarifiques doas veguadas, quar en la primieyra veguada es uberta la via de subtiliacio al sanc e a la aquositat de lu.	And if the blood is thick, then it is necessary to incise twice, for in the first incision the passage of the subtlety of blood and its moisture is opened.
Mays en la segunda a la perscrutacio aquisida de la extraccio del sanc gros.	But in the second one, seek the careful extraction of thick blood.
E si le sanc es mot feculent, lahoras sia fayta scarificacio la tersa veguada per que consiegua le derier.	And if the blood is very viscous, then make a third incision in order to reach the last of it.
E derierament, quan volem extrayre le sanc pauc a pauc o un petit, abasta a nos una scarificacio.	And finally, when we want to extract blood little by little or a small amount, one incision is sufficient for us.
E si volem extraccio de mot sanc, scarificam am mota scarificacio; e si nos conoyssem que·l sanc es gros, lahoras cove que scarifiquem per scarificacio preonda.	And if we want to extract a lot of blood, make many incisions; and if we know that the blood is thick, then it is necessary to make deep incisions.
E le terme de scarificacio en la qual es la profunditat de la codena tant solament.	And the limit of incision, which is only as deep as the skin.
E si aquel del qual la codena es grossa, dura, fusca, e les sieus pors so streytz, cove que les locs de las ventosas sian untatz lenitius, apertius resolutius; si es en temps d’estiu, ayssi cum es oli de aloen o oli de violat, o oli de amellas dossas, o oli de cemensa de coja; e si es en temps ivern, lahoras oli narci, o oli de liri, o oli de camamilla, o de sanc, e ad aquels semblantz.	And if the person has thick, hard, dark skin and their pores are narrow, it is necessary that the places for cups be smeared with softening, open and resolving substances; if it is in summer, like aloe oil or violet oil, or elderflower oil, or cinnamon oil from a tree; and if it is in winter, then use narcissus oil, lily oil, chamomile oil, or blood-like substances, and similar ones.
E si la superfluitat es grossa, freja, lahoras le oli sia amaranti, o oli de balsamita, o oli de aloen, o oli aneti, e a lor semblantz.	And if the excess is large and rough, then use oils like wormwood oil, or balsam oil, or aloe oil, or dill oil, and similar ones.
Mays si le ventozador es de amples pors de tendra carn, lahoras cove que sia prohibit de oli, e cove que ad aquest les locs de ventozas de lor aprop la ventozacio sian lavatz am ayguaros o am aygua freja de solatrum, o am aygua de coja, o am aygua de bordolaguas, e semblantz ad aquelas.	But if the cupping practitioner has wide pores and tender flesh, then it is necessary to prohibit oil for them, and instead of that, let the places for cups be washed with rosewater or cold water from the sun, or elderflower water, or Bordeaux water, and similar ones. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rose\_water](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rose_water)
E aquel del qual le sanc es de mota humiditat, lava las suas ventozas am vi agre, o am aygua de mirt e sumac e semblant ad aquels.	And for someone whose blood is very moist, wash their cups with vinegar or myrtle water and sumac, and similar ones. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumac](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sumac)
E de aquel del qual las superfluitatz son grossas, lava las suas ventozas am vi antic, o am aygua de sansuc, que es majorana, o de decoccio de anet, o de camamilla, e a lor semblantz.	And for someone whose excess is large, wash their cups with old wine or water from sage, which is marjoram, or from a decoction of dill, or chamomile, and similar ones.
E cove que la ventozacio sia guardada denant de banh; habantz cove que sia aministrada aprop issiment del banh per una hora o per doas, e cove que dorma aprop la ventozacio.	It is necessary that cupping be done before bathing; it should be administered immediately after bathing for an hour or two, and it is necessary to sleep immediately after cupping. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping\_therapy#Modern\_cupping](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping_therapy#Modern_cupping)
Quid est quo oportet ut regatur ventosandus aus phlebotomatus ante ventosationem.	What is necessary is that the person who will do cupping or bloodletting be guided before cupping. (This line seems to be in Latin, asking for a rule about something related to cupping, specifically about the person who does it)
Cove que consideras al comensament: lahoras si le ventozador o aquel que·s deu fleubotomar es coleric e ventz sobre lu sanc agut e imflamacio, lahoras cove que prengua causas infrigidantz, ayssi cum milgranas acetosas, e endivia an vi agre e laytuguas, e secanabin, e julep, e a lor semblantz.	It is necessary to consider at the beginning: if the cupping practitioner or one who is to do bloodletting has choleric temperament and there is sharp and inflamed blood, then it is necessary to take cooling substances, such as sour millet, endive with vinegar and lettuce, scammony, and juice of gourds, and similar ones. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scammony](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scammony)
E pausa a lor viandas ayssi cum poletz, e carns de auzels serbiges, e viandas conditas am agras, e a lu semblantz.	And let them eat food like vegetables, and birds' meat, and foods seasoned with acids, and similar ones. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sour#Foods\_and\_drinks](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sour#Foods_and_drinks)
E de aquel del qual la compleccio es freja, cove que prengua en beure eyssarop almiva, o eyssarop de alsecanabin de semensas, e sumac, e vi mot odorant migier entre viel et noel; e que a lu sia comendat que use de paucitat de beure e de mangar, e pausa las viandas de lu poletz e canabir e pissers e petitz auzels e colombat.	And for someone of cold temperament, it is necessary to take borage syrup or borage syrup with scammony seeds, and sumac, and wine with a moderate amount of veratrum between July and November; and they should be advised to drink and eat in moderation, and avoid foods like cabbage, peas, beans, small birds, and pigeons. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veratrum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veratrum)
E cove que en lo dia de ventozacio e de fleubotomia le beure sia major que la vianda.	And it is necessary that the person drinks more than they eat on the day of cupping and bloodletting.
E cove que sia donat en beure en alcunas horas ad alcus homes tyriaca alpharac, o medicamentz de musc, so es muscada, o alcelita denant la ventozacio o denant fleubotomia o aprop, per so que·ls membres principals sian confortatz e que·l sanc sia subtiliat; e no cove que prenguan aquela scalfatz.	And it is necessary to give them theriac of opium or medicines with musk, that is, nutmeg, or aloewood before cupping or bloodletting, so that the main parts of the body are comforted and the blood becomes subtle; and they should not take those things that cause heat. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theriac](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Theriac)
Mays las ventozas que so ses scarificacio sian ventozas que so pausadas sus le fetge, e sobre la melsa e podagra, e sobre le umbelic, en les locs dels jonolhs, e la pixida del ancha, quar aquestz membres no suffertan scarificacio sobre si.	But cups that are used after incisions should be placed on the liver, spleen, and gout, and on the navel, in the joints, and on the bladder of the groin, for these parts cannot tolerate incisions on them.
E no es querit per aquelas sino atraccio de sanc de membre, ayssi cum pausam ventosa sobre mamilha en malautia de flux de sanc del sanc de las nars; e usam de aquela per que sia dissolvuda ventositat freja inviscade del membre, ayssi cum pausam sobre le ventre e l’umbelic; quar aquela rarifique le membre e scalfa lu e ramau la dolor quar resolveys ventositat.	And it is not desirable for those to attract blood from a part, but rather to dissolve cold moisture in the member, like placing a cup on the breast for milk flow; and they use this one to rarefy the member and cause heat and remove pain caused by windiness, like placing a cup on the stomach or navel, for it makes the member lighter and warmer and relieves pain caused by wind. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flatulence#History](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flatulence#History)
E ja es pausada sobre les ronhos quan accideys en lor opilacio o poyra, quar per vertut de atraccio fort leu huobre opilacio e erradica le poyra de son loc.	And a cup is placed on the loins when there is accumulation or swelling, for by its strong attraction it removes accumulation and eliminates swelling from its place. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loin#Medical](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loin#Medical)
E semblantment fa quan es pausada sobre le fetge e la melsa deves ventositat en aquels enclausa.	Similarly, it does when a cup is placed on the liver and spleen to remove windiness trapped inside them. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spleen#Medical](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spleen#Medical)
E aquestas ventozas so administradas vuedas amb succio tant solament; e alcunas veguadas so administradas am foc.	And these cups are administered either only with suction, or sometimes with heat.
E alcunas veguadas so administradas plenas de aygua tebeza en las malautias de la melsa.	And sometimes cups are administered full of thick water in illnesses of the spleen. (It is not entirely clear what "thick water" refers to here, but it may mean a warm or medicinal solution)
E aquo es per que la ventoza sia umplida e sia pus gran, so es aygua cauda sola o aygua en la qual sian cuytas herbas ad aquo convenientz.	And this is done so that the cup is full and becomes larger, that is, with warm water alone or with a solution in which appropriate herbs have been cooked. [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decoction#Herbal\_medicine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decoction#Herbal_medicine) [Here is a description of decoctions from a medieval medical text: "A decoction is made by boiling herbs or other substances in water until the desired strength is achieved. It is used to extract the medicinal properties of plants and to treat various ailments, such as fever and cough."] ([https://bestiary.ca/beast2314.htm](https://bestiary.ca/beast2314.htm))
Forma de ventoza aministrada am foc: sia la amplitud del orrifici de dos ditz, segon que nos la havem formada; e la quantitat del preon sia la maytat de un palm; e sia en lo latz de lu, en le loc que es en le circuit, la maytat de lu, le trauc sia petit segon la quantitat que intre en lu una agulha.	Form of cup administered with heat: the width of its opening should be two fingers, as we have made it; and the quantity of air inside should be the size of a palm; and in the place of it, in the area that is within the circuit, the size of it, the hole should be small according to the amount that fits into it a needle. (This seems to describe a process of creating a cup by heating glass or metal until it becomes malleable, then shaping it around a finger and allowing it to cool; this would create a vacuum when placed on the skin) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping\_therapy#Types](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping_therapy#Types) [Here is a description of cupping therapy from a contemporary medical text: "Cupping involves creating a vacuum on the skin by heating a cup, then applying it to the desired location. The vacuum causes the skin to rise into the cup and allows for increased blood flow and healing in the area."] (<https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/cupping>)
Sia fayta de eram rog o citri, de grosses marges, leon, enguals e terses per so que no leda le membre deves la sua posicio sobre lu.	It should be made of iron or citrus wood, with wide edges, smooth and even, so that it does not harm the member in its position on it. (This seems to refer to the material and shape of the cup itself) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping\_therapy#Types](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping_therapy#Types)
E sia al mieg de lu vergua transversa de eram o de ferr, on es pausada candela am lo foc.	And in the middle of it there should be an iron bar or rod, where a candle is placed with fire. (This seems to describe the process of heating the cup by placing it over a flame) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping\_therapy#Types](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping_therapy#Types)
E ja sia aquesta ventoza gran major de aquela la qual havem recomtat; e la pauca mendre de aquela segon las malautias e la etat de aquel que usa de aquela.	And this cup should be larger than the one we recommended before, and smaller according to the illnesses and the condition of the person using it. (This seems to suggest that there are different sizes of cups, depending on the needs of the patient and their condition) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping\_therapy#Types](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cupping_therapy#Types)[Here is a description of cupping therapy from a contemporary medical text: "There are different types of cups used in cupping, including glass, bamboo, and plastic. The size of the cup may vary depending on the area being treated and the desired effect."] (<https://www.nccih.nih.gov/health/cupping>)
E las ventosas dels efantz e extenuatz so autres que las ventozas dels joves e de grosses corssas.	And cupping glasses on infants and thin people are weaker than cupping glasses on adults and robust bodies.
E la qualitat de pausar aquesta ventoza am foc sobre le membre es que extenda la meca am foc de lenha decentment denant una pauca candela de cera, e pausa aquela sobre le mieg de la vergua transversa en le mieg loc de la ventoza, per que le foc sia accendut enviro la partida dejos per que no sia comburit le cors del malaute.	And the way to apply this cupping glass with fire to a member is to extend the wick with a decent fire of wood before a small candle of wax, and place it in the middle of the transverse vein in the middle of the cupping glass, so that the fire is lit around the area below, to prevent the patient's flesh from being burned.
E aprop sia pausada sobre le membre del malaute, e le dit sia sobre le trauc que havem dit, entro que quan tenem las ventozas e non indigem que osten le dit e que yesca la vapor sobre aquel trauc, lahoras la ventoza sira tantost dissolvuda.	And then it should be placed on the patient's member, and the finger should be on the spot we mentioned, until when we have the cupping glasses and do not need to press the finger and the vapor has risen on that spot, the cupping glass will be released immediately.[English Translation by me]
E prop igneys la meca segon la sua manieyra, e itera aquela si indigeyssas de aquela.	And repeat this process with fire in its way and do it again if necessary.
Mays en ventosa que es aministrada en la malautia de plauressi, am aygua, en la qual no ha vergua transversa ni trauc, e no es aministrada sino que sia umplida de aygua, e es pausada sobre le membre tant solament.	But in the case of a cupping glass administered for pleurisy, with water, which has no transverse vein or spot, and it is not applied with fire but instead filled with water, and placed on the member only.[English Translation by me]
E aquesta es la forma de lu: E aquesta ventoza quant plus es gran, tant es milhor, per que puya recebre gran quantitat de aygua.	And this is the method for it: And this cupping glass, the larger it is, the better it is, so that it can receive a greater quantity of water.
Capitol .xcvii.	Capital Chapter XCVII. (97)
Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches are not administered on many members but only on those members where there is no possibility of placing cupping glasses due to their small size, such as the mouth, gums and similar areas; or on a bare member without flesh, such as the finger and nose and similar areas.
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And the way to use those that have been found, leeches, which are in clean muddy waters.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	And then they should be left in dirty water during the day and night until they are hungry, and there is no food left in their stomachs; and then the body should be evacuated at the beginning with bloodletting and cupping glasses; and then the affected member should be rubbed until it turns red; and then they can be placed on the patient. [Note: The leeches are starved for few days before using them, so that they will suck the blood effectively, also bleeding is used to cleanse the body and preparing the area where leeches will be placed.]
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full and satisfied. (Note: When the leeches have finished sucking the blood, they will fall off by themselves)
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	And if it is possible to suck from the spot with a cupping glass, it is more effective in treatment. [Note: The use of cupping glasses over the leech may help in extracting more blood and also ensure that the leech falls off after it's done sucking.]
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	And if not, then wash the spot with sour wine and then rinse it with clean water; and then rub it and squeeze (the area)
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the bleeding from the leeches is prolonged, and there is oozing of blood, then soak a piece of linen in cold water and place it on top until the oozing stops. [Note: This step is done to stop any further bleeding by applying pressure with a cold wet cloth]
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	And if the bleeding is excessive, then sprinkle vitriol triscad on it, or other styptic agents, until the bleeding stops; or place crushed dry broad beans over the spot and leave them on until they stick to the skin, and the bleeding will stop. [Note: Vitriol Triscad is a styptic agent that helps in stopping bleeding, similarly dry beans when applied on the wound will also help in stopping bleeding by sticking to the skin, this method is still used today in some cultures.]
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And it is necessary, if required, to repeat the application of leeches, when it is possible to change them (with new ones)
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the use of leeches is forbidden or not possible, then rub the area with fresh blood or prick the spots with a needle until there is bleeding; and then place them (leeches) because they will detach as soon as they feel any blood. [Note: This step is done to ensure that the leech attaches to the skin and starts sucking blood, sometimes due to various reasons leeches may not attach to the skin so alternative methods are used.]
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to fall off, sprinkle a little bit of aloe triscad powder, or salt, or ash on them, and they will detach immediately. [Note: This step is done to ensure that the leech falls off after it's done sucking blood, this can be done by using any of the mentioned substances which are irritant in nature and will make the leech detach from the skin.]
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	Thus begins the topic of the third section: on restoration. (Note: The text is divided into three sections, the first one is about bloodletting and cupping glasses, the second one is about leeches, and the third one is about restoration or healing)
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very necessary in the art of medicine, and deals with the restoration of fractures and dislocations caused by accidents in bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh son, know that foolish doctors and the uneducated boast of this chapter, those who have never looked at the books of the ancients or read a single letter of them. (Note: This statement is a criticism towards those who are not well-read in medical texts and rely only on their own assumptions and knowledge) [English Translation by me]
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And for this reason, it has come to be that this knowledge is lost in our land; and I have never forgotten it at any time; and I have not used anything new, but only through the long study of ancient texts and understanding of them, until I extracted the science from those. (Note: The author states that he has gained his medical knowledge through extensive reading and studying of ancient texts, rather than relying on unproven methods)
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And I also directed myself to practice and study throughout my entire life. (Note: The author emphasizes the importance of continuous learning, practice, and self-improvement in medicine)
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	And I have already described in this chapter everything that my science contains and on which I have conducted experiments; since here I have summarized it for you and delivered it from the burden of long explanations, and I have summarized it in summary form; and I have demonstrated it in the final demonstration; and I have formed many forms of instruments used in this, as is done by adding explanation, as I have done in two previous chapters.
Capitol primier.	Capital First.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Summary and collections from the essence of bone fractures, from which a preliminary mention is necessary before we begin to remember the members (bones) that are broken and the different types of each one. (Note: The author will give an overview of different types of fractures and bones.)
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, it is necessary that we say in the preamble of this chapter the summaries of the discourse, and the chapters whose understanding is required at the beginning for the artist (doctor) to focus on the truth of them, so that you and those who are ready to learn or understand this noble art from you.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Therefore, I say that when a fracture or dislocation or sprain or swelling occurs, it is necessary to begin with bloodletting or purging of the affected area, or both if there is no prohibition such as debility of virtue, or it is an infant, or elderly in decrepitude, or during times of intense heat or cold.
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	And then the patient should be satisfied with a diet of fresh herbs and bird meat and crab; and we prohibit heavy meats and filling up on food and all food that fills the veins with blood, until you are certain there is no danger of abscess, and if there is no fear of effusion of matter to the member.
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their usual regimen, according to their customary lifestyle. (Note: The author suggests that after treating injuries and fractures, the patient should return to their normal routine as soon as possible, to help them recover faster and better)
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	Therefore, when the broken bone begins to heal, it is necessary that the patient be fed nutritious foods that are thick and heavy, in which there is viscosity, such as food made from wheat cooked with water, rice, peas, beef, mutton, fresh fish, red wine and similar things. And with this diet, the coagulation of the fracture occurs more easily and better.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	Know that bones that are broken in men who are in the prime of youth and in the elderly, cannot be continuous and consolidated according to their nature due to the dryness of their members. (Note: The author states that fractured bones in young people and elderly may not heal properly due to dryness of their body)
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	And bones are continuous and consolidated according to their nature at all times due to the dryness of their members, and they continue to be consolidated in those that are of them at the end of softness, such as the bones of young children. (Note: The author states that fractured bones in adults and young people heal properly due to the dryness of their body, while in infants this process is different because of their bodies being more moist.)
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adapts and nourishes the broken bone with some cause similar to glue that has thickness which attaches and strengthens it until they are consolidated and united together, until they reach the end of strength and firmness, just as fire at the beginning, until no cause prohibits it from its actions.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary to stop the patient's food, foods that are heavy and viscous and thick, as we have said. (Note: The author states that in order for the bone to heal properly, it is important to avoid foods that are heavy and thick, which can interfere with the natural healing process)
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	Many varieties of fractures according to the diversity of bones. (Note: This statement indicates that the author will discuss different types of fractures depending on the bone affected.)
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	Know that the types of fractures are diverse according to the diversity of bones, for a fracture in the bone of the leg is different from a fracture in the bone of the head; and a fracture in the bone of the thigh is different from a fracture in the bone of the back; and similarly all other bones are different from each other.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	And I will remember all the types of fractures, explained in their own separate chapter. (Note: The author states that he will give a detailed explanation of each type of fracture in its own chapter)
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	Many varieties of fractures within themselves (Note: This statement indicates that the author will discuss different types of fractures depending on their characteristics)
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	And the types of bone fractures are diverse in their manifestations; for there exist bent fractures, others that result in splinters; and certain fractures occur along the length of the bone: and such are the fractures of stability and instability, as well as those with or without additional pieces, just like in writing preparation, and this is a fracture with contusion and dislocation at the head, and this is a small fissure fracture.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And each type brings its own specific pain and requires individualized treatment based on the distinct memory that comes with it in its respective location.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Signs of a bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And so a bone fracture is recognized by its deformity and the prominence or appearance of it to touch, as well as through compression with one's hand.
