Capitol .xxvii.	Chapter 27.
De curacio de dislocacio del coyde.	Chapter 27: Treatment of Hip Dislocation.
Sapias que la junctura del coyde es dislocada am difficultat e semblantment retorna am difficultat; e aquela es dislocada a totas partidas, e majorment a la partida denant a la partida detras, e la dislocacio de lu no es amaguada a tu quar es cazent dejos le vezement o dejos le tocament segon qualque figura sia dislocat, e quan ajustes le coyde disloguat am le sa, aquo es a tu declarat manifestament, quar la junctura es concavada e no pot doblar le bras, ni tocar am aquel le sieu muscle.	You should know that the hip joint is difficult to dislocate and equally difficult to set back in place; it can become dislocated in any direction, but most commonly at the front or back. The dislocation will not be hidden from you, as it will be evident whether the leg is bent or twisted in a certain way depending on how it is dislocated. When you adjust the dislocated hip joint with your hand, it should be clear to you that the joint is concave and cannot bend the arm or touch its own muscle.
E cove que·t coytes, e reduzescas la dislocacio tantost denant que vengua a lu apostema caut, quar si ve a lu apostema caut, dificil es la reduccio de lu, e fort leu no es sanat de tot; e majorment quan es a las partidas detras, quar pus mala es de totas las autras specias de dislocacio, e de major dolor, e motas veguadas deyssen am aquela la mort.	It is necessary to act quickly and reduce the dislocation before it becomes infected with purulent matter (abscess), as this will make reduction difficult and may lead to incomplete healing. This is especially true for dislocations at the back, which are more severe than other types of dislocation and can be accompanied by significant pain and a high risk of mortality.
E la restauracio de lu, quan es aquela que es possibla reduzir, es que la ma de lu sia extenduda am doas mas, e le bras de lu sia expandut, e las mas del metge sian sobre le coyde e dejos lu, e el empellisca la junctura am les pouzes de las suas mas ensemps, o am la razit de la sua palma entro que torne en son loc.	The restoration of the dislocated hip joint, when it is possible to reduce it, involves extending the patient's leg with two hands, spreading their arms apart, and placing the hands of the medical practitioner on the affected area while applying gentle pressure. This can be done either by pushing the joint back into place using the fingertips or the palm of the hand. The goal is to guide the joint back into its proper position safely and effectively.
Mays si la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras retorna ayssi que dobla la ma am la sua ma, entro que percuta le coyde am la razit de la sua palma.	But if the dislocation is at the front, then return it by bending the leg towards the patient's chest until the heel of the hand strikes the hip joint.
E si la dislocacio no obezeys a la reduccio, lahoras aministra vehement extencio e mot fort.	And if the dislocation does not respond to reduction, then administer strong and forceful extension.
E es que dos ministres extendan le bras, e tenguan aquel eyssament dos ministres per so que no sia remaugut deves la extencio.	And have two assistants hold the arms and two others maintain traction to prevent it from slipping back during extension.
E aprop sia revolvut le bras deves tota part, pus que es envolopat drap doblat lonc sobre la ma de lu, o liament.	And then rotate the arms in all directions, as they are wrapped with long folded cloth or bandages around the patient's hands.
E quant le metge toca la junctura am la sua ma, unte aquela am alcun oli per so que aquo sia aquelas causas las quals ajudan en lubricitat de la junctura am facilitat; e aprop empellesca la junctura am empulcio vehement entro que retorne.	And when the medical practitioner touches the joint with their hand, anoint it with some oil to facilitate its movement and ease of reduction. Then apply firm pressure until it returns to its proper position.
E aprop la reduccio de lu cove que sia pausat sobre aquela empastre en le qual sia stipticitat e excequacio am album de huou, e sia extrenhut am strictura descent, e·l bras sia suspendut del col, e sia layssat per alcus dias.	And for the reduction of it (the hip joint), a plaster with styptic and astringent properties made from albumen (egg white) should be applied, and the leg should be held in place with a bandage that is not too tight. The affected limb should be suspended from a sling around the neck, and left to rest for several days.
E aprop sia desliat; e donc si la junctura es formada en le sieu loc, lahoras tu deslia le liament de lu e layssa aquela.	And then it should be loosened; and so if the joint has returned to its proper position, then you can release the ligament and leave it alone.
E si vezas la junctura no be strenher, lahoras tu itera le emplastre e·l liament, e layssa aquela per alcus dias entro que sia extrenhuda; e aprop deslia aquela.	And if you see that the joint is not strengthening, then reapply the plaster and ligament, and leave it on for several days until it has healed; and then release it.
Mays si accideys a lu gravitat aprop la reduccio de la junctura, e la disposicio de lu es en movement, lahoras aministra humectacio en banh e fricacio subtil, e comprecio, entro que sia aleujat; o pausa sobre la junctura aleliati, so es coyssa de moto grassa; e aprop sia liada, e layssa aquela sobre le os le dia e la nueyt.	But if there is excessive weight or difficulty in reducing the joint and the patient's condition is unstable, then administer gentle hydrotherapy and mild friction massage with compression until symptoms are relieved; or apply a compress of warm fat to the affected area, then bandage it and leave it on for a day and night.
E aprop osta aquela, e met aquel en banh; e quan suza, lahoras tu fregua la junctura am fricacio temprada, e aprop itera sobre aquela aleliati, so es ronhonal de moto, una veguada, e la segonda, e la .iii.a.,	And then apply that (the compress), and place the patient in a bath; when it becomes dry, gently rub the affected joint with tempered friction, and reapply the warm compress three times, allowing it to rest on the joint for a brief period between each application.
corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denolam intrament de banh, entro que sia linit.	Corruption has already spread in the inner part of the nail, before it has been trimmed.
E si voles, pausa sobre aquela fenda de vaca humida e scalfada am boder e stren sobre aquel; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas, quar aquela es humida e reduzeys a la sua disposicio.	And if desired, place the affected area over a warm and moist cow's wound with a bandage and strong pressure, doing this several times, as it is moist and helps restore its normal condition.
Capitol .xxviii.	Chapter 28.
De curacio de dislocacio de malassen, so es de la junctura que es entre·l bras e la ma.	Chapter 28: Treatment of Dislocation of the Wrist Joint
Malassen de la ma alcunas vetz es deslocada, e la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es leugiera, e·l contrari es de las autras juncturas, mays empero cove que sia velocitat en la reduccio de lu en la hora en la qual es deslocada, denant que le loc sia apostemat o que accida en lu apostema caut.	"The wrist is dislocated sometimes, and reducing the displacement of it is easy, but the contrary is true for other joints. However, it is crucial to act quickly in reducing it in the hour it becomes dislocated, before the location becomes inflamed or infected with pus."
E la reduccio de la dislocacio de lu es que tu pauses la junctura de la ma del malaute sobre una taula e le ministre extenda la ma de aquel, e le metge pause la sua ma o o la sua palma sobre la iminencia de la junctura, e empellisca aquela entro que retorne al sieu loc.	"And reducing the dislocation is done by placing the patient's joint on a table and having them extend their arm. Then, place your hand or their palm over the affected area and push gently until it returns to its proper location."
Mays empero cove que sia considerat si la palma ja es ostada al ventre de la ma, lahoras le malaute pause le dos de la sua ma sobre una taula deves la extencio e la reduccio; e si la dislocacio es precedent deves le dos de la ma, lahoras sia la posicio de la ma de aquel intrinicequement sobre la taula, per so que la ma del metge caja sobre aquela iminencia de la junctura.	"However, one must consider if the palm is facing the stomach of the arm, then have the patient place the back of their arm on a table for extension and reduction. And if the dislocation is on the back of the arm, then position the patient's arm flat on the table, allowing the doctor's hand to be placed over the affected area."
E donc si retorna tantost, bon es; e sino, lahoras strenh aquela am empastre cedant le apostema e layssa aquel; e no iteres aquo, quar sino, no soferta ni no podes sobre la reduccio de lu pus que passan a lu dias.	"And if it returns quickly, that is good. But if not, then strengthen the area with a plaster to draw out any infection and leave it alone. Do not repeat this, as further attempts at reduction will only cause more pain and possibly lead to infection."
Mays empero la junctura roman segon la sua tortuositat; e no notz al malaute alcuna causa, sino que la ma es mollificada e no pot strenher alcuna causa; lahoras sapias que les nervis son trincatz o trissatz, e lahoras no es engen en lu sino que sia strenhuda am cauteri prop le cazament de lu e fort leu aquo confereys alcuna causa.	"However, if the joint remains dislocated due to its twisted state, and the patient feels no cause for it, but their limb is weakened and unable to be strengthened, then know that the nerves are compressed or trapped. In this case, do not force the reduction, but instead apply a heated cautery to release the compression and gently attempt reduction again."
Donc cum malassem es retornada, lahoras pausa sobre lu empastre le qual havem recomtat, e sia layssat e strenhut per v dias; e aprop sia desliat e sia layssat e la ma de lu sia excercitada.	"Once the dislocation has been reduced, place an herbal plaster over it as recommended and leave it on for 5 days to heal. Afterwards, remove the plaster and begin exercising the limb again."
Mays si le movement de lu es ostat e accideys en lu alcuna gravitat, lahoras leniys aquela am aygua cauda e am fricacio alcunas veguadas, entro que sia alleujat.	"But if movement is hindered and there is serious swelling, then apply warm water with herbs and gently massage the area until it feels better."
Capitol .xxix.	Chapter 29.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels ditz.	"Of the healing of finger dislocations."
Alcunas veguadas so dislocatz les ditz a tota partida.	"Fingers can become dislocated in many places."[`](note: I'm assuming that 'veguadas' is a typo of 'vegades', which means 'times, occasions')
E quan es dislocat alcun dit de aquels al dos de la palma o al ventre de lu, lahoras sten le dit e impelleys la dislocacio de lu am les tieus pouses, entro que retorne.	"When a finger is dislocated on the back of the hand or the palm side, then straighten the finger and gently push it back into place using your thumbs until it returns to its normal position."
E aprop sostenta le cap del dit, e suspen aquel deves la part a la qual es dislocat, e layssa aquel per dos dias.	"And then support the finger's head and suspend it at the location of the dislocation, leaving it for two days."
E aprop suspen aquel e exten aquel entro que dreyt sia engualhat en aquel sieu dia.	"And then suspend and extend the finger until it is properly aligned in its place by the next day."
E quan sira noyt, lia aquel segon aquela narracio, e no cesses desliar aquel en le dia e exercitar am movement, e lia aquel en la noyt; e fay aquo per alcus dias entro que sia streyt.	"And when it is night, bind the finger according to its position and do not stop loosening it in the daytime and exercising with movements, and bind it at night. Do this for several days until it is strong."
E fay semblant am aquo, si es dislocat al ventre de la ma, e lia aquel ad aquela partida e fay am aquo la tieua primiera operacio, entro que sia sanat.	"Do the same if it is dislocated on the palm side of the hand and bind it to that area. Perform the first operation until it is healed."
E semblantment fay am aquo quan es dislocat a las autres partidas.	"Do the same when it is dislocated in other areas."
Capitol .xxx.	Chapter 30.
De la curacio de dislocacio dels spondils del dos.	"Of the healing of spinal dislocation in the back."
Quan accideys ad alcun dels spondils del dos o del col dislocacio complida, e so remaugutz motz spondils de lors locs, lahoras en aquela no es curacio, quar la mort se coyta al malaute.	"When there is a complete dislocation of one or more vertebrae in the back or neck, resulting in many vertebrae being out of place, then there is no cure for this, as death is imminent for the patient."
E senhal de aquo es que la egestio del malaute es fora-eyssida ses voluntat, e no pot retenir aquela; e motas veguadas so mollificatz alcus membres de lu o doas cambas de lu o dos brasses de lu, o un de aquels; o es remaugut un spondil de son loc, quar motas veguadas es remaugut e motas veguadas es fayta la remocio de aquels a quatre partidas.	"A sign of this is that the patient's bowel movements are involuntary and cannot be controlled, or certain limbs or sides of their body or one arm is weakened, or a vertebra is out of place. This results in many vertebrae being dislocated and moved to four directions."
Donc aquela ja es remauguda a las partidas detras e es nompnada gelbozitat.	"Therefore, it is dislocated in several directions and called gibbus."
Mays la curacio de lu es que lahoras consideras si la gelbozitat accidey de puerissia, quar lahoras en aquela no es curacio ni de aquela no es sanacio de tot.	"However, the treatment of it is that you should consider if the gibbus has occurred in childhood, because then there is no cure or complete healing from it."
Mays en aquela que ve per cazement o per percussio o per semblant ad aquels, ja diyssero les Antics las manieras de curacio am sermo prolixs, del qual lo mays retorna am profieyt; mays yeu ja e abreujat de aquel del qual lo pauc escusa del trop de lu, per la mieua propinquitat a la entencio mieua exposicio, am la qual he aquo expausat et format ex instrument divers de aquel am le qual mostrero aquo e espausero aquel.	"But in cases caused by trauma, shock or similar factors, the ancients have mentioned various methods of treatment in lengthy discourse, which are beneficial. However, I have summarized the essential parts to avoid unnecessary verbosity and present it in a clearer manner:
E dic que en gelbosita que accideys de la partida denant en le pietz, no es engen ni sanacio de aquela; e semblantment en aquela que es fayta a dos latz.	"I say that in gibbus which occurs at the front of the chest, there is no cure or healing for it; similarly, in cases where it forms on both sides."
E de aquelas no es curada sino aquela que accideys en le dos propriament am aquo que yeu recomti.	"And those types are not cured except for the one that occurs in the back directly, as I have recommended."
E es que·l malaute sia extendut sobre la sua cara sobre pug engual prop de paret, e sia extendut dejos lu esturment molh per so que no sia lidit le pietz de lu.	"And the patient should lie face-down on a plank placed near a wall, with enough space for them to be positioned between it and the instrument used for treatment."
E aprop un fust dreyt sia pausat, ficat en la terra en la extremitat del pug entorn le cap de lu, e autra fust en aviro les pes de lu en l’autra extremitat del pueg.	"Then place a straight rod under the patient's head and neck, supported by the floor at one end, and another rod beneath their legs, extending from the other end of the plank."
E·l ministre tengua le fust, e no sia fermat en fossa; e autre ministre tengua l’autre segon aquela forma.	"And let one practitioner hold the rod and not be fixed in a hole, and another practitioner hold the other one according to that form."
E aprop envolopa sobre le cap del malaute e dejos les titillic liamen leon ferm; e exten la extremitat del liamel al fust le qual es deves le cap de lu, e lia aquel en lu; e aprop strenh l’autre liament sobre las ancas de lu les denols de lu, e deves las cambas de lu; e aprop ajusta totz les liamentz e lia aquels en l’autre fust le qual es deves les pes de lu.	"Then wrap a bandage around the patient's head and tie it tightly but not too tight, and attach one end of the band to the rod that is near their head. Tighten the other band around their hips, knees, and legs, adjusting all the bands so they are taut, and attach them to the rod that is near their feet."
E aprop le ministre cascu extenda le liament a la partida del fust, e no sian remaugutz les dos fustz e les liamentz dels sieus locs en les quals son ficatz, mays empero no so fermatz ayssi cum havem dit.	"Then let each practitioner pull the bandage taut at either end of the rod, ensuring that both rods and the bands in their positions are not dislodged, but do not fix them as we said before."
E le metge pause las suas palmas sobre le spondil am fortaleza entro que retorne, o que pause sobre aquela una taula, e aprop que ajuste sobre la taula les sieus pes entro que retorne.	"And the physician places their hands on the vertebra with strength until it returns to its place, or they place a board on top of it and then adjust their weight onto the board until it returns."
Mays si no retorna per aquesta forma, lahoras pren una taula de la qual la latitut o la longitut sia en aviro de tres brassas, e cava en la paret de la qual havem dit que es prop le malaute un loc en le qual intre la extremitat de la taula.	"But if it does not return by this method, then take a table that is three cubits in length or width and carve out a space in the wall near the patient where the end of the table can fit."
E aprop pausa la maytat de la taula sobre le spondilh, e·l metge pause les sieus pes sobre l’autre extremitat, e estrenha be entro que le spondil sia coartat e que retorne al sieu loc.	"And then place the weight of the table on the vertebrae and have the physician put their weight on the other end, pushing hard until the vertebrae are constricted and return to their proper position."
E si tu voles, obre am torn le qual es revolvut am la ma; e es que tu fiques en terra deves le cap del malaute en le derier del pug dos fustz, la longitut dels quals sia d’un bras, e deves le cap de lu en le derier del pug eyssament dos fustz; e sia la longitut que es entre quascun fust un palm, e ja es fayt en quascun fust trauc en le qual corr torn, e quascun sia mot fermat en terra per so que no sia maugut.	"And if you want, open it with a screw that is rotated by hand; and this means that you place two rods in the ground on either side of the patient's head, one on each side, and each rod should be one cubit long. And there should be a space between each rod that is equal to the width of a palm, and each rod should have a hole drilled through its center that corresponds to the threaded screw. The screw should be firmly attached to the ground so that it does not move."
E sia mes un fust redon en le qual es le torn, e sia revolvut en les dos traucs dels dos fustz.	"And let there be a round rod with the screw on both ends, and it should turn in both holes of the two rods."
E en la extremitat de lu es un trauc en le qual es format le fust, la longueza del qual es un palm am aquo que es revolvut; e en les dos autres fustz es semblant de aquel.	"And at one end of it is a hole in which the rod is formed, with a length of one palm and a screw that turns. And on the other two rods, it is similar to this."
E aprop strenh les liamentz que has streyt en le pietz del malaute en le trau le qual es deves le cap de lu, e les liamentz que has streyts en las coyssas de lu en le torn le qual es deves les pes de lu.	"Then tighten the straps that you have fastened at the patient's feet in the hole near their head and the straps that you have fastened at their hips in the screw near their feet."
E aprop deves quascun torn e stia un ministre que torssa le torn am la sua ma, e le metge engualhe le spondil segon que havem dit.	"And let there be someone at each screw who turns it with their hand and adjusts the vertebrae as we have said."
E aquesta es la forma del torn:	"And this is the form of the screw:"
E aprop pus que le spondil es retornat, e le loc es engualhat, lahoras cove que pauses empastre exciccatiu am album de huou, e aprop estopa; e aprop pause sobre le empastre astela de taula de la qual la latitut sia de tres ditz o enviro aquels, e la longitut de lu sia quantitat que prengua le loc de la gelbositat, e sobre la partida del spondil sa.	"And after the vertebra has been returned and the location is healed, it is necessary to apply a dry plaster with albumen from eggs, and also cotton wool. Then place a piece of wooden board on top of the plaster that is three fingers wide or thereabouts, and its length should be enough to cover the area of the gibbosity and placed over the part where the vertebra sits."
E aprop sia liat am liament le qual havem dit, e uze le malaute de nutriment subtil entro que sia sanat.	"And then it should be bound with a bandage that we mentioned before, and the patient should take subtle nutrition until they are healed."
E si roman alcuna iminencia en le loc en la fi de la sanacio, lahoras cove que sian aministradas medicinas que moilifico e liniscan am aministracio de la taula per lonc temps, la qual havem recomtada; e ja es aministrada en aquel loc lamina de plom.	"And if any prominence remains in the location at the end of healing, then it is necessary to administer medicines that soften and clean with long-term administration of the tablets we recommended; and a sheet of lead has already been administered to that location."
E alcunas veguadas accideys imminencia en le derier dels spondils del dos, e es cujat per aquela dislocacio; e es aquel os le qual ja imineys per que no cove que sia fayta prosompcio a lu am aquesta medicina, quar fort leu fara a tu accidir mort.	And sometimes an emergency occurs in the vertebrae of the spine of the back, and it is caused by such a dislocation; and this bone is the one that protrudes so that it is not necessary to apply a cure-all medicine to it, because it will easily cause death.
Capitol .xxxi.	Chapter 21.
De curacio de anca dislocada.	On the treatment of a dislocated hip.
Sapias que la junctura del ancha e la junctura del muscle no endeve sino dislocacio tant solament, e no accideys ad aquelas aquo que accideys a las autras juncturas de petita remocio e concavitat.	Know that the joint of the hip and the joint of the muscle only involve dislocation, and do not involve what happens with other joints of small displacement and concavity.
E la junctura de la ancha es dislocada segon quatre manieyras, quar es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, o a las partidas defora, o a las partidas denant, o a las partidas detras.	And the hip joint can be dislocated in four ways: it can be dislocated inwardly, outwardly, forward, or backward.
E majorment es dislocada a las partidas dedintz, e pauc a las partidas denant o a las partidas detras.	And most commonly, it is dislocated inwardly, and rarely forward or backward.
E senhal de la dislocacio de lu a las partidas de dintz es quar, quan tu ajustas la camba del malaute sana am la malaute, es pus longua e·l denolh es pus heminent que de la sana, e·l malaute no pot doblar le sieu pe deves le lenguonar, e es le loc que siec le lengonar apostemat de apostema caut, per so que·l cap de la coyssa ja es pervengut aqui.	And the sign of a dislocation inwardly is that when you place the healthy leg next to the affected leg, the latter appears longer and more prominent than the former, and the patient cannot bend their knee without pain, which indicates that the swelling caused by an abscess has reached the area where the thigh joins the hip.
E·l senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio es a las partidas defora, es que les accidentz de lu so contraris ad aquest accident.	And the sign of someone who experiences a dislocation outwardly is that their symptoms are the opposite of those described above.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas denant es quar expan la camba sieua segon compliment, mays empero no dobla aquela ses dolor que es en le denol, e si se perforsa ad anar e no pot sobre aquo a las partidas denant; e la urina de lu es retenguda e l’engonar de lu es apostemat, e deves la ambulacio de lu sobre le talo.	And the sign of someone who experiences a dislocation forward is that they extend their leg fully but are unable to bend it due to pain, and if they try to walk, they cannot do so because of discomfort in the front part of their hip; their urine may be retained and there may be swelling in the affected area, and they should be made to walk on their toes.
E senhal de aquel al qual accideys dislocacio a las partidas detras es que no expande le denol, ni no puesca doblar aquel denant que doble le engonar, e la camba de lu es pus breva que l’autra, e l’engonar es mollificat, e·l cap de la coyssa es deves aquel loc.	And the sign of someone who experiences a dislocation backward is that they cannot extend their knee or bend it without also bending their thigh, and their leg appears shorter than the other, with a softened and swollen area at the site where the hip meets the thigh.
Mays reduccio de las specias de aquesta dislocacio es que tu consideras, lahoras, si la dislocacio es vetusta et antiqua, que ja es anticada am le havent aquela aprop tu aministras reduccio de lu e roman segon la sua disposicio, lahoras no es en aquela curacio de tot; e adonc no cove que en aquela sia fayta prosompcio.	But the reduction of dislocations depends on whether it is old or new. If it is an old and chronic dislocation, then you should apply a reduction treatment based on its specific condition. However, if it is not possible to reduce it, then you should avoid applying any cure-all medicine.
Mays en aquel del qual la dislocacio es recent, e es una de las quatre specias de dislocacio, lahoras te coyta ad aquo que volvas la junctura e extendas aquela a las partidas dedintz e a las partidas defora, e mau aquela a la dextra e sinistra, quar fort leu retorna e no indigeys de autra cura.	But in the case of someone with a recent dislocation, which is one of the four types, you should consider returning the joint to its normal position by extending it outwardly and inwardly, then moving it to the right and left, because it will easily return to its normal position without requiring any further treatment.
Mays, si no retorna en aquesta manieyra, lahoras cove que tu prepares ministre fort e extendas la camba de lu de la partida pus dejos, o am las suas mas, o am liament lo qual es liat sobre la camba desus le denol; e autre ministre extenda la ma de aquel desus enayssi que meta las suas mas dejos les titillics de lu; e aprop strenha am liament leon sobre la razit de la coyssa, e tengua autre ministre ters le extremitat del liament.	But if it does not return to its normal position in this way, then you should prepare the following equipment: extend the patient's leg downward or upward using a bandage tied around their thigh or knee; have another person place their hand on top of the affected area and press down gently on the tendons below the kneecap; apply strong pressure with a bandage tied tightly around the hip joint, and have another person hold the free end of the bandage firmly.
E sia extencio de lu o de la partida dedintz a l’angonar a la partida de la furcula, o de la partida detras a la partida del dos.	And this extension involves stretching the affected area toward the shinbone or the back part of the hip toward the spine.
E sia la extencio de totz aquels en una veguada entro que·l malaute sia elevat am le sieu cos de terra e que romangua pendent.	And this extension involves lifting the patient's entire body off the ground and suspending them in the air using their own strength.
E aquesta specia de extencio es specia cominal a totas quatre.	And this type of extension is common to all four types of dislocations.
E donc si la dislocacio retorna am aquo que havem dit, sira bo; e sino, lahoras es necessari a tota specia aquo que dire de la propria curacio.	And so if the dislocation returns with the method we described, that will be good. But if not, then you should consider specific treatments for each type of dislocation.
En la reduccio de lu propria, quan es dislocada, e la dislocacio es a las partidas dedintz, cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre le sieu latz sa; e aprop pausa les liamentz sobre la razit de la coyssa en aquel loc le qual entre le cap de la coyssa e·l loc que es dejos le langonar; e aprop exten le liament en sus de la part del angonar a la pus auta partida de la furcula.	In reducing a dislocation inwardly, it is necessary for the patient to lie on their side and place a bandage over the hip joint at the point where the thigh meets the hip, between the top of the thighbone and the area below the kneecap. Then, apply strong pressure with a bandage tied around the upper part of the shinbone, starting from the ankle and moving upwards towards the knee.
E aprop autre ministre fort prengua les brasses de lu, e amerme le loc gros de la coyssa malaute e extenda a las partidas deforo per extencio vehement, quar aquela retorna en le sieu loc.	And have another person strongly grip the patient's arms and pull them outward while applying strong pressure to the affected side of the hip, extending it forcefully, because this will cause the dislocation to return to its normal position.
E aquesta specia es de pus leugiera curacio am la qual aquest membre es reduzit que las autres specias.	And this type of reduction is easier than the others for reducing this limb.
Mays si es excusat sobre tu e no obezeys al entrament am aquesta specia de curacio de tot, lahoras cove que sian liatz les dos pes del malaute ensemps am liament fort, leugier, sobre amdos les talos e amdos les denols.	But if the patient resists and does not comply with this type of treatment, then you should tie both their legs together firmly using a bandage around their ankles and calves.
E sia la longitut de quascun de son par la quantitat de quatre ditz, e sia la camba malaute extenduda mays que l’autre per quantitat de dos ditz.	And each of the patient's legs should be four finger-widths long, and the affected leg should be extended more than the other by two finger-widths.
E aprop le malaute sia suspendut sobre le cap del fust, e que sia en la mayso; e sia la longitut de lu de la terra la quantitat de dos brasses.	And have the patient suspended from the top of a post, with their body facing upward, and at a height of two arm-lengths from the ground.
E aprop comanda a un jove fort que minuesca le cap de la coyssa, e sia suspendut am le malaute autre jove, e l’autre jove minuent la coysa am fortaleza empellesca, quar la junctura retorna al sieu loc am velocitat.	And command a strong young person to push down on the patient's hip while another person holds onto the patient and pushes their hip with great force, causing the joint to return to its normal position quickly.
Mays en la reducio propria, quan es dislocacio a la partida defora, cove que·l malaute jaga sobre pug segon que havem recomtat en le havent gelbozitat; e sia strenhut le liament sobre la camba malauta propriament e sobre le pietz de lu.	But in reducing a dislocation outwardly, it is necessary for the patient to sit on a stool as we recommended after heating the area, and then apply strong pressure with a bandage tied around the affected thigh and ankle.
E aprop dos fustz sian pausatz, la un als pes de lu, e l’autre al cap; e aprop sian pausatz fustz ajustatz al mieg del pueg ficat sobre·l qual draps humitz sian envolopatz, per so que·l malaute no sia dampnajat per que·l fust sia entre las coyssas de lu, per que deves la extencio a las partidas dejos no sia atirat.	And have two posts placed on either side of the patient: one under their feet and the other at their head. Also place a post in the middle of the stool on which a heated cloth is wrapped, so that the patient does not suffer from discomfort caused by the post between their legs, and the extension of the leg downward is not hindered.
E aprop quascun ministre extenda a la sua part, e·l metge am la sua ma enguala la reduccio segon l’art.	And have each person extend their respective area, and the doctor use their hand to guide the reduction according to medical art.
Donc, si obezeys a revercio, sira bo grandament; e sino, pausa sobre aquela diligentment e ayssi quo havem dit en gelbozitat per aquela engualment.	And so if the patient complies and follows the instructions, it will be good. But if not, then apply strong pressure forcefully, as we recommended earlier during heating, to guide the reduction.
Mays cove que·l malaute jagua sobre les sieus latz sa quetament.	And it is necessary for the patient to lie on their side calmly and quietly.
E quan la dislocacio es a las partidas denant, lahoras cove que la camba sia extenduda leugierament, e es segon aquesta meteyssa narracio sobre pueg; e le metge pause la palma de la sua ma dreyta sobre·l langonar malaute, e aprop coarte aquel am l’autra ma, e am aquela coartacio pausa aquel extendut a las partidas dejos a la partida del denol.	And when the dislocation is in front, then it is necessary to extend the leg slightly and place the patient on a stool as we described earlier. Then, place the palm of your right hand on the kneecap of the affected leg and use your left hand to press down firmly on the area above the ankle, causing it to move towards the knee.
E si la dislocacio es a las partidas detras, lahoras no cove que·l malaute sia extendut a las partidas dejos, e es elevat sobre la terra; habantz cove que sia pausat sobre causa dura, ayssi cum cove le eyssament si l’ancha de lu es dislocada a las partidas defora, segon aquo que havem dit del jasement de lu sobre dos anchas; e es sobre la sua cara e les liamentz sian extendutz, segon que havem dit, no ha guayre.	And if the dislocation is at the back, then it is not necessary to extend the leg downward and the patient should be elevated off the ground. It is necessary for them to lie on a firm surface, as we recommended earlier when describing how to place the patient in a standing position if their hip is dislocated outwardly, according to what we said about supporting their leg with two wide boards. The legs should be extended and placed on a firm surface, as we described earlier.
E cove que sia aministrada compressio am taula sobre le loc al qual yeys la junctura.	And it is necessary to apply pressure using a board on the area where the joint protrudes.
Donc cum la reducio es complida segon que cove — e·l senhal de la reduccio de lu no es amaguat a tu, e es que tu extendas del malaute doas cambas, e quan tu vezes aquelas enguals e le malaute extrenh la sieua camba e expandeys aquela ses excusacio, lahoras sapias que·l membre segon que cove es retornat — e lahoras tu ajusta doas coyssas e pausa empastre e extrenh am benda ayssi que la ancha no sia mauguda en alcuna de las partidas; e adheresca le malaute a repaus per tres dias o per quatre.	And so when the reduction is complete, as necessary - and you will know that it is successful if you see that the patient's legs are extended equally and they can move their affected leg without difficulty, indicating that it has returned to its normal position - then bring the patient's knees together and apply a paste and bandage, ensuring that the hip joint is not damaged in any way. Have the patient rest for three or four days.
E aprop deslia le liament e l’empastre, e compara la una camba am l’autra.	And then remove the bandage and paste, and compare one leg with the other.
Lahoras, si vezas aquelas enguals en vustament, lahoras sapias que la dislocacio ja es fermada, e adonc layssa le malaute anar.	And so if you see that the legs are equal in length and movement, then you can be sure that the dislocation has been successfully reduced, and you can allow the patient to walk again.
E si vezas alcuna causa de mollificacio, lahoras tu retorna e emplastra aquel, e extrenh aquel segon la tua primiera strectura, e layssa aquel en tres dias.	And if you notice any swelling or softness, then reapply the bandage and paste, and extend the leg again as before, allowing it to rest for three days.
E aprop deslia aquel, e fay aquel tardar en ambulacio sobre quascu per alcus dias, entro que sia confortat.	And then remove the bandage and allow the patient to walk slowly after several days, until they are fully recovered.
Capitol .xxxii.	Chapter 32.
De curacio de dislocacio del denolh.	On the treatment of knee dislocation.
Le denolh es dislocat segon tres manieyras, quar es dislocat a las partidas defora, e a las partidas dedintz, e a las partidas dejos mays a las partidas detras; e a las partidas denant no es dislocat.	The dislocation happens in three ways: it can occur in the outer parts, in the inner parts, and in the lower parts, that is, the back parts; but it does not occur in the front parts.
E le senhal de dislocacio de lu es que comandes al malaute que aplique la sua camba am la coyssa; lahoras sapias que·l denol es dislocat.	And the sign of a dislocation is that you should command the patient to bend their leg towards the thigh; if they are unable to do so, then you know that the joint is dislocated.
E la restauracio de totas las manieyras de lu es que fassas cezer le malaute dreyt, enayssi que ja extenda la sieua camba, si pot sobre aquo; adherir le tieu dos a la cara de lu, e pausa le pe de lu entre les tieus pes; e aprop fay adherir le denol de lu am las tuas palmas, e rete aquelas entre les tieus ditz sobre le denolh de lu am fortaleza, e autre ministre extenda le sieu pe entro que·l denol retorne a son loc.	And the restoration of all types of dislocations is done by having the patient lie straight, so that they can extend their leg if possible; place your fingers on the affected joint and hold the patient's foot between yours; then apply pressure with both palms to reduce the dislocation while a helper extends the patient's limb back into its original position.
E senhal de reddicio de lu es que la sua camba adharesca am la coyssa am levitat no-laboroza.	And the sign of a successful reduction is that the patient's leg will easily adhere to their thigh without pain or discomfort.
E aprop emplastra aquel e fay adhirir la camba am la coyssa, e aprop lia aquelas emsemps am una benda per tres dias o per quatre, e aprop deslia aquelas.	And then apply a dressing on it and have the patient keep their leg adhered to their thigh for three or four days; then remove the bandages.
E no uze le malaute de ambulacio per alcus dias, entro que sia sanat e cofortat.	And have the patient avoid walking for a few days until they are healed and comfortable.
Mays si la reduccio de lu a tu es excusada, lahoras aministra fort extencio am liamentz dels quals en la curacio de la hancha precedit narracio.	But if reduction is not possible for you, then administer vigorous stretching and manipulation as described in the previous narrative on hip surgery.
Capitol .xxxiii.	Chapter 33.
De la curacio de la dislocacio del talo.	On the treatment of ankle dislocation.
Le talo alcunas veguadas es remaugut per petita remocio, e alcunas veguadas es dislocat segon compliment, e la dislocacio de lu es fayta o a las partidas dedintz o a las partidas deforo.	Sometimes the ankle is sprained due to minor trauma, and sometimes it is dislocated in full or partially, which can happen either on the inner or outer side of the joint.
E le senhal de la dislocacio de lu es que vezes le talo imflat procedent a la partida a la qual es dislocat.	And the sign of a dislocation is that you see the toe swollen, proceeding in the direction of the part it is dislocated to.
Mays la curacio de la remocio de lu es de leugiera reddicio, e es que sia extendut am facilitat am las mas e sia engualhat entro que retorne.	But the treatment for reducing a dislocation is relatively easy, and that is to gently stretch it with your hands and cover it so that it returns (to its proper position).
Mays en la curacio de lu quan es dislocat segon compliment, cove que fasses cezer le malaute dreyt, e tengua aquel un ministre fort e valent de la partida detras del dos de aquel en le mieg loc de lu.	But in the treatment of a dislocation, when it is dislocated according to its nature, you must make the patient sit up straight, and have a strong and capable servant stand behind them at their side, in the middle where they are dislocated.
E aprop te tu am la tieua ma dreyta le pe de la pus sobirana part, e am la tua ma sinistra de la part pus dejos del pe en le loc de la cavilha.	And then you place your right hand on the upper part of the leg and your left hand on the lower part of the leg at the level of the ankle.
E aprop atira le pe a tu am la tua ma dreyta, e aprop am la sinistra per dos veguadas, e aprop exten am la sinistra; e empelleys le pietz del pe am la dreyta deves la camba ses trebalh.	And then pull the leg towards you with your right hand and push it twice with your left hand, and stretch it out with your left hand; and press the heel of the foot with your right hand against the thigh without working too hard.
E fay aquo doas veguadas segon que havem comtat.	And do that two times as we have said.
E aprop empelleys le pietz del pe a la camba la tersa veguada, e tu es a la cavilha.	And then press the heel of the foot against the thigh for the third time and you are at the ankle.
Donc si retorna en una veguada o en dos segon aquesta manieyra, e si vezes le pe engualhat, es bo; e sino, lahoras sobre lu itera la operacio, quar aquel retorna.	So if it returns in one or two times according to this method, and you see that the foot is swollen, that's good; but if not, then repeat the operation, because it will return (to its proper position).
Mays si a tu es prohibida la reduccio de lu am aquo que havem recomtat, lahoras fay jaser le malaute sobre le sieu dos sobre terra, e estrenh un paysel mot en terra fermat, e que caja entre las coyssas de lu, e tu ja has envolopat sobre lu drap per so que no ledesca le malaute.	But if you are prohibited from reducing it according to what we have recommended, then make the patient lie on their back on the ground and place a strong board under them, which fits between their thighs, and you have already covered them with a blanket so that they do not get cold.
E aprop le ministre de lu tengua las suas coyssas, e aprop autre ministre extenda le pe am las suas mas o am liament que lie sobre le col del pe; e aprop extenda aquel quascun ministre contre extencio del sieu par, e le payssel sia extant entre las coyssas del malaute retinent aquel, per so que·l cos de lu no sia atirat a las partidas dejos deves la sua extencio.	And have the servant of the patient hold their thighs and have another servant stretch the leg with their hands or use a lever to lift it; and have each servant pull against the extension on their side, and the board should be placed between the patient's thighs holding them apart, so that the patient's body does not move downwards with the extension.
E aprop le metge enguala la dislocacio am las sieuas mas, e autre ministre tengua la coyssa sana a las partidas dejos, quar la dislocacio retorna am la facilitat.	And have the doctor cover the dislocation with their hands and another servant hold the healthy thigh downwards, because the dislocation will return easily.
E donc cum retorna la dislocacio e es declarada a tu la sanetat de la reduccio de lu, lahoras pausa emplastre e extrenh aquela am liamentz fortment, e ligua le pe am liament a la camba.	And when the dislocation has returned and you have declared that the reduction is successful, then apply an emplaster and use a strong bandage to wrap it, and bind the leg to the thigh.
E cove que temes o te guardes dels nervis les quals so detras sobre le talo, per que le liament sobre aquel no sia vehement e leda aquel fortment.	And you must be careful or cautious of the nerves which are located behind the ankle, because applying a bandage too forcefully over it may cause damage.
E aprop layssa aquel per dos dias o per tres; e si le liament es mollificat, extrenh aquel.	And leave that for two or three days; and if the bandage has softened, remove it.
E aprop deslia aquel en le ters dia o en le quart, e prohibeys le malaute de anament per xl dias.	And untie it on the third day or the fourth, and forbid the patient from moving for 40 days.
Mays si es forsat de anar denant aquel spazi, no es fayta segurtat que la dislocacio no sia sobre lu dissolvuda e corrumpuda, e aprop aquo que no recipia curacio.	But if they are forced to move before that time, it is not safe for the dislocation as it may become dissolved and corrupted, and furthermore, it will not receive treatment.
E si accideys a lu apostema caut, lahoras cove que tu aministre en la cedacio de lu aquo en lo qual precedic la nostra narracio, en autre loc de curacio e de embrocacio, entro que sia remauguda.	And if an abscess forms, then it is necessary to administer in the treatment of it what we have mentioned before in our narrative, in another location for treatment and incision, until it has matured.
Capitol .xxxiiii.	Chapter 34.
De curacio de dislocacio dels ditz dels pes.	Chapter 34: Treatment of dislocation of the toes.
Cove que aquel qu’es dislocat sia engualhat am pauca extencio ses trebal; e aquo que no es dificil, abantz es leugier.	It is necessary that the dislocated part be covered with a small amount of extension, but not too much, and this is not difficult to do, in fact it is easy.
Mays si la dislocacio es en alcus nozes del dos del pe, lahoras cove que fassas cezer le malaute le sieu pe sobre loc engual de la terra o sobre taula, e sia estant ayssi cum si anava.	But if the dislocation is in the joints of the ankle of the foot, then it is necessary to make the patient lie down with their leg extended on a level surface such as the ground or a table, and keep it in that position as if they were walking.
E aprop tu sta de pes, e pausa le tieu pe sobre aquo que imineys de las juncturas, e aprop calca aquel am le tieu pe am vertut entro que retorne, e que vejas aquel ja engualhat e no aparesca en le loc eminencia.	And then you stand with your weight on it, place your foot over the joints and press down with strength until it returns to its proper position and ensure that it is covered and not swollen in the affected area.
E aprop pausa dejos le ventre del pe de lu una taula que prengua tot le pe, a la qual sian dos caps, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent e ferma per tres dias; e aprop deslia aquel e fay aquel repausar de ambulacio per motz dias, entro que sia estrenhut e de reddicio sia assegurat.	And then place a board under the bottom of their foot which supports the entire leg, with two ends, and hold it in place with firm and steady support for three days; and then untie it and let them rest from walking for several days until it is healed and recovery is assured.
Capitol .xxxv.	Chapter 35.
De las specias de dislocacio que sian faytas am plagua o am fractura o am quascuna ensemps.	Chapter 35: Types of dislocation caused by plague, or fracture, or any combination of them.
Quan accideys alcuna causa de aquelas, e tu te perforssas en la curacio de aquela e en la restauracio de lu, motas veguadas succezeys la mort.	When any of those causes (plague or fracture) occur and you focus on the treatment and restoration of it, many times death will result. It is important to approach such cases with caution and humility, recognizing that there are some things beyond our control as medical practitioners. It is essential to do no harm, and sometimes that may mean referring the patient to a more experienced or specialized care provider, or simply providing comfort and support during their illness. It is also crucial to maintain good hygiene and sanitation practices in order to prevent the spread of infectious diseases like the plague.
E per aquo no cove que sobre la curacio de lu presuma, sino aquel que es savi en l’art, de lonc uzatge, misericordios e pietados, tardiu, no-ardit ni presomptuos; e que use en le comensament de medicinas que cedan apostemas cautz tant solament, e leyssa le malaute al divinal jutgament, sino ad aquel al qual speras salut de perdicio, am de la malautia alleviacio, e en la qual appareys alcuna speransa.	And so it is not advisable to be overconfident in the treatment of such cases, but rather a wise and experienced practitioner who is merciful and compassionate, slow to act, not hasty or arrogant, should use gentle medicines at first that only reduce abscesses, and leave the patient to divine judgement. But one should entrust oneself to the one in whom you hope for salvation from perdition, with alleviation of the illness, and in which there appears some hope. It is essential to have a humble attitude, recognizing the limits of human knowledge and expertise, and relying on divine guidance and grace in the healing process. The practitioner should also be cautious not to cause further harm or delay in seeking appropriate care for the patient, particularly in cases of serious illness or injury.
E adonc esforsa te tantost far de lu la reduccio en le comensament de la causa, denant que endevengua apostema caut.	And so make every effort to reduce the dislocation as soon as possible at the onset of the injury, before an abscess forms. This will increase the chances of successful treatment and reduce the risk of complications. The practitioner should be vigilant in monitoring the patient's progress and adjusting the treatment plan accordingly, seeking expert advice or consultation when necessary. It is important to maintain good communication with the patient and their family throughout the healing process, providing education and support as needed. Ultimately, the goal is to promote healing, alleviate suffering, and restore function to the affected area, with compassion and humility, recognizing that each patient is unique and deserving of individualized care and attention.
E adonc si le membre retorna segon que volem, lahoras aministra regiment le qual ceda apostema caut e cura la plagua am aquo que conveneys a lu dels enguentz desiccatius.	And so if the limb returns as we desire, then administer a regimen that reduces abscesses and treat the plague with drying agents that are appropriate for it. It is important to address any underlying infections or illnesses that may have contributed to the dislocation, using specific treatments and interventions based on the patient's individual needs and circumstances. The practitioner should be knowledgeable about various treatment options and able to make informed decisions about the most effective course of action for each case. This may involve consultation with other medical professionals or specialists, as well as ongoing monitoring and evaluation of the patient's progress. Ultimately, the goal is to promote healing, alleviate suffering, and restore function to the affected area, with compassion and humility, recognizing that each patient is unique and deserving of individualized care and attention.
E si dislocacio es am fractura e accideys en le os satagias separadas, lahoras tu perforsa le stement de lor, e fay en aquo so que havem dit en las malautias simplas de aquo que es precedit en les locz de aquels.	And if the dislocation is accompanied by a fracture and separate pieces of bone are involved, then you should align them first, and do what we have said in simple injuries that were mentioned before in their places. It is important to address any fractures or bone injuries as part of the treatment plan for a dislocation, using specific techniques and interventions based on the patient's individual needs and circumstances. The practitioner should be knowledgeable about various treatment options and able to make informed decisions about the most effective course of action for each case. This may involve consultation with other medical professionals or specialists, as well as ongoing monitoring and evaluation of the patient's progress. Ultimately, the goal is to promote healing, alleviate suffering, and restore function to the affected area, with compassion and humility, recognizing that each patient is unique and deserving of individualized care and attention.
E guarda e esquiva segon la tua vertut aquel del intrament en las vias de temor segon que a tu es precedida la mia predicacio; quar aquo es milhor a tu deves le tieu Creator, e mays permanent a la tua gloria, e mays saludos al tieu cos verays aquels en le tieu temps.	And take care and avoid as much as you can any internal harm in the veins or arteries according to your ability, following my warning; because this is better for you before your Creator, and more permanent for your glory, and truly beneficial for your body at the right time. The practitioner should be mindful of potential risks and complications associated with any medical intervention, and take all necessary precautions to minimize harm and promote healing. This includes following established guidelines and protocols for safe and effective treatment, as well as seeking ongoing education and training in order to stay current with best practices and emerging trends in the field. Ultimately, the practitioner should approach each case with a commitment to excellence and compassion, recognizing that every patient is unique and deserving of individualized care and attention.
Ayssi fineysso las paraulas de Albucasim perfieytament de las quals Dieus ne sia benezeyt.	Thus ends the words of Albucasis perfectly, may God bless him. This passage concludes the section on dislocations in the medieval medical treatise attributed to the renowned Andalusian physician and surgeon Abu al-Qasim Khalaf ibn Abbas al-Zahrawi, also known as Albucasis. The text reflects the author's deep understanding of anatomy, physiology, and pathology, as well as his extensive clinical experience in diagnosing and treating various medical conditions. The passage emphasizes the importance of careful observation, accurate diagnosis, and individualized treatment plans, based on a thorough assessment of each patient's unique needs and circumstances. The practitioner is encouraged to approach each case with humility, compassion, and a commitment to excellence, recognizing the limits of human knowledge and expertise, and relying on divine guidance and grace in the healing process.
Amen.	Yes, indeed. May God bless and guide all those who seek to heal and alleviate suffering, with wisdom, compassion, and humility. Amen.
